Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Information belongs to someone else
Consumer complaint narrative: For the past three years Ive been receiving numerous calls and emails from a collection agency asking about a XXXX XXXX bill that I owe for {$1000.00}. The agency is called I C System INC. Ive explained to them multiple times I never had a XXXX XXXX. Ive contacted XXXX several times to dispute this issue off my credit report and I tried disputing this issue on the XXXX website as well. However, nothing has changed but constant calls and emails from the collection company trying to force me to pay a bill that I never put in my name. On XX/XX/XXXX, of this year, I was denied for a home that I applied for due to having a this two fraudulent bills thats in the collections. Ive explained to them as well, I never applied for a credit card in my name and even explained this issue again to XXXX. This issue is holding me back from applying and being approved for a home and damaging my credit score. This issue has gone on for too long and something has to be done. I filed a complaint on the consumer complain.gov website. Also, the attached documents and a copy of my state ID ( front and back ) are uploaded now.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt was already discharged in bankruptcy and is no longer owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
To whom it may concern, On XX/XX/2024 I submitted a dispute to XXXX due to payment history errors/discreptencies. My credit report shows inaccurate dates of my vehicle reposession. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act I am wanting a removal of account due to inaccurate information. The dispute came back as " accurate '' ( was not resolved ) and the lender has failed to remove the account even after investigation. 

In addition to the discreptencies, I contacted my XXXX ( XXXX ) and requested a receipt of refund/payout to either myself or the lender due to loss. Unfortunately XXXX XXXX has failed to provide me with the requested information and has no records. My vehicle was a loss and I never received a letter by my GAP insurance of any payment to myself or the lender? 

This unfortunate circumstance has negatively impacted my credit drastically and would appreciate some assistance with this investigation for accurate information. I am attaching a screenshot of the discreptencies from the lender. 

Thank you for your time with helping me with this complaint.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative:
I needed to get a quick loan to handle unexpected bills. I went to maxlendXXXXXXXX  and was approved for a loan of {$1100.00}. I was told over the phone prior to accepting the loan that I would be charged for one payment of {$600.00} and two other payments of {$680.00} to payback the loan, bringing the total payback of said loan to {$1900.00} to pay it back. Already feeling that was way to much, I still accepted. Upon receipt of loan I was given paperwork outlining the terms. Since this was all done over the phone I was of the mindset ( my failure ) that the terms on the document was simply a recap as to what was discussed over the phone. 

I kept tabs on it for the first 3 months and paid no mind to it. It was only after making a subsequent payment I realized something was amiss. I then checked the documents that were sent and the document outlined that I was being charged a finance charge of {$4900.00} along with the amount financed of {$11000.00}. I was NEVER TOLD over the phone the finance change of {$4900.00} which along side the actual loan brought the total payback to {$6000.00}. It was incredibly misleading and when I contacted maxlend.com they told me they told me over the phone that I would need to make XXXX payments versus XXXX. From which I asked the service rep " who in the right mind would accept those terms? '' This organization needs to be flagged for the shaddy dealings and downright fraud. 

I had contacted the company maxlend.XXXX to stop payment which they stated they did but I would be contacted by a supervisor the following day and that I am still on the hook to pay the {$11000.00} which was incredibly confusing since its apparent what the service rep was looking at wasn't the same terms that were sent to me or they simply didn't care, in any event had I not seen another payment made outside of the XXXX payments told to me I would've been completely unaware of the situation. I have attached the document that was sent to me, which in itself is incredibly shady.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account information incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
To whom it may concern : I am contesting the information on my credit report that I believe is not correct. In accordance with the FCRA Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( l ) and in accordance with the accepted STANDARD of XXXX XXXX data field reporting. The information has not been proven to be true, correct, or verified.I can't recognize any allegations of wrongdoing without any factual proof. I challenge the reportability of any such claims. According to the federal and state laws that apply to me, you are required to report information accurately and completely.You should not keep or report anything that you know is not in compliance with the law or regulations.I am writing to let you know that you need to make sure everything in my credit report is accurate. This includes making sure that you adhere to all FCRA and XXXX XXXX format reporting standards. For every account that youre reporting, I need evidence ( physically verifiable ) that you verified the information to be accurate and compliant. For every inquiry I request proof that you confirmed that the creditor had a permissible purpose.I am giving you a month to investigate this matter and determine whether it is still accurate, valid and in compliance. If you can not provide proof that the information is accurate, compliant or valid I demand that you remove it from the report.I would also like for you to mail me physical proof of the actions you have taken to correct my credit report and a new updated report. This will help me stay updated on the progress you are making.The following items on my report appear questionable! Please certify that all claims are true and accurate, complete and timely reported. If not, please delete immediately. 
Below is a summary of the data in which I am challenging : Summary of Accounts being challenged in list form XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) - ( XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX - XXXX Experian Experian 2 Year Payment History 30 XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account # : XXXX XXXX Account Description : Individual Account Status : XXXX Open Account Type : XXXX Revolving Balance Owed : XXXX {$540.00} Credit Limit : XXXX {$500.00} Creditor Remarks : XXXX - Creditor Type : XXXX Credit Card Date Opened : XXXX XX/XX/2024 Date Reported : - XX/XX/2024 Date of Last Activity : XXXX XX/XX/2024 High Balance : XXXX {$560.00} Last Payment : XXXX XX/XX/2024 Past Due Amount : XXXX {$16.00} Payment Amount : XXXX {$0.00} Payment Status : XXXX Late 30 Days Term Length : XXXX XXXX Summary of Accounts being challenged in list form XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) - ( XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX - XXXX XXXX XXXX 2 Year Payment History XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account # : XXXX XXXX Account Description : Individual Account Status : XXXX Open Account Type : XXXX Revolving Balance Owed : XXXX {$540.00} Credit Limit : XXXX {$500.00} Creditor Remarks : XXXX - Creditor Type : - Credit Card Date Opened : XXXX XX/XX/2024 Date Reported : - XX/XX/2024 Date of Last Activity : XXXX XX/XX/2024 High Balance : XXXX {$560.00} Last Payment : XXXX XX/XX/2024 Past Due Amount : XXXX {$16.00} Payment Amount : XXXX {$0.00} Payment Status : XXXX Late 30 Days Term Length : XXXX XXXX The content mentioned above was never verified to meet reporting standards. The data preceding it was never verified to be accurate, complete, or up to date. I require any erroneous, incomplete, or unsupported inaccurate, unverifiable, and fraudulent : 30-Day Late Notation for XX/XX/2024, be deleted and removed expeditiously. 
Also, see the image above for XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX ( XXXX ). Ive highlighted and circled additional areas of concern. 
Viewing Date Opened ( XXXX ) demonstrating XX/XX/2024. You are in serious trouble if you can't provide proof that this account has been compliant with all current regulations! I need evidence to back up your claims. Show me how exactly does it meet these requirements? 
When I scrutinized Payment Status ( XXXX ) presenting Late 30 Days. The only thing that's more important than compliance is accuracy! Prove to me your information for this account has been fully vetted and meets all of federal law. I need you show proof or explain how it complies with XXXX XXXX standards When I scrutinized Date of Last Activity ( XXXX ) presenting XX/XX/2024. The information reported doesn't seem to meet the standards set by XXXX XXXX guidelines. You must make sure all fields are filled out correctly and in 100 % compliances prior adding anything onto my credit profile! Please remove this record of inaccurate, unverifiable, and fraudulent : 30-Day Late Notation for XX/XX/2024, from my report or provide proof of your compliance with applicable standards. 
In appreciation You are violating my rights! I have listed the concerns about your reporting in this document. It's not complete and does not meet my standards ; according to law, you must certify all aspects of required FCRAXXXX XXXX XXXX compliance which is done truthfully, correctly ( in a timely manner ), completely AND accurately as well - or else I would have to escalate these issues to the CFPB, FTC and my Attorney General. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Please send your written response to my address of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX # XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX. 
I am aware that you have been sending out form letters in response to many of the disputes and challenges that consumers have submitted, regardless of the specific information that they have provided. This is illegal, as each dispute and challenge must be addressed individually and on its own merits.My letters were created using software that is available to everyone. If you don't process my letters, you are violating 15 U.S. Code 5 1681i. Keep in mind, you are not allowed to delay processing letters from consumers based on the assumption that help from a third party may be available. This is not a legal exception.I am the author of any letters you receive with my name on them. Either I or my advisors wrote them with my full knowledge and consent. I am aware that there is no law that says you need to provide a Power of Attorney in order to delay processing letters from a consumer.If you do not process my letters in a timely manner, I will consider it to be an intentional disregard of my rights as a consumer. I will then contact my lawyer to take legal action. Your failure to comply with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and XXXX XXXX standards has caused significant harm to my creditworthiness and personal finances. I urge you to take immediate corrective action to avoid further legal repercussions. 
Statutory Violations and Legal Grounds I have identified multiple violations of the FCRA and other relevant statutes in your reporting practices. These include, but are not limited to : 1. 15 U.S. Code 1681n ( Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance ) : You have willfully failed to comply with the requirements imposed under this subchapter. This includes, but is not limited to, providing inaccurate information and failing to correct or delete unverifiable information. 
o Civil Liability : You are liable for any actual damages sustained by the consumer or damages of not less than {$100.00} and not more than {$1000.00}, punitive damages, and the costs of the action together with reasonable attorneys fees. 
2. 15 U.S. Code 1681o ( Civil Liability for Negligent Noncompliance ) : Your negligent noncompliance with the FCRA provisions has caused substantial harm to my credit score and financial standing.

o Civil Liability : Liability for actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of your failure.

3. 15 U.S. Code 1692k ( Civil Liability for Debt Collection Practices ) : Your actions constitute a breach of this statute, further compounding the legal violations in your reporting practices. 
4. 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2 ( Responsibilities of Furnishers of Information to Consumer Reporting Agencies ) : o Duty to Provide Accurate Information : Reporting information with actual knowledge of errors.

o Duty to Correct and Update Information : Ensuring that all reported information is accurate, complete, and up-to-date.

Specific Violations on My Consumer Report The following late payments reported by XXXX are inaccurate, unverifiable, and fraudulent : 30-Day Late Notation for XX/XX/2024.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a complaint against XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, Transunion, XXXX, and XXXX for inaccurate reporting of a charged-off debt, violations of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), the Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ), the Privacy Act of 1974, and the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ). 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX has reported a charged-off debt to Transunion, XXXX, and XXXX on my credit report. This is in violation of the FDCPA, which states that when an account is more than 180 days past due, it must generally be charged off. Despite being charged off, XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX has failed to provide me with a 1099-C form, as required by IRS code 4681. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX has violated the FCRA ( 15 US. .Code 1681s2 - Responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies ) by reporting inaccurate information to the credit bureaus. Specifically, they have reported the charged-off debt without having reasonable cause to believe that the information is accurate. This has severely affected my overall score and financial stability. 

XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX actions also violate the Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ) - 12 CFR 31.3 and the CFPA 's prohibition against unfair, deceptive, or abusive acts or practices. By continuing to report the charged-off account as a debt, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX is engaging in deceptive conduct that harms consumers ( Me ). 

Furthermore, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX has violated my rights under the Privacy Act of 1974. The Privacy Act of 1974, as amended, 5 U.S.C. 552a, establishes a code of fair information practices that governs the collection, maintenance, use, and dissemination of information about individuals that is maintained in systems of records by federal agencies. A system of records is a group of records under the control of an agency from which information is retrieved by the name of the individual or by some identifier assigned to the individual. The Privacy Act prohibits the disclosure of a record about an individual from a system of records absent the written consent of the individual, unless the disclosure is pursuant to one of twelve statutory exceptions. XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX improperly disclosed my personal information to credit reporting agencies, specifically Transunion, XXXX, and XXXX without my permission. 

Additionally, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX has violated the GLBA ( 15 U.S.C. 6802, also known as section 502 ( b ) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ) by failing to provide me with a clear and conspicuous notice of their intent to share my nonpublic personal information with nonaffiliated third parties, such as Transunion, XXXX, and XXXX. This coincides with 16 CFR 313.7 ( Form of opt out notice to consumers ; opt out methods ) 16 CFR 313.10 ( Limits on disclosure of non-public personal information to nonaffiliated third parties ) and 248.124 ( Reasonable opportunity to opt out ). 

Supporting Documentation : Credit Reports to Show Lack of Unison and Accurate Reporting Opt Out Letter to XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX that was ignored FDCPA Documentation concerning charge-off statuses Requested Relief : I request that the CFPB investigate this matter and take appropriate action against XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX Transunion, XXXX, and XXXX. I seek the removal of the inaccurate information from my credit report, as well as compensation deemed appropriate and upholding the law per violation committed.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I write to you with deep concern and dissatisfaction regarding the unauthorized inclusion of information in my consumer report, a clear violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681b. This letter serves as an official dispute, urging your agency to conduct an immediate and thorough investigation into this serious breach of my rights. 

Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX I am writing to dispute the accuracy of the information contained in my consumer credit report. Upon recent review, I have discovered entries that violate the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), particularly Section 611, which mandates the maximum possible accuracy of information in a consumer 's file.

Furthermore, the entries in question were reported without my written permission, contravening the requirements outlined in 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) of the FCRA. As such, I request an immediate, comprehensive, and impartial investigation into these entries. I expect a detailed response outlining the findings of this investigation, including the original written instructions from me ( Consumer ) with my wet signature.

Moreover, I am not aware of any legitimate purpose for reporting these late payments, and I affirm that I did not authorize the reporting of such information to your agency. Therefore, in accordance with Section 604 ( a ) ( 3 ) of the FCRA, I demand a thorough investigation into these disputed late payments, along with written confirmation of the investigation 's completion and details of any actions taken to rectify this matter.

Additionally, I request documentation, including the periodic statement and tracking number, to prove that each periodic statement was delivered to me at least 21 days before the payment due date, as mandated by 15 U.S. Code 1666b.

I request that you provide me with the name and address of the person ( s ) that you contacted to allegedly verify the information that I have rightfully disputed.

Failure to comply with the legal requirements outlined in this letter will necessitate pursuing all available legal remedies to address this violation of my rights under the FCRA. I trust that your agency will approach this matter with the urgency and seriousness it deserves.

FCRA Section 607 ( a ) ( 4 ) - Consumer Right to Privacy : You are continuing to report fraudulent accounts on my credit report that do not belong to me, which is a clear infringement upon my privacy rights. As I mentioned before, I have the sole authority to determine what information should be considered private. I insist that my hard inquiries and account information not be shared on my credit report. 

FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( 2 ) - Misleading False Reporting : The information you continue to report falsely suggests that I applied for multiple inquiries and accounts, when in reality, these were the result of a scammer\ 's actions. This misleading and unverified reporting is in direct violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and its fairness requirements.

FCRA Section 616 - Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance : Despite my previous dispute, you have failed to verify the accuracy of the credit information you have accepted, thereby demonstrating willful noncompliance. This non-compliance is subject to civil liability of up to {$1000.00} per violation.

FCRA Section 603 ( d ) ( 2 ) ( A ) - Obligations with Respect to Disclosures of Personal Information : You have yet to fulfill your obligation to disclose my right to opt out of sharing my personal information. This omission is deceptive and a direct violation of my consumer rights.

FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( 3 ) - Furnishing Deceptive Forms : Despite my previous dispute, you persist in furnishing inaccurate inquiries and accounts without proper validation, which potentially violates Generally Accepted Accounting Principles ( GAAP ). Reporting such deceptive information is unacceptable In addition to the aforementioned violations, I remind you of the previous violations outlined in my initial dispute letter, including the violation of Debt Collection Practices Act, Identity Theft Laws, Acquiring Location Information Regulations, Timely Payments Regulations, Finance Charge Determination, and Credit Report Permissible Purposes. These violations require your immediate attention and resolution.

In accordance with The Fair Credit Reporting Act, Public law 91-506, Title VI, Section 611, Subsection A-D, please provide the names and business addresses of each individual with whom you verified the above, so that I may follow up.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Re : Inaccurate Reporting and Violation of Fair Credit Reporting Act & XXXX XXXX To whom it may concern at XXXX XXXX TRANSUNION XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX : I just checked my credit and found some inaccuracies. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, Section 611 of FCRA you have a responsibility of promptly deleting any information which is inaccurate or incomplete so it doesn't get reported in my report! This is my understanding as well. It's important to note that under the FCRA, even if an account has only been speculated upon or never confirmed in any waythe burden falls on you ( the credit bureau ) to provide evidence of its veracity before it can be placed on my credit report. According to the FCRA Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( l ) and the accepted STANDARD of XXXX XXXX data field reporting, I have the right to dispute any information on my credit report that I believe is not correct. When it comes to my credit report, I reserve the right to dispute any information that I deem to be inaccurate. I won't stand for any misinformation being associated with my name and financial history. If there's something on my credit report that doesn't seem right, you can bet that I'll be taking action to get it removed.I can not recognize or accept the allegation of delinquency without factual proof. There must be some sort of evidence to back up the claim. 
Otherwise, I can not and will not recognize or accept the allegation. According to federal and state law, you must report any allegations with the greatest compliance and accuracy possible.You should not report any claims that you know or should know are not in compliance with regulations and the law. If you do report such claims, you could be subject to fines or other penalties. Furthermore, reporting claims that you know are not in compliance could damage the reputation of your company.I am writing to inform you that you need to make sure all your claims are factual and certified before reporting them. This is required by the XXXX XXXX reporting standard. I request that you provide evidence to support the existence of the account and evidence that the account was used for a permissible purpose. Please provide any documents or records you may have that can help corroborate the account and its permissible purpose.I am giving you 30 days to investigate the matter and determine whether it is still being reported accurately and in compliance with regulations. If it is not, I want it removed from the report.I hereby authorize you to take whatever steps are necessary to correct my credit. Please send me physical proof of any actions taken on my behalf. I appreciate your help in making sure my credit is in good standing.Further investigation is required to verify the following claims. These claims remain unverified until further inquiry can confirm them. More research is needed to support these unsubstantiated assertions. Please report any verified claims immediately. Please certify that all claims that have been verified as accurate, complete, and timely reported have been reported in compliance with regulations or remove & reverse late payments immediately. 
Below is a summary of the data in which I am challenging : Summary of Accounts being challenged in list form XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ) - ( XXXX ) XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX - XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Year Payment History XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Account # : XXXX XXXX Account Description : Individual Account Status : XXXX Open Account Type : XXXX Installment Balance Owed : XXXX {$XXXX} Credit Limit : XXXX {$XXXX} Creditor Remarks : XXXX - Creditor Type : XXXX XXXX Loan Date Opened : XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Date Reported : - XX/XX/XXXX Date of Last Activity : XXXX XX/XX/XXXX High Balance : XXXX {$XXXX} Last Payment : XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Past Due Amount : XXXX {$XXXX} Payment Amount : XXXX {$XXXX} Payment Status : XXXX Current Term Length : XXXX XXXX The information you provided is not accurate and does not meet the minimum standards for accuracy. I demand that this be fixed immediately or else legal action will ensue! Inaccurate, imperfect information has no place in your database or on my credit report so please delete it now. 
Also, see the image above for XXXX XXXX  ( XXXX ) XXXX ( XXXX ). Ive highlighted and circled additional areas of concern. 
Lets examine Term Length ( XXXX ) showing XXXX I bet you can't wait until I'm done with this account! The compliance standards are really important, and your reporting ability is clearly lacking. As we know from the news lately -- inaccurate credit records lead to higher interest rates on loans or even worse... Prove that all information for this particular account has been verified. 
When I scrutinized XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) presenting {$XXXX}. The information reported doesn't seem to meet the standards set by XXXX XXXX guidelines. You must make sure all fields are filled out correctly and in 100 % compliances prior adding anything onto my credit profile! Please remove this inaccurate record from my report or provide proof of your compliance with applicable standards. 
When I scrutinized XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) presenting {$XXXX}. Compliance with regulatory requirements is essential for accurate credit reporting! Prove to me that your information for this account has been fully vetted and meets all the standards of federal law, including but not limited XXXX XXXX standards. I need you show proof or explain how this account is compliant Lets take a look at Creditor Remarks ( XXXX ) reporting -. There may be a problem with the data reported because it doesn't meet the required standards. The data may not be accurate because it deviates from what is required. As you know You must report all Data fields in compliance with the XXXX XXXX standards. There can be no deviation from these requirements. 
I was looking at Date Reported ( - ) expressing XX/XX/XXXX. This is a formal complaint about the content of my report. It has come to my attention that you failed in following standard procedures for accuracy, and as such I question its validity if not fixed immediately. 
Regards You are not following the rules. I have listed all of my rights in this document so that they can be met accordingly, but it appears you do not care about fulfilling your obligations under Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) or XXXX XXXX law XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Please send your written response to my address of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX # XXXX XXXX, XXXX  XXXX, I am writing to inform you that I am aware of your illegal practices of sending form letters in response to disputes and challenges from consumers, regardless of the specific information that they have provided. This is in violation of 15 U.S. Code 5 1681i, which requires that each dispute and challenge must be addressed individually and on its own merits.My letters were created using software that is available to everyone. If you don't process my letters, you are violating my rights as a consumer. Consumer complaint narrative:
In going over my credit reports with the three credit bureaus I noticed that all three has my last name of XXXX. I have never had that last name nor do I know anyone with the last name of XXXX. This needs to be removed please. 

Second problem is I have been disputing XXXX XXXX with all three bureaus for three years. My accounts 1 business and two personal were closed by an in house mistak at XXXX XXXX that has never been repaired properly I do have an attorney and a suit will be filed if they cant get it right this time around. Those are not my XXXX  XXXX credit card numbers. I have never been sent them, activated them or used them. Yet they remain attached to my name. My three cards were paid off before the accounts were closed. In one of my disputes for XXXX Experian removed it off of my credit report Now its back on under a collection agency 's name I would like to exercise my 609 rule and ask that if these accounts cant not be verified as mine that they be removed altogether for all negative credit reporting. I do not own these accounts I have never signed for any of the them. I have signed for my three which were closed. 

As my credit is being cleaned up you can see that XXXX found out that I paid long ago and they removed the account but my credit used to be great and then the second XXXX XXXX closed all three my credit report an FICO went to XXXX overnight. This is not fair I need my credit cleaned because I have done nothing to deserve what XXXX XXXX is doing. 

There would be times when I had extra that I would make two payments in one day to my XXXX  XXXX cards or the next day I would pay again and they had already closed my three accounts in XX/XX/XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Experian, and XXXX are in violation of The Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act of 1974. FERPA, also known as the Buckley Amendment, is a federal law that protects the privacy of student education records. Key points of the law include : Ownership of Records : Students own their education records and have the right to inspect and review them.

Consent for Disclosure : Schools generally can not disclose personally identifiable information ( PII ) from student records without written consent. it prohibits educational institutions from disclosing personally identifiable information in education records without the written consent of the student, or, if the student is a minor, the student 's parents. ( 20 U.S.C.S. 1232g ( b ) ) .Schools may disclose, without consent, " directory '' information such as a student 's name, address, telephone number, date and place of birth, honors and awards, and dates of attendance. Transaction history is prohibited under this law, which covers the amount of the educational loan and payment methods or deferment. Their actions constitute unauthorized and illegal reporting of my educational records, specifically the transaction history, to consumer reporting agencies. This action by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX clear violation of the Family Education Rights and Privacy Act ( FERPA ) of 1974. The Family Education Rights and Privacy Act ( FERPA ) safeguards educational records, encompassing a wide array of information, including but not limited to grades, transcripts, disciplinary records, and personally identifiable information ( PII ) directly linked to a student. Transaction history pertinent to educational loans or financial matters, although not explicitly outlined in FERPA, falls squarely within the realm of protected information due to its direct association with the educational journey and financial status of the student. As custodians of these records, XXXX XXXX XXXX is bound by FERPA regulations. However, they have egregiously disregarded these regulations by reporting transaction histories to consumer reporting agencies without obtaining my explicit consent, thereby breaching the privacy rights guaranteed under FERPA. Moreover, the Privacy Act of 1974 supplements FERPA by regulating the collection, use, and dissemination of personal information by federal agencies. This act establishes stringent measures to ensure confidentiality, accuracy, relevance, and proper use of personal information. XXXX XXXX XXXX disclosure of my transaction history to consumer reporting agencies without my explicit consent constitutes a blatant violation not only of FERPA but also of the broader principles established under the Privacy Act of 1974. These actions compromise the confidentiality and privacy protections afforded to my educational records and personal information, resulting in tangible financial damages and emotional distress. Despite my attempts to rectify this matter directly with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX their failure to acknowledge or resolve the issue necessitates the intervention of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX 

XXXX XXXX XXXX actions also violate the Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ) - 12 CFR 31.3 and the CFPA 's prohibition against unfair, deceptive, or abusive acts or practices. By continuing to report the transaction history of my educational affairs, DEPT OF XXXX is engaging in deceptive conduct that harms consumers ( Me ). 

Furthermore XXXX XXXX XXXX has violated my rights under the Privacy Act of 1974. The Privacy Act of 1974, as amended, 5 U.S.C. 552a, establishes a code of fair information practices that governs the collection, maintenance, use, and dissemination of information about individuals that is maintained in systems of records by federal agencies. A system of records is a group of records under the control of an agency from which information is retrieved by the name of the individual or by some identifier assigned to the individual. The Privacy Act prohibits the disclosure of a record about an individual from a system of records absent the written consent of the individual, unless the disclosure is pursuant to one of twelve statutory exceptions. XXXX OF XXXX improperly disclosed my personal information to credit reporting agencies, specifically XXXX, Experian, and XXXX without XXXXy permission. 

Additionally, XXXX XXXX XXXX has violated the GLBA ( 15 U.S.C. 6802, also known as section 502 ( b ) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ) by failing to provide me with a clear and conspicuous notice of their intent to share my nonpublic personal information with nonaffiliated third parties, such as XXXX, Experian, and XXXX. This coincides with 16 CFR 313.7 ( Form of opt out notice to consumers ; opt out methods ) 16 CFR 313.10 ( Limits on disclosure of non-public personal information to nonaffiliated third parties ) and 248.124 ( Reasonable opportunity to opt out ). 

Supporting Documentation : Credit Reports to Show Lack of Unison and Accurate Reporting Opt Out Letter to XXXX XXXX XXXX  that was ignored I request that the CFPB investigate this matter and take appropriate action against XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Experian, and XXXX. I seek the removal of the inaccurate information from my credit report, as well as compensation deemed appropriate and upholding the law per violation committed.

In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681.

15 U.S.C 1681 section XXXX A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section XXXX A Section XXXX : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( XXXX ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than XXXX years. 

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( XXXX ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to bring to your attention certain inaccuracies on my credit report and to formally notify XXXX of potential legal violations that require immediate attention. 

Identification of Inaccuracies : Upon reviewing my credit report, I have identified several inaccuracies that have adversely affected my financial standing. These inaccuracies include : incorrect balance, late payments, account number, credit limit, date of reported and others inconsistencies. 

Impact on My Financial Well-being : The inaccuracies outlined above have severely affected my creditworthiness and overall financial health. In XX/XX/XXXX, I experienced a major financial setback due to a family emergency, which led me to apply for a personal loan with XXXX XXXX  and other creditors offered loans with significantly high interest rates and I have been wrongfully denied which was highly embarrassing and has negatively impacted my lifestyle. This misinformation has had a detrimental impact on my financial options and opportunities. Would you reinvestigate the accounts listed below. 

Account Name : XXXX  XXXX XXXX Number : XXXX Reinvestigate the completeness of every piece of information and if its not accurate, please remove it from my credit report. 

Reference to Relevant Laws : I believe that these inaccuracies violate consumer protection laws, including but not limited to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). The FCRA mandates accurate reporting and stipulates that consumers have the right to dispute and correct inaccuracies on their credit reports. 
Based of consumer law 15 U.S. Code 1681i - Procedure in case of disputed accuracy, if within 30 days you can not verify the accuracy of the information, please remove the account from my credit report. 

Request for Thorough Investigation : I kindly request that XXXX conducts a thorough investigation into the inaccuracies outlined above and takes immediate corrective action. I believe that rectifying these errors is crucial to maintaining the integrity of the credit reporting system and upholding consumer rights. 

Potential Legal Consequences : Please be advised that if these violations are not addressed promptly, I may be compelled to take legal action to protect my rights under the FCRA and other applicable laws. 

Optionally with the proof I am attaching to this letter, you will agree it needs to be removed XXXX. 

I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and request that you keep me informed of the progress of your investigation. You may reach me at XXXX XXXX to discuss this further. 

Thank you for your understanding and cooperation. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a complaint against XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax for inaccurate reporting of a charged-off debt, violations of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), the Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ), the Privacy Act of 1974, and the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ). 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX has reported a charged-off debt to XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax on my credit report. This is in violation of the FDCPA, which states that when an account is more than 180 days past due, it must generally be charged off. Despite being charged off, XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX has failed to provide me with a 1099-C form, as required by IRS code 4681. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX has violated the FCRA ( 15 US. .Code 1681s2 - Responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies ) by reporting inaccurate information to the credit bureaus. Specifically, they have reported the charged-off debt without having reasonable cause to believe that the information is accurate. This has severely affected my overall score and financial stability. 

XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX actions also violate the Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ) - 12 CFR 31.3 and the CFPA 's prohibition against unfair, deceptive, or abusive acts or practices. By continuing to report the charged-off account as a debt, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX is engaging in deceptive conduct that harms consumers ( Me ). 

Furthermore, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX has violated my rights under the Privacy Act of 1974. The Privacy Act of 1974, as amended, 5 U.S.C. 552a, establishes a code of fair information practices that governs the collection, maintenance, use, and dissemination of information about individuals that is maintained in systems of records by federal agencies. A system of records is a group of records under the control of an agency from which information is retrieved by the name of the individual or by some identifier assigned to the individual. The Privacy Act prohibits the disclosure of a record about an individual from a system of records absent the written consent of the individual, unless the disclosure is pursuant to one of twelve statutory exceptions. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX improperly disclosed my personal information to credit reporting agencies, specifically XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax without my permission. 

Additionally, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX has violated the GLBA ( 15 U.S.C. 6802, also known as section 502 ( b ) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ) by failing to provide me with a clear and conspicuous notice of their intent to share my nonpublic personal information with nonaffiliated third parties, such as XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax. This coincides with 16 CFR 313.7 ( Form of opt out notice to consumers ; opt out methods ) 16 CFR 313.10 ( Limits on disclosure of non-public personal information to nonaffiliated third parties ) and 248.124 ( Reasonable opportunity to opt out ). 

Supporting Documentation : Credit Reports to Show Lack of Unison and Accurate Reporting Opt Out Letter to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX that was ignored FDCPA Documentation concerning charge-off statuses Requested Relief : I request that the CFPB investigate this matter and take appropriate action against XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax. I seek the removal of the inaccurate information from my credit report, as well as compensation deemed appropriate and upholding the law per violation committed.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
NOTICE TO AGENT IS NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL IS NOTICE TO AGENT XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally notify you of inaccuracies in the information you have furnished to the consumer reporting agencies, namely Experian, XXXX, and XXXX XXXX The reporting of this inaccurate information has caused severe damage to my character, reputation, and general mode of living, as well as my ability to obtain credit for personal and housing purposes. Your inaccurate reporting has significantly harmed my livelihood. 
15 U.S. Code 1681s2 - Responsibilities of Furnishers of Information to Consumer Reporting Agencies ( a ) Duty of Furnishers of Information to Provide Accurate Information Prohibition ( A ) Reporting Information with Actual Knowledge of Errors As per 15 U.S.C. 1681s2, you are prohibited by law from furnishing any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if you know or have reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 
The IRS defines a charge-off as gross or ordinary income, which is not to be reported on a consumer report. This makes your reporting of this account inaccurate. The IRS clearly states that canceled debt or charge-offs are considered income. Therefore, reporting this account as a debt is inaccurate and a violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681s2, which states that as a furnisher of information to a consumer reporting agency, you are legally obligated to provide accurate information. 
You are hereby notified that you are furnishing incorrect and inaccurate information. 
IRS Requirement for Form 1099-C The IRS requires that a lender file Form 1099-C and send a copy to the borrower if the amount of debt canceled is {$600.00} or more, and the lender is a financial institution, credit union, federal government agency, or other applicable entity. As you have filed this account as a canceled debt, I demand that you send me my Form 1099-C, as required by law. 
Address for Correspondence : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX 15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( a ) Duty of Furnishers of Information to Provide Accurate Information Prohibition ( B ) Reporting Information After Notice and Confirmation of Errors A person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if : ( i ) The person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate ; and ( ii ) The information is, in fact, inaccurate. 
In conclusion, you have been put on notice that you are reporting inaccurate information. The information you have reported is, in fact, inaccurate. 
The continued reporting of this inaccurate information is a clear violation of 15 U.S.C.

1681s2, which outlines your responsibilities as a furnisher of information. Your negligence and inaccurate reporting have caused severe harm to me and my family. 
This letter serves as your final opportunity to correct this issue and delete the erroneous, inaccurate account from my consumer reports. 
You have 10 calendar days from the receipt of this notice to delete this account from my consumer reports. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX, GA XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX ; As I have not heard back from you in over 60 days regarding my notice of dispute dated XX/XX/year>, and you have not supplied the demanded proof of the alleged debt, under the doctrine of estoppel by silence, I may presume that no proof of the alleged debt, nor therefore any such debt, in fact exists. 

In a good faith effort to resolve this matter amicably, I restate my demand for proof of the debt, specifically the alleged contract or other instrument bearing my signature, as well as proof of your authority in this matter. Absent such proof, you must terminate this collection action and correct any erroneous reports of this debt as mine. 

For the record, I state again that as I have no account with you, nor am I your customer, nor have I entered into a contract with you, I must ask for the following information : Please evidence your authorization under 15 usc 1692 ( e ) and 15 usc 1692 ( f ) in this alleged matter.

What is your authorization of law for your collection of information?

What is your authorization of law for your collection of this alleged debt? Please evidence your authorization to do business or operate in the state of Texas. Please evidence proof of the alleged debt, including specifically the alleged contract or other instrument bearing my signature.

You have fifteen ( 15 ) days from receipt of this notice to respond. Your failure to respond, on point, in writing, hand signed, and in a timely manner, will work as a waiver to any and all of your claims in this matter, and will entitle me to presume that you sent your letter ( s ) in error, and that this matter is permanently closed.

Your continued silence is unacceptable. Either provide the proof or correct the record to remove the invalid debt from my credit files with the three primary credit-reporting agencies. You are Failure to respond within 15 days of receipt of this registered letter will result in a small claims action against your company. I will be seeking {$5000.00} in damages for the following : Defamation, Negligent Enablement of Identity Fraud, and Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act. 

After obtaining the judgment against your company, I will obtain a Writ of Execution from the Sheriff 's office in your county and I will begin the process of attaching property or funds to satisfy the judgment.

This Notice has the same effect as a dispute to the validity of the alleged debt and a dispute to the validity of your claims. This Notice is an attempt to correct your records, and any information received from you will be collected as evidence should any further action be necessary. This is a request for information only, and is not a statement, election, or waiver of status. 

Signature, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: We were approved for a " forbearance on a current account '' while we try to sell this home. We received a notification from all XXXX credit bureaus that our XXXX XXXX balance increased from {$470000.00} to over {$470000.00}. I was extremely confused as there's no reason for our balance to increase while payments are paused. When I called the executive team at XXXX XXXX they confirmed that our balance has not increased, and our payments have simply been paused. Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX XXXX Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Credit Report Information Credit Report Account Number : XXXX Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX Dear XXXX Credit Bureau Name ], I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate information on my credit report under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ). The account in question is from XXXX XXXX XXXX, with the following details : Account Number : XXXX Balance : {$52.00} Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX Date Opened : XX/XX/year> Payment Status : Seriously past due/ Assigned to attorney, collection agency, or credit grantor 's internal collection department Balance Date : XX/XX/year> Account Status : Not Satisfying Trade Dispute Basis : No Valid Contract : I do not have any contractual relationship with XXXX XXXX XXXX. Under 15 U.S. Code 1692e of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), debt collectors must not use false, deceptive, or misleading representations. The absence of a direct contract between myself and XXXX XXXX XXXX invalidates the reporting of this debt on my credit report. 

Inaccurate Reporting : The FCRA mandates that all information on a consumer 's credit report must be accurate and verifiable. The information reported by XXXX XXXX XXXX, including the balance and status of this account, is inaccurate. Furthermore, the account was reported as " Seriously past due '' without sufficient evidence or verification of the debt. 

Potential Consumer Rights Violation : Reporting this account as derogatory without a valid contract and sufficient evidence XXXX constitute a violation of my consumer rights under the FCRA. The lack of detailed payment history and unclear status updates further questions the legality of this reporting. 

Request for Resolution : I request that [ Credit Bureau Name ] conduct a thorough investigation into this matter. If you are unable to verify the accuracy and legality of this information, I demand that this collections account be removed from my credit report immediately. 

Please notify me of the outcome of your investigation within the XXXX period as required by the FCRA. If the investigation reveals that the information is inaccurate, I request that the account be removed from my credit report and that I be provided with an updated copy of my report. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. If further information or documentation is required, please do not hesitate to contact me. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a complaint against XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ), XXXX, Experian, and XXXX for inaccurate reporting of a charged-off debt, violations of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), the Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ), the Privacy Act of 1974, and the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ). 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) has reported a charged-off debt to XXXX, Experian, and XXXX on my credit report. This is in violation of the FDCPA, which states that when an account is more than 180 days past due, it must generally be charged off. Despite being charged off, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) has failed to provide me with a XXXX form, as required by IRS code 4681.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) has violated the FCRA ( 15 US. .Code 1681s2 - Responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies ) by reporting inaccurate information to the credit bureaus. Specifically, they have reported the charged-off debt without having reasonable cause to believe that the information is accurate. This has severely affected my overall score and financial stability. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) actions also violate the Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ) - 12 CFR 31.3 and the CFPA 's prohibition against unfair, deceptive, or abusive acts or practices. By continuing to report the charged-off account as a debt, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) is engaging in deceptive conduct that harms consumers ( Me ). 

Furthermore, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) has violated my rights under the Privacy Act of 1974. The Privacy Act of 1974, as amended, 5 U.S.C. 552a, establishes a code of fair information practices that governs the collection, maintenance, use, and dissemination of information about individuals that is maintained in systems of records by federal agencies. A system of records is a group of records under the control of an agency from which information is retrieved by the name of the individual or by some identifier assigned to the individual. The Privacy Act prohibits the disclosure of a record about an individual from a system of records absent the written consent of the individual, unless the disclosure is pursuant to XXXX of XXXX statutory exceptions. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) improperly disclosed my personal information to credit reporting agencies, specifically XXXX, Experian, and XXXX without my permission. 

Additionally, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) has violated the GLBA ( 15 U.S.C. 6802, also known as section 502 ( b ) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ) by failing to provide me with a clear and conspicuous notice of their intent to share my nonpublic personal information with nonaffiliated third parties, such as XXXX, Experian, and XXXX. This coincides with

16 CFR 313.7 ( Form of opt out notice to consumers ; opt out methods ) 16 CFR 313.10 ( Limits on disclosure of non-public personal information to nonaffiliated third parties ) and 248.124 ( Reasonable opportunity to opt out ). Supporting Documentation : Credit Reports to Show Lack of Unison and Accurate Reporting Opt Out Letter to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) that was ignored FDCPA Documentation concerning charge-off statuses Requested Relief : I request that the CFPB investigate this matter and take appropriate action against XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) XXXX XXXX, Experian, and XXXX. I seek the removal of the inaccurate information from my credit report, as well as compensation deemed appropriate and upholding the law per violation committed.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, has violated my rights. 

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written instructions.

15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account information incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Credit Report Information Credit Report Account Number : XXXX Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Dear CFPB I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate information on my credit report under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ), which gives me the right to dispute information I believe to be inaccurate or incomplete. 

The account in question is from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, a collections company, with which I have no contractual relationship. Specifically, the details are as follows : Account Number : XXXX Balance : {$2400.00} Date Opened : XX/XX/year> Payment Status : Seriously past due/ Assigned to attorney, collection agency, or credit grantor 's internal collection department Last Reported : XX/XX/year> Dispute Basis : No Contractual Relationship : Under 15 U.S. Code 1692e of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), debt collectors are required to report accurate information and must not use any false, deceptive, or misleading representations. I do not have any contractual agreement with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, which invalidates the reporting of this debt on my credit report. 

Inaccurate Reporting of Debt : The FCRA mandates that all information on a consumer 's credit report must be accurate and verifiable. Since there is no contract or agreement between myself and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, the accuracy of this reported debt is in question. Additionally, the absence of payment history and the derogatory information reported without adequate evidence further violates the FCRA. 

Potential Violation of Consumer Rights : The continued reporting of this account as derogatory, without proper verification and in the absence of a valid contract, may constitute a violation of my consumer rights under the FCRA. Additionally, the failure to provide complete information about the payment history and the terms of the alleged debt raises concerns about the legality of this reporting.

Request for Resolution : I request that [ Credit Bureau Name ] conduct a thorough investigation into this matter. If you are unable to verify the accuracy and legality of this information, I demand that this collections account be removed from my credit report immediately. 

Please notify me of the outcome of your investigation within the 30-day period as required by the FCRA. If the investigation reveals that the information is inaccurate, I request that the account be removed from my credit report and that I be provided with an updated copy of my report. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. If further information or documentation is required, please do not hesitate to contact me. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I write to you with deep concern and dissatisfaction regarding the unauthorized inclusion of information in my consumer report, a clear violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681b. This letter serves as an official dispute, urging your agency to conduct an immediate and thorough investigation into this serious breach of my rights. 

XXXX XXXX I am writing to dispute the accuracy of information contained in my consumer credit report. Upon recent review, I have discovered entries that violate the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), particularly Section 611, which mandates the maximum possible accuracy of information in a consumer 's file. 

Furthermore, the entries in question were reported without my written permission, contravening the requirements outlined in 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) of the FCRA. As such, I request an immediate, comprehensive, and impartial investigation into these entries. I expect a detailed response outlining the findings of this investigation, including the original written instructions from me ( Consumer ) with my wet signature. 

Moreover, I am not aware of any legitimate purpose for reporting these late payments, and I affirm that I did not authorize the reporting of such information to your agency. Therefore, in accordance with Section 604 ( a ) ( 3 ) of the FCRA, I demand a thorough investigation into these disputed late payments, along with written confirmation of the investigation 's completion and details of any actions taken to rectify this matter. 

Additionally, I request documentation, including the periodic statement and tracking number, to prove that each periodic statement was delivered to me at least 21 days before the payment due date, as mandated by 15 U.S. Code 1666b.

I request that you provide me with the name and address of the person ( s ) that you contacted to allegedly verify the information that I have rightfully disputed. 

Failure to comply with the legal requirements outlined in this letter will necessitate pursuing all available legal remedies to address this violation of my rights under the FCRA. I trust that your agency will approach this matter with the urgency and seriousness it deserves. 

FCRA Section 607 ( a ) ( 4 ) - Consumer Right to Privacy : You are continuing to report fraudulent accounts on my credit report that do not belong to me, which is a clear infringement upon my privacy rights. As I mentioned before, I have the sole authority to determine what information should be considered private. I insist that my hard inquiries and account information not be shared on my credit report. 

FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( 2 ) - Misleading False Reporting : The information you continue to report falsely suggests that I applied for multiple inquiries and accounts, when in reality, these were the result of a scammer\ 's actions. This misleading and unverified reporting is in direct violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and its fairness requirements. 

FCRA Section 616 - Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance : Despite my previous dispute, you have failed to verify the accuracy of the credit information you have accepted, thereby demonstrating willful noncompliance. This noncompliance is subject to civil liability of up to {$1000.00} per violation. 

FCRA Section 603 ( d ) ( 2 ) ( A ) - Obligations with Respect to Disclosures of Personal Information : You have yet to fulfill your obligation to disclose my right to opt out of sharing my personal information. This omission is deceptive and a direct violation of my consumer rights. 

FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( 3 ) - Furnishing Deceptive Forms : Despite my previous dispute, you persist in furnishing inaccurate inquiries and accounts without proper validation, which potentially violates Generally Accepted Accounting Principles ( GAAP ). Reporting such deceptive information is unacceptable In addition to the aforementioned violations, I remind you of the previous violations outlined in my initial dispute letter, including the violation of Debt Collection Practices Act, Identity Theft Laws, Acquiring Location Information Regulations, Timely Payments Regulations, Finance Charge Determination, and Credit Report Permissible Purposes. These violations require your immediate attention and resolution. 

The entries in question were reported without my written permission, contravening the requirements outlined in 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) of the FCRA. As such, I request an immediate, comprehensive, and impartial investigation into these entries. I expect a detailed response outlining the findings of this investigation, including the original written instructions from me ( Consumer ) with my wet signature.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute the following inaccuracies that I have identified on my credit report : XXXX. **Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX** - Account Number : XXXX - Amount : {$XXXX} The collection agency has failed to validate this debt despite my requests. I would like to know how this account was verified. Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I demand the immediate removal of this account from my credit report as its presence constitutes a violation. 

XXXX. **Account Name : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX* - Account Number : XXXX - Amount : {$XXXX} According to section 1681b ( g ) ( 3 ) of this title, certain exclusions are inapplicable for information disclosed to persons related by common ownership or affiliated by corporate control, especially with respect to medical information and lists describing or aggregating payment transactions for medical products or services. I request clarification on the verification of this debt and insist on adherence to the privacy requirements stipulated by law. I demand an immediate removal of this account from my credit report as its presence constitutes a violation.

3. **Account Name : XXXX** - Account Number : XXXX - XXXX : {$XXXX} This account is in violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( 7 ), which pertains to the method of verification. It has been reported without valid evidence to support its validity. I request a thorough reinvestigation and removal of this item. 

XXXX. **Account Name : XXXX** - Account Number : XXXX - XXXX : {$XXXX} In accordance with 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( 5 ), if an item of information is found to be inaccurate or can not be verified after any reinvestigation, it must be DELETED. This account falls under this statute, and I demand that action be taken to correct my credit file promptly. 

XXXX. **Account Name : XXXX** - Account Number : XXXX - Amount : {$XXXX} I am disputing the validity of this account under 15 U.S. Code 1681i. This law requires that inaccurate or unverifiable information be removed from my credit report after a reinvestigation. This account has been reported without valid evidence of its accuracy. I request a thorough reinvestigation and the immediate removal of this item from my credit report. 

These errors have negatively impacted my credit score and could result in significant harm to my financial standing. I expect a prompt response to this letter, and pursuant to the FCRA, I request that these disputed items be investigated within the statutory timeframe of 30 days. 
Please send me documentation reflecting the outcome of your investigation and the actions taken to rectify these issues on my credit report. 
Should you continue to report these items without properly verifying them, be aware that I am prepared to escalate this matter to ensure my rights under consumer protection laws are fully upheld. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to these serious matters. 
Sincerely, Attachment : copy of the credit report with disputed items highlighted

These errors have negatively impacted my credit score and could result in significant harm to my financial standing. I expect a prompt response to this letter, and pursuant to the FCRA, I request that these disputed items be investigated within the statutory timeframe of 30 days.

Please send me documentation reflecting the outcome of your investigation and the actions taken to rectify these issues on my credit report.

Should you continue to report these items without properly verifying them, be aware that I am prepared to escalate this matter to ensure my rights under consumer protection laws are fully upheld.

Thank you for your prompt attention to these serious matters.

Sincerely, Attachment : copy of the credit report with disputed items highlighted

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX XXXX Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Credit Report Information Credit Report Account Number : XXXX Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX Dear [ Credit Bureau Name ], I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate information on my credit report under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ). The account in question is from XXXX XXXX XXXX, with the following details : Account Number : XXXX Balance : {$52.00} Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX Date Opened : XX/XX/year> Payment Status : Seriously past due/ Assigned to attorney, collection agency, or credit grantor 's internal collection department Balance Date : XX/XX/year> Account Status : Not Satisfying Trade Dispute Basis : No Valid Contract : I do not have any contractual relationship with XXXX XXXX XXXX. Under 15 U.S. Code 1692e of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), debt collectors must not use false, deceptive, or misleading representations. The absence of a direct contract between myself and XXXX XXXX XXXX invalidates the reporting of this debt on my credit report. 

Inaccurate Reporting : The FCRA mandates that all information on a consumer 's credit report must be accurate and verifiable. The information reported by XXXX XXXX XXXX, including the balance and status of this account, is inaccurate. Furthermore, the account was reported as " Seriously past due '' without sufficient evidence or verification of the debt. 

Potential Consumer Rights Violation : Reporting this account as derogatory without a valid contract and sufficient evidence XXXX constitute a violation of my consumer rights under the FCRA. The lack of detailed payment history and unclear status updates further questions the legality of this reporting. 

Request for Resolution : I request that [ Credit Bureau Name ] conduct a thorough investigation into this matter. If you are unable to verify the accuracy and legality of this information, I demand that this collections account be removed from my credit report immediately. 

Please notify me of the outcome of your investigation within the XXXX period as required by the FCRA. If the investigation reveals that the information is inaccurate, I request that the account be removed from my credit report and that I be provided with an updated copy of my report. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. If further information or documentation is required, please do not hesitate to contact me. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a complaint against XXXX XXXX XXXX, Transunion, XXXX, and XXXX for inaccurate reporting of a charged-off debt, violations of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), the Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ), the Privacy Act of 1974, and the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ). 

XXXX XXXX XXXX has reported a charged-off debt to Transunion, XXXX, and XXXX on my credit report. This is in violation of the FDCPA, which states that when an account is more than 180 days past due, it must generally be charged off. Despite being charged off, XXXX XXXX XXXX has failed to provide me with a 1099-C form, as required by IRS code 4681. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX has violated the FCRA ( 15 US. .Code 1681s2 - Responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies ) by reporting inaccurate information to the credit bureaus. Specifically, they have reported the charged-off debt without having reasonable cause to believe that the information is accurate. This has severely affected my overall score and financial stability. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX actions also violate the Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ) - 12 CFR 31.3 and the CFPA 's prohibition against unfair, deceptive, or abusive acts or practices. By continuing to report the charged-off account as a debt, XXXX XXXX XXXX is engaging in deceptive conduct that harms consumers ( Me ). 

Furthermore, XXXX XXXX XXXX has violated my rights under the Privacy Act of 1974. The Privacy Act of 1974, as amended, 5 U.S.C. 552a, establishes a code of fair information practices that governs the collection, maintenance, use, and dissemination of information about individuals that is maintained in systems of records by federal agencies. A system of records is a group of records under the control of an agency from which information is retrieved by the name of the individual or by some identifier assigned to the individual. The Privacy Act prohibits the disclosure of a record about an individual from a system of records absent the written consent of the individual, unless the disclosure is pursuant to one of twelve statutory exceptions. XXXX XXXX XXXX improperly disclosed my personal information to credit reporting agencies, specifically Transunion, XXXX, and XXXX without my permission. 

Additionally, XXXX XXXX XXXX has violated the GLBA ( 15 U.S.C. 6802, also known as section 502 ( b ) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ) by failing to provide me with a clear and conspicuous notice of their intent to share my nonpublic personal information with nonaffiliated third parties, such as Transunion, XXXX, and XXXX. This coincides with 16 CFR 313.7 ( Form of opt out notice to consumers ; opt out methods ) 16 CFR 313.10 ( Limits on disclosure of non-public personal information to nonaffiliated third parties ) and 248.124 ( Reasonable opportunity to opt out ).

Supporting Documentation : Credit Reports to Show Lack of Unison and Accurate Reporting Opt Out Letter to XXXX XXXX XXXX that was ignored FDCPA Documentation concerning charge-off statuses Requested Relief : I request that the CFPB investigate this matter and take appropriate action against XXXX XXXX XXXX, Transunion, XXXX, and XXXX XXXX I seek the removal of the inaccurate information from my credit report, as well as compensation deemed appropriate and upholding the law per violation committed.

Consumer complaint narrative:
15 U.S. Code 1681, also known as the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), governs the access to consumer credit report records and how Credit Reporting Agencies ( CRAs ) collect and sell personal information. The FCRA 's purpose is to ensure that CRAs collect and use information in a fair and equitable way that protects consumers ' privacy and promotes accuracy. The FCRA includes several findings and requirements, including : Congressional findings The FCRA states that the banking system relies on accurate and fair credit reporting, and that inaccurate or unfair reporting can harm the banking system and public confidence. 
Subchapter requirements The FCRA requires CRAs to use information properly and ensure it's relevant. It also includes compliance procedures, such as requiring CRAs to follow reasonable procedures to ensure the accuracy of their reports, and to allow users of consumer reports to disclose the report 's contents to the consumer. 
I dispute and want this off my credit report.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am formally disputing the account XXXX XXXX Acct # XXXX. As mandated by the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), specifically section 1629g, you are legally required to verify this debt. Failure to provide proper verification will result in a violation of federal and state regulations governing debt collection practices.

Under the FDCPA, your verification must include the following : Proof of my agreement to pay the original creditor ; A copy of the final account statement issued by the original creditor ; A detailed breakdown of the total amount due, including principal, interest, and any additional charges ; Documentation for each charge, including the date and basis for each charge.

I dispute this debt for the following reasons : [ Insert reason ( s ) for dispute ].

Given this dispute, you are legally obligated not to report this debt to any credit reporting agencies. If this debt has already been reported, you must immediately notify the credit reporting agencies that the debt is disputed and remove the tradeline from my credit report. Reporting information you know to be inaccurate, or failing to correct such information, constitutes a violation of the FDCPA and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ).

Furthermore, except for providing verification of this debt, you are required by law to cease all communication with me regarding this matter. Any attempt to contact me in violation of this request will be treated as a breach of your legal obligations under the FDCPA. 

This matter demands your immediate attention. I expect full compliance with all legal requirements without delay. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX
