Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX and Citibank failed to perform a reinvestigation of a charge-off account reported by Citibank on my credit report. The account in question is listed under XXXX and has been marked which I believe may be inaccurately reported. XXXX and Citibank didnot provide the method of the reinvestigation. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681i, I am entitled to an accurate and complete credit report. The FCRA mandates that credit reporting agencies ensure the information in credit reports is both fair and accurate. Inaccurate or incomplete information must be corrected or removed. 
Moreover, the FCRA requires that any reported late payments must be accurate and substantiated. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c, late payments must reflect the true nature of the account status. If a late payment entry is incorrect or outdated, it should be promptly rectified.

Failure to comply with these requirements can be considered willful non-compliance under 15 U.S.C. 1681n, which addresses the responsibilities of credit reporting agencies to maintain accurate records and the legal repercussions for failing to do so. 

In light of these legal obligations, I request the following information regarding the reinvestigation process : The specific procedures XXXX will follow to verify the accuracy of the reported charge-off and any related late payments. 
Details on how communication with Citibank will be managed to obtain updated or corrected information. 
The anticipated timeframe for completing the reinvestigation. 
How and when I will be notified of any changes or updates resulting from this process. 
I expect a thorough reinvestigation and prompt resolution of this matter in compliance with FCRA standards. Please keep me informed of any updates or changes to my credit report.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, I formally requested that Equifax provide proof of my authorization for the inquiry listed on my credit report via the CFPB portal. In response, Equifax requested that I submit proper identification to proceed with the investigation, which I promptly provided. Despite this, on XX/XX/year>, I received a letter from Equifax claiming that the inquiry was valid because my information was allegedly used to obtain a mortgage. 

Let me be clear : I am not disputing the validity of the inquiry. I am disputing that this inquiry was fraudulent and unauthorized. I never granted permission or authorized anyone to make an inquiry regarding a mortgage on my behalf. To substantiate my claim, I subsequently provided Equifax with an FTC affidavit of fraud confirming that this inquiry was unauthorized. 

Equifax has blatantly violated my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and CFPB guidelines by failing to provide proofsuch as my signature or any documentationauthorizing this inquiry. They are now legally obligated to remove this unauthorized inquiry from my credit report immediately. 

This is a formal demand for the immediate removal of the fraudulent inquiry. Failure to comply will leave me with no option but to escalate this matter further, including pursuing legal action to enforce my rights under the law. I expect prompt confirmation of the removal of this inquiry from my credit report.

15 U.S. Code 1666b - Timing of payments ( a ) TIME TO MAKE PAYMENTS Acreditormay not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless thecreditorhas adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required bysection 1637 ( b ) of this titleis mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. 
I requested the information that must have or possess by law in order for you to furnish a payment as late. 
This is being request pursuant rule 1002.

In other words, to properly report information as verified, the furnisher must have sufficient evidence to support the conclusion that the information was true, and in doing this the conditions required by 15 USC 1666b must be met.

You failed to provide the required requested information, you failed to proceed in accordance with the requires for a creditor to treat a payment as late. 
It has been over 30 days and you have not properly verify the information. 

Id. at XXXX ; see also XXXX XXXX XXXX ( 11th ed. 2019 ) ( defining verify as [ t ] o prove to be true ; to confirm or establish the truth or truthfulness of ; to authenticate ). 
Importantly, a furnishers inability to conclusively determine that the disputed information is inaccurate does not mean that the furnisher is permitted to report back to the consumer reporting agency that its investigation verified the accuracy of that information. Instead, if the evidence available to the furnisher is insufficient to establish the truth or falsity of the disputed information, then, under the statutory framework, the furnisher must report that its investigation concluded that the disputed information can not be verified. 
XXXX, XXXX XXXX at XXXX. So, for example, if a furnisher is unable to verify that a consumer missed a payment, then it may be appropriate for the furnisher to delete any mentions of the missed payment while continuing to report other information about the account.

Delete the information you are furnishing to the Consumer Reporting Agencies as late from account.

Notice to agent is notice to principal notice to principal is notice to agent You [ XXXX, XXXX, XXXX replied that the alleged transaction you furnished as late was { accurate/ verified } but my previous dispute did not ask you for accuracy or validation. 
You { XXXX, XXXX, XXXX } reported an alleged transaction as Late.

15 U.S. Code 1666b - Timing of payments ( a ) TIME TO MAKE PAYMENTS Acreditormay not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless thecreditorhas adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required bysection 1637 ( b ) of this titleis mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date.

15 USC 1681e ( b ) ( b ) ACCURACY OF REPORT Whenever aconsumer reporting agencyprepares aconsumer reportit shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.

I requested the information that you must have or possess by law in order for you to report a payment as late.

This is being request pursuant rule 1002.

In other words, to properly report information as verified, the furnisher must have sufficient evidence to support the conclusion that the information was true, and in doing this the conditions required by 15 USC 1666b must be met.

You failed to provide the required requested information, you failed to proceed in accordance with the requires for a creditor to treat a payment as late and the evidence that must be sent to you to prove that this transaction was late.

It has been over 30 days and you have not properly verify the information.

Id. at 1303 ; see also XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX. 2019 ) ( defining verify as [ t ] o prove to be true ; to confirm or establish the truth or truthfulness of ; to authenticate ).

15 U.S. Code 1681i - Procedure in case of disputed accuracy ( a ) REINVESTIGATIONS OF DISPUTED INFORMATION ( 1 ) REINVESTIGATION REQUIRED ( A ) In general Subject to subsection ( f ) and except as provided in subsection ( g ), if the completeness or accuracy of any item of information contained in aconsumersfileat aconsumer reporting agencyis disputed by theconsumerand theconsumernotifies the agency directly, or indirectly through areseller, of such dispute, the agency shall, free of charge, conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to determine whether the disputed information is inaccurate andrecordthe current status of the disputed information, or delete the item from thefilein accordance with paragraph ( 5 ), before the end of the 30-day period beginning on the date on which the agency receives the notice of the dispute from theconsumerorreseller.

Importantly, a furnishers inability to conclusively determine that the disputed information is inaccurate does not mean that the furnisher is permitted to report back to the consumer reporting agency that its investigation verified the accuracy of that information. Instead, if the evidence available to the furnisher is insufficient to establish the truth or falsity of the disputed information, then, under the statutory framework, the furnisher must report that its investigation concluded that the disputed information can not be verified.

Hinkle, 827 F.3d at 1304. So, for example, if a furnisher is unable to verify that a consumer missed a payment, then it may be appropriate for the furnisher to delete any mentions of the missed payment while continuing to report other information about the account.

I am requesting pursuant 15 USC 1681i ( 6 ) NOTICE OF RESULTS OF REINVESTIGATION ( B ) Contents ( iii ) a notice that, if requested by theconsumer, a description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information shall be provided to theconsumerby the agency, including the business name and address of any furnisher of information contacted in connection with such information and the telephone number of such furnisher.

when disputed information can not be verified is to delete that information.

In particular, Section 1681i outlines consumer reporting agencies responsibilities in responding to consumers disputes and, like Section 1681s-2 ( b ), provides that when a disputed item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency must delete or modify it as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation. 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ).

Section 1681i goes on to provide that, [ f ] ollowing any deletion of information which is found to be inaccurate or whose accuracy can no longer be verified, the consumer reporting agency must in some circumstances notify certain people who previously received a report with the now-deleted information. That provision thus contemplates that when information can no longer be verified, the proper response is to delet [ e ] it. See Hinkle, 827 F.3d at 1304 Delete the information you are Reporting as Late from account.

Experian Fraud Department To Whom It May Concern, It has come to my attention that you are reporting what I know to be inaccurate data, which I dispute, and this letter is an appeal for your assistance. As a consumer reporting agency 15 U.S.C. $ 1681a ( f ), you are governed by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 'FCRA '' ). 15 U.S.C. 1681, et seq., which protects consumers from inaccurate, outdated, or invalidated information reporting of their consumer file. The FCRA states that it's the consumer reporting agency 's responsibility to ensure that all information contained within consumer files is accurate and free from errors. Your company is regularly engaged in the business of assembling, evaluating, and disbursing information concerning consumers for the purpose of furnishing consumer reports, as defined in 15 U.S.C. {$1600.00} ( d ), to third parties.

According to federal law, you are required to comply with the requirements imposed under the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., including but not limited to : 1 ) follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information in the consumer report, as required by 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ). This section imposes a high and often disregarded standard on consumer reporting agencies. See, e.g., XXXX v. Experian XXXX. XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, at XXXX ( XXXX. XXXX XXXX. XXXX, XXXX ) ( breaking down the requirements of 1681e ( b ), and explaining that " assure ' means 'to make sure or certain : put beyond all doubt, '' ' [ maximum ' means the 'greatest in quantity or highest degree attainable [, ] ' and 'possible ' means something falling within the bounds of what may be done, occur or be conceived. '' ( quoting XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX ( XXXX ) ) ; XXXX ) comply with the investigation requirements, as required by 15 U.S.C. 1681i ; 3 ) should not provide consumer files to companies without determining that these companies had a permissible purpose to obtain consumer files pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681b ; 4 ) provide consumer file pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681g ; 5 ) et seq.

Accordingly, I request your company to provide verifiable documentary proof ( e.g., original consumer contract or similar proof bearing my wet ink signature on it ) you have on file of accounts/items listed below. Under the FCRA, if you do not provide documented and verifiable proof, you must remove all unverified, invalid, derogatory information from my consumer report. 
Acct : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Acct number : XXXX Upon completion of your investigation, please send a detailed description of the procedures used to determine the accuracy of the accounts/items XXXX XXXX disputing, as well as the name and contact information of the agent conducting the said investigation in case further communication is necessary. 
I know that your company will need some sort of verification to prove my identity. My information is clearly shown below : FULL NAME : XXXX XXXX SOCIAL SECURITY NUMBER : XXXX DATE OF BIRTH : XX/XX/XXXX I sent this letter via certified mail to ensure this matter is resolved within the required thirty ( 30 ) day window so as to avoid any violation of the FCRA. Finally, please send me a copy of the changed consumer report at the earliest. 

Thank you for your assistance in this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt is not yours
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX XXXX Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Credit Report Information Credit Report Account Number : XXXX Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX Dear [ Credit Bureau Name ], I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate information on my credit report under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ). The account in question is from XXXX XXXX XXXX, with the following details : Account Number : XXXX Balance : {$52.00} Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX Date Opened : XX/XX/year> Payment Status : Seriously past due/ Assigned to attorney, collection agency, or credit XXXX 's internal collection department Balance Date : XX/XX/year> Account Status : Not Satisfying Trade Dispute Basis : No Valid Contract : I do not have any contractual relationship with XXXX XXXX XXXX. Under 15 U.S. Code 1692e of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), debt collectors must not use false, deceptive, or misleading representations. The absence of a direct contract between myself and XXXX XXXX XXXX invalidates the reporting of this debt on my credit report. 

Inaccurate Reporting : The FCRA mandates that all information on a consumer 's credit report must be accurate and verifiable. The information reported by XXXX XXXX XXXX, including the balance and status of this account, is inaccurate. Furthermore, the account was reported as " Seriously past due '' without sufficient evidence or verification of the debt.

The lack of detailed payment history and unclear status updates further questions the legality of this reporting.

Please notify me of the outcome of your investigation within the XXXX period as required by the FCRA. If the investigation reveals that the information is inaccurate, I request that the account be removed from my credit report and that I be provided with an updated copy of my report. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. If further information or documentation is required, please do not hesitate to contact me. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Information belongs to someone else
Consumer complaint narrative: I filed a complaint on XX/XX/year>, XXXX. and I am writing to formally dispute the account associated with the credit card account ending in XXXX for XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX in the amount of {$12000.00}, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account number XXXX in the amount of {$11000.00} and XXXX  account number XXXX in the amount of {$920.00} which is fraudulently reporting on my credit report. I have repeatedly notified your company that this account does not belong to me and that it was opened without my knowledge or consent. Despite my numerous attempts to resolve this issue, the fraudulent account continues to appear on my credit report with late payments and as a charge-off, severely damaging my credit score. Violations of My Rights : 1. Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) Violations : Under the FCRA, specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681i, I have the right to dispute inaccurate information in my credit report. Your continued reporting of this fraudulent account, despite my numerous disputes, violates my right to have inaccurate or unverifiable information corrected or removed. The FCRA mandates that once a consumer disputes the completeness or accuracy of any item of information, the furnisher ( in this case, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) must conduct a reasonable investigation. Failure to do so or continuing to report inaccurate information constitutes a direct violation of this federal law. 2. Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ) Violations : According to the GLBA, particularly 15 U.S.C. 6802, financial institutions are required to protect the privacy of nonpublic personal information and to provide notice before disclosing such information to nonaffiliated third parties. The fact that this account was fraudulently opened under my name suggests a breach of your duty to safeguard my personal information. This failure has resulted in unauthorized access to my sensitive data, further compounding the violation of my rights under the GLBA. 3. Equal Credit Opportunity Act ( ECOA ) Violations : The ECOA, under 15 U.S.C. 1691, explicitly prohibits creditors from discriminating against any applicant who exercises their rights under the Consumer Credit Protection Act. By refusing to remove this fraudulent account and continuing to report it negatively on my credit, despite my rightful disputes, you are effectively discriminating against me for exercising my rights under federal law. This discrimination, in turn, subjects you to penalties and legal consequences under the ECOA. Actions Requested : Given the clear violations of my rights under these federal statutes, I am formally requesting the following actions : 1. Immediate Removal of the Fraudulent Account : I demand that the fraudulent car loan account be removed from my credit report immediately. This includes removing all associated negative marks, such as late payments and the charge-off status. 2. Cease All Collection Activities : I request that you cease any collection activities related to this fraudulent account, as I did not authorize this loan or any related transactions. 3. Investigation and Response : I request a thorough investigation into this matter, including how my personal information was compromised and how this fraudulent account was opened. Please provide a detailed response outlining the steps taken during the investigation and the results. 4. Confirmation of Action Taken : Once the fraudulent account is removed from my credit report, I request that you provide written confirmation of the removal and any other corrective actions taken. Failure to Honor Request and Discrimination : If you fail to honor my request for the removal of this fraudulent account and continue to report inaccurate information on my credit report, it will be a violation of my rights under the FCRA. Additionally, if you discriminate against me in any way for exercising my rights under the FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 ) or the Equal Credit Opportunity Act ( ECOA ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1691 ), I will pursue all available legal remedies. According to the ECOA : It shall be unlawful for any creditor to discriminate against any applicant, with respect to any aspect of a credit transactionbecause the applicant has in good faith exercised any right under the Consumer Credit Protection Act. Discrimination for exercising my rights is strictly prohibited under federal law and may result in further legal action. Please consider this letter as my formal notice and request for immediate action under the relevant provisions of the FCRA, GLBA, and ECOA. If this issue is not resolved within 30 days, I will be forced to escalate this matter by filing a formal complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and possibly pursuing legal action. I appreciate your prompt attention to this urgent matter. Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, I formally requested that Equifax provide proof of my authorization for the inquiry listed on my credit report via the CFPB portal. In response, Equifax requested that I submit proper identification to proceed with the investigation, which I promptly provided. Despite this, on XX/XX/year>, I received a letter from Equifax claiming that the inquiry was valid because my information was allegedly used to obtain a mortgage. 

Let me be clear : I am not disputing the validity of the inquiry. I am disputing that this inquiry was fraudulent and unauthorized. I never granted permission or authorized anyone to make an inquiry regarding a mortgage on my behalf. To substantiate my claim, I subsequently provided Equifax with an FTC affidavit of fraud confirming that this inquiry was unauthorized. 

Equifax has blatantly violated my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and CFPB guidelines by failing to provide proofsuch as my signature or any documentationauthorizing this inquiry. They are now legally obligated to remove this unauthorized inquiry from my credit report immediately. 

This is a formal demand for the immediate removal of the fraudulent inquiry. Failure to comply will leave me with no option but to escalate this matter further, including pursuing legal action to enforce my rights under the law. I expect prompt confirmation of the removal of this inquiry from my credit report.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a complaint against XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX, Transunion, XXXX, and XXXX for inaccurate reporting of a charged-off debt, violations of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), the Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ), the Privacy Act of 1974, and the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ). 


XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX has reported a charged-off debt to Transunion, XXXX, and XXXX on my credit report. This is in violation of the FDCPA, which states that when an account is more than 180 days past due, it must generally be charged off. Despite being charged off, XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX has failed to provide me with a 1099-C form, as required by IRS code 4681. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX has violated the FCRA ( 15 US. .Code 1681s2 - Responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies ) by reporting inaccurate information to the credit bureaus. Specifically, they have reported the charged-off debt without having reasonable cause to believe that the information is accurate. This has severely affected my overall score and financial stability. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX actions also violate the Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ) - 12 CFR 31.3 and the CFPA 's prohibition against unfair, deceptive, or abusive acts or practices. By continuing to report the charged-off account as a debt, XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX Na is engaging in deceptive conduct that harms consumers ( Me ). 

Furthermore, XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX has violated my rights under the Privacy Act of 1974. The Privacy Act of 1974, as amended, 5 U.S.C. 552a, establishes a code of fair information practices that governs the collection, maintenance, use, and dissemination of information about individuals that is maintained in systems of records by federal agencies. A system of records is a group of records under the control of an agency from which information is retrieved by the name of the individual or by some identifier assigned to the individual. The Privacy Act prohibits the disclosure of a record about an individual from a system of records absent the written consent of the individual, unless the disclosure is pursuant to one of twelve statutory exceptions. Capital One Bank USA Na improperly disclosed my personal information to credit reporting agencies, specifically Transunion, XXXX, and XXXX without my permission. 

Additionally, Capital One Bank USA Na has violated the GLBA ( 15 U.S.C. 6802, also known as section 502 ( b ) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ) by failing to provide me with a clear and conspicuous notice of their intent to share my nonpublic personal information with nonaffiliated third parties, such as Transunion, XXXX, and XXXX. This coincides with 16 CFR 313.7 ( Form of opt out notice to consumers ; opt out methods ) 16 CFR 313.10 ( Limits on disclosure of non-public personal information to nonaffiliated third parties ) and 248.124 ( Reasonable opportunity to opt out ). 

Supporting Documentation : Credit Reports to Show Lack of XXXX and Accurate Reporting Opt Out Letter to XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX that was ignored FDCPA Documentation concerning charge-off statuses Requested Relief : I request that the CFPB investigate this matter and take appropriate action against XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Transunion, XXXX, and XXXX. I seek the removal of the inaccurate information from my credit report, as well as compensation deemed appropriate and upholding the law per violation committed.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Re : Inaccurate Reporting and Violation of Fair Credit Reporting Act & Metro- 2 To whom it may concern at EXPERIAN , XXXX , and XXXX XXXX XXXX : I just checked my credit and found some inaccuracies. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, Section 611 of FCRA you have a responsibility of promptly deleting any information which is inaccurate or incomplete so it doesn't get reported in my report! This is my understanding as well. It's important to note that under the FCRA, even if an account has only been speculated upon or never confirmed in any waythe burden falls on you ( the credit bureau ) to provide evidence of its veracity before it can be placed on my credit report. According to the FCRA Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( l ) and the accepted STANDARD of metro 2 data field reporting, I have the right to dispute any information on my credit report that I believe is not correct. When it comes to my credit report, I reserve the right to dispute any information that I deem to be inaccurate. I won't stand for any misinformation being associated with my name and financial history. If there's something on my credit report that doesn't seem right, you can bet that I'll be taking action to get it removed.I can not recognize or accept the allegation of delinquency without factual proof. There must be some sort of evidence to back up the claim.

Otherwise, I can not and will not recognize or accept the allegation. According to federal and state law, you must report any allegations with the greatest compliance and accuracy possible.You should not report any claims that you know or should know are not in compliance with regulations and the law. If you do report such claims, you could be subject to fines or other penalties. Furthermore, reporting claims that you know are not in compliance could damage the reputation of your company.I am writing to inform you that you need to make sure all your claims are factual and certified before reporting them. This is required by the Metro 2 reporting standard. I request that you provide evidence to support the existence of the account and evidence that the account was used for a permissible purpose. Please provide any documents or records you may have that can help corroborate the account and its permissible purpose.I am giving you 30 days to investigate the matter and determine whether it is still being reported accurately and in compliance with regulations. If it is not, I want it removed from the report.I hereby authorize you to take whatever steps are necessary to correct my credit. Please send me physical proof of any actions taken on my behalf. I appreciate your help in making sure my credit is in good standing.Further investigation is required to verify the following claims. These claims remain unverified until further inquiry can confirm them. More research is needed to support these unsubstantiated assertions. Please report any verified claims immediately. Please certify that all claims that have been verified as accurate, complete, and timely reported have been reported in compliance with regulations or remove & reverse late payments immediately.

Lets examine Term Length ( XXXX ) showing XXXX I bet you can't wait until I'm done with this account! The compliance standards are really important, and your reporting ability is clearly lacking. You must make sure all fields are filled out correctly and in 100 % compliances prior adding anything onto my credit profile! Please remove this inaccurate record from my report or provide proof of your compliance with applicable standards.

There may be a problem with the data reported because it doesn't meet the required standards. The data may not be accurate because it deviates from what is required. I was looking at Date Reported ( - ) expressing XX/XX/XXXX. This is a formal complaint about the content of my report. It has come to my attention that you failed in following standard procedures for accuracy, and as such I question its validity if not fixed immediately.

Regards You are not following the rules. I have listed all of my rights in this document so that they can be met accordingly, but it appears you do not care about fulfilling your obligations under Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) or Metro 2 law XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Please send your written response to my address of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, I am writing to inform you that I am aware of your illegal practices of sending form letters in response to disputes and challenges from consumers, regardless of the specific information that they have provided. This is in violation of 15 U.S. Code 5 1681i, which requires that each dispute and challenge must be addressed individually and on its own merits.My letters were created using software that is available to everyone. If you don't process my letters, you are violating my rights as a consumer. I will consider this to be an intentional disregard of my rights, and I will contact my lawyer to take legal action This letter serves as a formal notice of pending litigation and a final settlement offer in relation to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX, Experian Credit Bureaus, and XXXX Credit Bureaus reporting of inaccurate and fraudulent late payments in my consumer report. Statutory Violations and Legal Grounds I have identified multiple violations of the FCRA and other relevant statutes in your reporting practices. These include, but are not limited to : 1. 15 U.S. Code 1681n ( Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance ) : You have willfully failed to comply with the requirements imposed under this subchapter. This includes, but is not limited to, providing inaccurate information and failing to correct or delete unverifiable information.

o Civil Liability : You are liable for any actual damages sustained by the consumer or damages of not less than {$100.00} and not more than {$1000.00}, punitive damages, and the costs of the action together with reasonable attorneys fees.

2. 15 U.S. Code 1681o ( Civil Liability for Negligent Noncompliance ) : Your negligent noncompliance with the FCRA provisions has caused substantial harm to my credit score and financial standing.

o Civil Liability : Liability for actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of your failure.

3. 15 U.S. Code 1692k ( Civil Liability for Debt Collection Practices ) : Your actions constitute a breach of this statute, further compounding the legal violations in your reporting practices.

4. 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2 ( Responsibilities of Furnishers of Information to Consumer Reporting Agencies ) : o Duty to Provide Accurate Information : Reporting information with actual knowledge of errors.

o Duty to Correct and Update Information : Ensuring that all reported information is accurate, complete, and up-to-date.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In order to comply with FCRA and METRO 2 compliance regulations, my profile must be accurate and thorough. You must finish your information verification within a reasonable time frame and be able to evaluate and confirm all of the information in my credit report. My credit history, as well as the following information, have never been validated or correctly reported. 
I will exercise my consumer rights by requesting that factually truthful, verifiable, and compliant data be obtained and placed on my credit report. I also require that any mistakes be fixed permanently. 
Below is a summary of the data in which I am challenging : Summary of Inquiries being challenged in list form XXXX  XXXX ( XXXX ) - ( XXXX ) XX/XX/year> Inquiries XXXX  XXXX  XX/XX/year> Experian. I received a credit report from you that showed a few unfamiliar companies. 
It looks like they put an inquiry on my file without my knowledge, but this shouldn't be possible unless it was something approved by me first. Under U.S.

Code, 15, U.S.C 1681 es seq. Section 604, all users must have a permissible purpose under the Fair Credit Reporting Act to obtain a consumer report. Please have this inquiry removed from my credit file or forward me documentation ( physical proof ) that you have proven permissible purpose for this inquiry. I am reporting that there are some negative items in my credit profile, and I have confirmed that they are not accurate. I dispute these claims and demand that any negative information be removed from the reports immediately. The claims that this information in my report is negative, untrue, incorrect, incomplete, untimely, and not verifiable are unsubstantiated. I have yet to be provided physical verifiable proof that the claims of negativity within my report are true. After reviewing my report, I noticed several deviations from mandatory reporting standards therefore the data in my report can not be accurate and complete! With that said, I refute your allegations and challenge you to provide proof that you have the right to report this incomplete negative information about me. Document that you have complied with the reporting requirements, and report without any deviations. If you have not complied with the requirements or there are any negative aspects below that have been challenged, you must remove them from my report. Per 15 U.S.C 1681e Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates " Also per 12 CFR Part 1022 ( Regulation V ) requires furnishers to : XXXX  - Furnish information about accounts or other relationships with a consumer that has integrity. XXXX  - Furnish information about accounts or other relationships with a consumer that is accurate. XXXX - Conduct reasonable investigations of consumer disputes According to XXXX, in order to make a lawful report, you must follow the Metro 2 compliance standards. Also as stated in the XXXX Any Deviation From These Standards Jeopardizes the Integrity of The Data. This means that any mistakes in reporting claims can make the information less accurate. This is important to remember because it affects the accuracy of any federally regulated reports. With that said! I found some mistakes and inaccuracies in your report, and I would like to invoke my rights to dispute/challenge these inaccurate and non-compliant items. If you continue to report claims that are not perfect, it shows that you do not care about my rights as a consumer.I don't think it's fair for you to report on me in a way that isn't confirmed to be ethical and meets the standards of certified reporting.The following claims about me were not reported correctly and do not meet federal requirements. I am challenging these claims and asking for proof that the proper reporting standards were followed. 
Below is a summary of the data in which I am challenging : Summary of Inquiries being challenged in list form XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  ( XXXX ) - ( XXXX ) XX/XX/year> Inquiries XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> Experian I found credit inquiries on my credit report that I don't remember authorizing. This could be a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, and a serious breach of my privacy rights. I would like you to investigate this and get back to me with documentation of these inquiries with my signature on them. If they are found to be fraudulent, I would like them immediately deleted from my credit file. 
Appreciatively I have listed the concerns I have about your reporting in this document. It is not complete and does not meet my standards. According to the law, you and the data furnishers must certify all aspects of the required FCRA and Metro 2 compliance. This must be done in a truthful, correct, complete, and timely manner as to not violate my consumer and civil rights. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, Section 611 of FCRA, credit bureaus have a responsibility to delete any information from credit reports which is inaccurate or incomplete. This is important to note, as even if an account has only been speculated upon or never confirmed in any way, the burden falls on the credit bureau to provide evidence of its veracity before it can be placed on a credit report. If the information in a credit report is wrong, it was never proven to be factual, and the consumer has the right to take legal action against the credit bureau. 
Below is a summary of the data in which I am challenging : Summary of Inquiries being challenged in list form XXXX  XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) - ( XXXX ) XX/XX/year> Inquiries XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/year> Experian I received a copy of my credit report and noticed a credit inquiry from a company that I don't remember authorizing. I understand that you shouldn't be allowed to put an inquiry on my credit file without my authorization, so please remove this inquiry from my credit file immediately. Please forward me documentation that you have investigated and removed the unauthorized inquiries. 
Appreciatively You are violating my rights! I have listed the concerns about your reporting in this document. It's not complete and does not meet my standards ; according to law, you must certify all aspects of required FCRA/ Metro 2 compliance which is done truthfully, correctly ( in a timely manner ), completely AND accurately as well - or else I would have to escalate these issues to the CFPB , FTC and my Attorney General XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Please send your written response to my address of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX # XXXX XXXX XXXX FL XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a complaint against XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax for inaccurate reporting of a charged-off debt, violations of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), the Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ), the Privacy Act of 1974, and the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ). 

XXXX XXXX XXXX has reported a charged-off debt to XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax on my credit report. This is in violation of the FDCPA, which states that when an account is more than 180 days past due, it must generally be charged off. Despite being charged off, XXXX XXXX XXXX has failed to provide me with a 1099-C form, as required by IRS code XXXX. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX has violated the FCRA ( 15 US. .Code 1681s2 - Responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies ) by reporting inaccurate information to the credit bureaus. Specifically, they have reported the charged-off debt without having reasonable cause to believe that the information is accurate. This has severely affected my overall score and financial stability. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX actions also violate the Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ) - 12 CFR 31.3 and the CFPA 's prohibition against unfair, deceptive, or abusive acts or practices. By continuing to report the charged-off account as a debt, XXXX XXXX XXXX is engaging in deceptive conduct that harms consumers ( XXXX ). 

Furthermore, XXXX XXXX XXXX has violated my rights under the Privacy Act of 1974. The Privacy Act of 1974, as amended, 5 U.S.C. 552a, establishes a code of fair information practices that governs the collection, maintenance, use, and dissemination of information about individuals that is maintained in systems of records by federal agencies. A system of records is a group of records under the control of an agency from which information is retrieved by the name of the individual or by some identifier assigned to the individual. The Privacy Act prohibits the disclosure of a record about an individual from a system of records absent the written consent of the individual, unless the disclosure is pursuant to one of twelve statutory exceptions. XXXX XXXX XXXX improperly disclosed my personal information to credit reporting agencies, specifically XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax without my permission. 

Additionally, XXXX XXXX XXXX has violated the XXXX  ( 15 U.S.C. 6802, also known as section 502 ( b ) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ) by failing to provide me with a clear and conspicuous notice of their intent to share my nonpublic personal information with nonaffiliated third parties, such as XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax. This coincides with 16 CFR 313.7 ( Form of opt out notice to consumers ; opt out methods ) 16 CFR 313.10 ( Limits on disclosure of non-public personal information to nonaffiliated third parties ) and 248.124 ( Reasonable opportunity to opt out ). 

Supporting Documentation : Credit Reports to Show Lack of Unison and Accurate Reporting Opt Out Letter to XXXX XXXX XXXX that was ignored FDCPA Documentation concerning charge-off statuses Requested Relief : I request that the CFPB investigate this matter and take appropriate action against XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax XXXX I seek the removal of the inaccurate information from my credit report, as well as compensation deemed appropriate and upholding the law per violation committed.

I am not in dispute of the ownership of the account but if you are unable to provide the full reports of how you validated, verified, and how you are in compliance then you must remove the negative information or the account from my credit report. Also According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act 15 USC 1681 section 602 a states " There is a need to insure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. '' XXXX and XXXX are consumer reporting agencies and I Am the Consumer. Which would certainly have the right to Assert that my private information is not shared which is backed by 15 USC 6801 which states " It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information. '' is a financial institution by definition under that title. 15 USC 1681 section 604 ( a ) section 2 states that " In general Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. '' The financial institution and the Consumer reporting agencies XXXX and XXXX do not have my consent to furnish this information and they surely do not have my written consent. Any and all consent to XXXX, XXXX, whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written, implied or otherwise is revoked. 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) states that " A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise. that nondisclosure option. '' i was Never informed of my right to exercise my nondisclosure option. Not only that 15 USC 1681C ( a ) ( 5 ) states '' Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), but no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. '' This account is an adverse item they are reporting again without my permission which is against the law. 15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A states " A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 15 U.S. Code 1681e states '' Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681c of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681b of this title. XXXX and XXXX are not maintaining reasonable procedures. Also 12 CFR 1016.7 states that " A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. '' I am opting out of your reporting services.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Notice to agent is notice to principal notice to principal is notice to agent You [ XXXX, XXXX, Equifax replied that the alleged transaction you furnished as late was { accurate/ verified } but my previous dispute did not ask you for accuracy or validation. 
On { XX/XX/XXXX } you { XXXX, XXXX, Equifax } reported an alleged transaction as Late.

15 U.S. Code 1666b - Timing of payments ( a ) TIME TO MAKE PAYMENTS Acreditormay not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless thecreditorhas adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required bysection 1637 ( b ) of this titleis mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date.

15 USC 1681e ( b ) ( b ) ACCURACY OF REPORT Whenever aconsumer reporting agencyprepares aconsumer reportit shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.

I requested the information that you must have or possess by law in order for you to report a payment as late.

This is being request pursuant rule 1002.

In other words, to properly report information as verified, the furnisher must have sufficient evidence to support the conclusion that the information was true, and in doing this the conditions required by 15 USC 1666b must be met.

You failed to provide the required requested information, you failed to proceed in accordance with the requires for a creditor to treat a payment as late and the evidence that must be sent to you to prove that this transaction was late.

It has been over 30 days and you have not properly verify the information. 
Id. at XXXX ; see also XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ) ( defining verify as [ t ] o prove to be true ; to confirm or establish the truth or truthfulness of ; to authenticate ). 
15 U.S. Code 1681i - Procedure in case of disputed accuracy ( a ) REINVESTIGATIONS OF DISPUTED INFORMATION ( XXXX ) REINVESTIGATION REQUIRED ( A ) In general Subject to subsection ( f ) and except as provided in subsection ( g ), if the completeness or accuracy of any item of information contained in aconsumersfileat aconsumer reporting agencyis disputed by theconsumerand theconsumernotifies the agency directly, or indirectly through areseller, of such dispute, the agency shall, free of charge, conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to determine whether the disputed information is inaccurate andrecordthe current status of the disputed information, or delete the item from thefilein accordance with paragraph ( 5 ), before the end of the 30-day period beginning on the date on which the agency receives the notice of the dispute from theconsumerorreseller.

Importantly, a furnishers inability to conclusively determine that the disputed information is inaccurate does not mean that the furnisher is permitted to report back to the consumer reporting agency that its investigation verified the accuracy of that information. Instead, if the evidence available to the furnisher is insufficient to establish the truth or falsity of the disputed information, then, under the statutory framework, the furnisher must report that its investigation concluded that the disputed information can not be verified. 
XXXX, 827 F.3d at 1304. So, for example, if a furnisher is unable to verify that a consumer missed a payment, then it may be appropriate for the furnisher to delete any mentions of the missed payment while continuing to report other information about the account. 
I am requesting pursuant 15 USC 1681i ( 6 ) NOTICE OF RESULTS OF REINVESTIGATION ( B ) Contents ( iii ) a notice that, if requested by theconsumer, a description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information shall be provided to theconsumerby the agency, including the business name and address of any furnisher of information contacted in connection with such information and the telephone number of such furnisher.

when disputed information can not be verified is to delete that information.

In particular, Section 1681i outlines consumer reporting agencies responsibilities in responding to consumers disputes and, like Section 1681s-2 ( b ), provides that when a disputed item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency must delete or modify it as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation. 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ).

Section 1681i goes on to provide that, [ f ] ollowing any deletion of information which is found to be inaccurate or whose accuracy can no longer be verified, the consumer reporting agency must in some circumstances notify certain people who previously received a report with the now-deleted information. That provision thus contemplates that when information can no longer be verified, the proper response is to delet [ XXXX ] it. See XXXX, XXXX XXXX at XXXX Delete the information you are Reporting as Late from account : XXXX  XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, XXXX XXXX _________________________________ Without XXXX  UCC 1-308

This includes filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and pursuing all available legal remedies. 

I expect confirmation in writing that this fraudulent account has been removed from my credit report within 3 days. Failure to comply will result in further legal action. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative:
Relationship start date : XX/XX/XXXX Installment loan sold : {$30000.00} borrowed Payments to lender as of XX/XX/XXXX : {$47000.00} Contractual monthly payment amount on statement has been paid through XX/XX/XXXX. Statement payment due amount has never aligned with website account detail or payment demands from the lender. It has always been unclear what obligation is. 

Communication ( statements ) are misleading and at times inaccurate. The business tactics can be abusive. For example, the lender sent someone to the borrower 's home XX/XX/XXXX, the reason for the home invasion is unclear.. 

Remaining balance reported by the lender at this time is {$2500.00} lump sum amount Interest/Fees over the life of the loan 40 % ( 15 % interest disclosed at loan origination ) No explanation has been provided for the 40 % interest and fees. 
Fee amounts and allocations inconsistent over the life of the loan and feel deceptive No explanation has been provided for the lump sum amount requested on XX/XX/XXXX. I have exhausted all resources within OneMain Financial last escalation to Executive team resulted in the home invasion associated with the escalation and the lender executive team member was unresponsive to email from the borrower after the home invasion. 

Additional Background ( loan initiation ) From the beginning, the relationship got off to a bad start and before the borrower knew it they were trapped. The borrower did not receive a copy of the loan documents to review until three years after the loan origination. The borrower was dependent on the website and statements, which were different. The account details ( and payment demands ) on the website did not match the statements. The statements changed without notice and details therein were misaligned and, in some cases, inaccurate. The business tactics were forceful and deceptive for no reason ( within the first 3 months ). 

Request for information went unanswered, the borrower was directed to call a designated branch who told them to call back ( allow time for research or processing ). The emails the borrower sent to the branch went unanswered. The borrower was directed to call or received no response. Every escalation outside of the branch was rerouted back to the branch. 

The borrower would never have signed a contract for the interest coupled with the multi-tiered fee structure OneMain Financial implemented. The layered fee structure the lender implemented that was not disclosed and the reporting and allocations were unclear and inconsistent over the life of the loan. The lender represented themselves as a bank providing a typical installment loan ; however, the business model and practices have been unimaginable. For example : o The payment amount requested has been greater than what was contractually required ( based on the statement ) with no explanation. 
o The statements changed without notice. 
o The borrowers ability to understand and manage the account was blocked and changed without notice, including : 1 ) the lender would not share loan documents ; loan documents published on the website more than three years after loan origination ; 2 ) the lender would not update the payment due date, which greatly impacted the borrower ; 3 ) the lender submitted payments that were not authorized and held borrow accountable for any NSF fees ; 4 ) the lender removed borrowers ability to cancel or schedule payments without notice or any reasonable cause ; 5 ) website features for viewing account details changed without notice ; 6 ) the lender did not provide notifications or disclosures ; changes were made and communicated directly in statements on the date they were implemented. Some changes made were not disclosed at all ( the borrower must reconcile on their own changes the lender made ) ; 7 ) there were no escalation channels, as issues surfaced from unanswered questions there was no where to go. 

In the borrower 's final escalation attempt XX/XX/XXXX ( because the account was 45 days delinquent due to misinformation and lender being unresponsive ), OneMain Financial sent someone to the borrowers home shortly after that escalation to repossess collateral ( XXXX XXXX XXXX vehicle ). The borrower received a repossession notice dated for the same day as the home invasion from the individual responding to the escalation ( XXXX XXXX XXXX - XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX did not respond to a follow up email from me after sending the letter or anytime thereafter. At the time of the home invasion {$44000.00} ( which includes 30 % interest and fees ) had been paid against the borrowed amount ( {$30000.00} ) and no notification of default or repossession had been made until that day associated with the escalation. OneMain Financial entered the borrowers home by opening the garage and opening the vehicle but did not take the vehicle ( there was a hook added that the borrower had to remove following these events ). The action by OneMain Financial felt like an act completed to intimidate, ultimately meant to terrorize borrower and the family at the end of life for the loan ( to cause further harm to continue pain and suffering already experienced at the hands of OneMain Financial ). There was no loan security risk or interest that would warrant that home invasion outside of a personal attack based on OneMain Financial actions XXXX. 

Since no good faith effort has worked within OneMain Financial the borrower is submitting a complaint to the CFPB for guidance on how best to handle this situation, specifically to research events XXXX and determine next steps. 

Exhibits and references to corroborate this complaint have been archived.

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to bring to your attention certain inaccuracies on my credit report and to formally notify XXXX of potential legal violations that require immediate attention. 

Identification of Inaccuracies : Upon reviewing my credit report, I have identified several inaccuracies that have adversely affected my financial standing. These inaccuracies include : incorrect balance, late payments, account number, credit limit, date of reported and others inconsistencies. 

Impact on My Financial Well-being : The inaccuracies outlined above have severely affected my creditworthiness and overall financial health. In XX/XX/XXXX, I experienced a major financial setback due to a family emergency, which led me to apply for a personal loan with XXXX XXXX and other creditors offered loans with significantly high interest rates and I have been wrongfully denied which was highly embarrassing and has negatively impacted my lifestyle. This misinformation has had a detrimental impact on my financial options and opportunities. Would you reinvestigate the accounts listed below. 

Account Name : XXXX  XXXX XXXX Number : XXXX Reinvestigate the completeness of every piece of information and if its not accurate, please remove it from my credit report. 

Reference to Relevant Laws : I believe that these inaccuracies violate consumer protection laws, including but not limited to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). The FCRA mandates accurate reporting and stipulates that consumers have the right to dispute and correct inaccuracies on their credit reports. 
Based of consumer law 15 U.S. Code 1681i - Procedure in case of disputed accuracy, if within 30 days you can not verify the accuracy of the information, please remove the account from my credit report. 

Request for Thorough Investigation : I kindly request that XXXX conducts a thorough investigation into the inaccuracies outlined above and takes immediate corrective action. I believe that rectifying these errors is crucial to maintaining the integrity of the credit reporting system and upholding consumer rights. 

Potential Legal Consequences : Please be advised that if these violations are not addressed promptly, I may be compelled to take legal action to protect my rights under the FCRA and other applicable laws. 

Optionally with the proof I am attaching to this letter, you will agree it needs to be removed ASA.

I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and request that you keep me informed of the progress of your investigation. You may reach me at XXXX XXXX to discuss this further. 

Thank you for your understanding and cooperation. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: XXXX XXXX Credit Card with account # XXXX opened on XX/XX/XXXX and a balance of {$11.00}. I was never late on this account. Please show me documentation showing proof of a transaction showing was ever late to support your inaccurate reporting on my account. If you can not supply this, please DELETE this alleged late payment from my credit report per 15 USC $ 1681b Your company is in clear violation of the law. Under 15 USC $ 1681b - permissible purpose of consumer reports, THE LAW CLEARLY STATES : ( a ) IN GENERAL Subject to subsection ( c ) any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : ( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. Did give you written instructions to furnish this on my credit report? Furthermore, the FAIR CREDIT REPORTING ACT 15 USC {$1600.00} ( 2 ) ( a ) ( i ) Exclusions from a consumer credit report clearly states : ( 2 ) EXCLUSIONS. -- Except as provided in paragraph ( 3 ), the term ''consumer report '' does not include -- ( A ) Subject to section 1681s-3 of this title, any -- ( i ) report containing information solely as to transactions or experiences between the consumer and the person making the report. Delete the above late payments from my consumer report, this agency is in violation of 15 USC {$1600.00}. Failure to respond satisfactorly with deletion of the above referenced account, and send out a free copy of my report after the changes have been made will result in legal actions being taken against your company, for which I will also be seeking {$1000.00} per violation for : XXXX. Defamation of Character ( per se ) XXXX. Negligent Enablement of identity Fraud XXXX. Fair Debt Collections Practices Act 15 USC $ 1692g violations XXXX. Fair Credit Reporting Act 15USC {$1600.00} violations for willful noncompliance - 616. Civil liability for wilful noncompliance [ 15 U.S.c. $ 1681n ]. Consumer complaint narrative:
Re : Formal Dispute Letter for Immediate Removal of Inaccurate Accounts To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute the following inaccurate information that appears on my credit report. I have thoroughly reviewed my credit report and have found multiple discrepancies and unverified accounts that are negatively impacting my XXXX XXXX. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I am requesting an immediate reinvestigation of these items and immediate removal from my credit report. 

The details of the disputed items are as follows : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Balance : {$170.00} - This account lacks a conspicuously listed address as required under FCRA XXXX XXXX ; therefore, it can not legally be reported. Remove this immediately. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  This account was reported without valid evidence in violation of FCRA XXXX XXXX. XXXX ( XXXX ). Please remove it immediately. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  - Balance : {$1900.00} - Reported without valid verification in violation of FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( XXXX ). XXXX removal is demanded. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX - XXXX : {$780.00} - No documentation has been provided to verify this collection account. Remove it immediately. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  - XXXX : {$0.00} - There is no evidence justifying the reporting of this account. XXXX removal is requested. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX - Balance : {$1600.00} - Information found to be inaccurate or unverifiable must be deleted as per XXXX U.S.C. XXXX ( XXXX ). Take prompt action to correct my file. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  - Balance : {$290.00} & {$0.00} respectively - These accounts are not recognized by me and I have received no communication regarding them. They must be removed without delay. And both have the same account number different balance. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  - Balance : {$310.00} - This debt has not been validated, thus it violates FCRA XXXX. Remove it at once. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Balance : {$310.00} - Reported as ID theft to the original creditor. It should not be reported ; remove immediately. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  - XXXX : {$570.00} - I am unfamiliar with this account ; see the attached police report. Please remove it. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  - Balance : {$220.00} - Reporting is unsupported by valid evidence, violating FCRA XXXX XXXX. XXXX ( XXXX ). Reinvestigate and delete this item. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  - XXXX : {$110.00} - Lack of a conspicuously listed address necessitates immediate removal of this collection account as per Section XXXX. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  - Balance : {$610.00} - Reportedly without valid evidence, in violation of FCRA XXXX XXXX. XXXX ( XXXX ). Requires removal. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  - XXXX : {$0.00} - As with prior entries, Section XXXX mandates removal due to inaccuracies. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX - Balance : {$100.00} - A medical collection in violation of 15 US Code 1681a ( XXXX ) and must not appear on my credit report. 

The law requires you to respond to my dispute within XXXX  days of receipt of this letter. If after your investigation, any of the above-listed items can not be verified or are found to be inaccurate, they must be corrected or deleted immediately. 
If you require further documentation to assist in your investigation, please contact me promptly so that I may provide it. I expect to hear back from you with the results of your investigation. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to these serious concerns. 

Sincerely, Attachments : police reports, ID, XXXX address, SSN, Dispute letter

Account name : # XXXX, XXXX  Account name : # XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX has violated my rights.

And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In generallf, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. 

and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Sub-issue: Account information incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to file a formal complaint against Experian for their failure to perform due diligence in investigating inaccurate information reported on my credit report. As a consumer, I rely on credit reporting agencies to provide accurate and fair reporting of my credit history. However, Experian has failed to uphold this responsibility. 

Despite my repeated efforts to dispute the inaccurate information, Experian has neglected to conduct a proper investigation as required by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). This negligence constitutes a violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681, which mandates credit reporting agencies to ensure the accuracy of the information they report and to investigate any disputes thoroughly and promptly. 

The continued presence of this inaccurate information on my credit report has caused significant harm to my financial reputation and has resulted in adverse consequences. I have provided Experian with all necessary documentation to support my dispute, yet they have failed to correct the errors within the required time frame. 

I am formally requesting that the CFPB intervene and take the necessary action to ensure that Experian fulfills their legal obligations to investigate and correct inaccurate information. Furthermore, if Experian does not rectify this situation within the next 10 business days, I will seek legal action for defamation and any other applicable claims due to their negligent reporting and failure to correct these inaccuracies. 

I trust that the CFPB will address this matter promptly to prevent further harm to my financial standing and to hold Experian accountable for their failure to comply with federal regulations. 

Thank you for your attention to this serious matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute the following inaccuracies that I have identified on my credit report : XXXX. **Account Name XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  - Account Number : XXXX - Amount : {$830.00} The collection agency has failed to validate this debt despite my requests. I would like to know how this account was verified. Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I demand the immediate removal of this account from my credit report as its presence constitutes a violation. 

XXXX. **Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX  - Account Number : XXXX - Amount : {$960.00} According to section 1681b ( g ) ( 3 ) of this title, certain exclusions are inapplicable for information disclosed to persons related by common ownership or affiliated by corporate control, especially with respect to medical information and lists describing or aggregating payment transactions for medical products or services. I request clarification on the verification of this debt and insist on adherence to the privacy requirements stipulated by law. I demand an immediate removal of this account from my credit report as its presence constitutes a violation. 




XXXX. **Account Name : XXXX  - Account Number : XXXX - Amount : {$20000.00} This account is in violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( 7 ), which pertains to the method of verification. It has been reported without valid evidence to support its validity. I request a thorough reinvestigation and removal of this item. 

XXXX. **Account Name XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX - Amount : {$8200.00} In accordance with 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( 5 ), if an item of information is found to be inaccurate or can not be verified after any reinvestigation, it must be DELETED. This account falls under this statute, and I demand that action be taken to correct my credit file promptly. 

XXXX. **Account Name : XXXX  - Account Number : XXXX - Amount : {$1400.00} I am disputing the validity of this account under 15 U.S. Code 1681i. This law requires that inaccurate or unverifiable information be removed from my credit report after a reinvestigation. This account has been reported without valid evidence of its accuracy. I request a thorough reinvestigation and the immediate removal of this item from my credit report. 

These errors have negatively impacted my credit score and could result in significant harm to my financial standing. I expect a prompt response to this letter, and pursuant to the FCRA, I request that these disputed items be investigated within the statutory timeframe of 30 days. 
Please send me documentation reflecting the outcome of your investigation and the actions taken to rectify these issues on my credit report. 
Should you continue to report these items without properly verifying them, be aware that I am prepared to escalate this matter to ensure my rights under consumer protection laws are fully upheld. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to these serious matters. 
Sincerely, Attachment : copy of the credit report with disputed items highlighted

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Information belongs to someone else
Consumer complaint narrative: This letter is to provide you with knowledge of intent to sue. The lawsuit will filed due to the utter lack of response from your company. When someone is the victim of identity theft, it is simply a nightmare trying to get false information removed from a credit file. I have contacted all of the false creditors listed on my credit file. I have challenged all of the false listings on my credit file. Nothing ever happens to fix the situation. Over 90 days ago I wrote each the creditors in question and demanded proof that I am their customer. I asked for proof of the alleged debt, including specifically the alleged contract or other instrument bearing my signature. So far none of them has been able to provide such proof to me. I have sent follow-up letters to each of them and there is still no proof. I have attempted phone contact, but I simply get transferred around and nothing ever gets accomplished. I have fully investigated my rights in this matter. Under the doctrine of estoppel by silence, XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, I may presume that no proof of the alleged debt, nor therefore any such debt, in fact exists. I have copies of the certified letters and dates prepared to bring to court. Also, under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, these disputed items may not appear on my credit report if they can not be supported by any evidence. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, if they can not verify the debt within 30 days, then it must be removed. Your letters to me claim to have " verified '' the debt, but this is in fact not true under law. Simply contacting the alleged creditor and asking them to match up numbers in their database is no sufficient verification for identity theft. Of course the information matches up. Someone clearly used my information without my authorization. Now I am suing EXPERIAN for being such a pain in the posterior to me. I have provided more than sufficient evidence to get these false accounts removed. Feel free to reach out to address this issue before it escalates legally.. via letter at my address listed at the top of this letter. This matter can be settled simply by your agreement to remove the false information from my credit file. I require a response, on point, in writing, hand signed, and in a timely manner. Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive notice of right to dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
As of today XXXX XXXX XXXX. I herby declare i am unaware of this debt.

According to 15 U.S. Code 1692g - Validation of debts ( a ) Notice of debt ; contents Within five days after the initial communication with a consumer in connection with the collection of any debt, a debt collector shall, unless the following information is contained in the initial communication or the consumer has paid the debt, send the consumer a written notice containing ( 1 ) the amount of the debt ; ( 2 ) the name of the creditor to whom the debt is owed ; ( 3 ) a statement that unless the consumer, within thirty days after receipt of the notice, disputes the validity of the debt, or any portion thereof, the debt will be assumed to be valid by the debt collector ; ( 4 ) a statement that if the consumer notifies the debt collector in writing within the thirty-day period that the debt, or any portion thereof, is disputed, the debt collector will obtain verification of the debt or a copy of a judgment against the consumer and a copy of such verification or judgment will be mailed to the consumer by the debt collector ; and ( 5 ) a statement that, upon the consumers written request within the thirty-day period, the debt collector will provide the consumer with the name and address of the original creditor, if different from the current creditor. I did not have an opportunity. 

I did not recieve any letter or notification from this company within the 5 days of this account being opened. I did not have an opportunity to address the alleged debt prior to this company billing me for it and placing the account along with its experiences on my credit report. If in fact you believe you gave me proper notification, which would give you legal right to assume the debt belongs to me due to unresponsiveness, please send me the ORIGINAL DOCUMENT containing the CERTIFIED RECIPT WITH THE DATE, MY NAME AND SIGNATURE PROVING I RECIEVED IT AND WAS MADE AWARE WITHIN THE PROPER TIME FRAME. 

ALSO, according to 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( a ) ( 2 ) for Permissible purposes of consumer reports A consumer reporting agency may only furnish my information to a third party or affiliate company unless it is for a court case or In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. Please also furnish the ORIGINAL DOCUMENT OF WRITTEN INSTRUCTIONS THAT I GAVE YOUR COMPANY PERMISSION to report this ALLEGED DEBT to a third party without my consent and other affiliates with whom i have no business. THIS LETTER SHOULD ALSO HAVE MY SIGNATURE PROVING IT WAS ME AND I GAVE WRITTEN INSTRUCTION AND AUTHORIZATION TO DO SO. 

You have 30 days from the date of this notice and complaint through the CFPB to furnish the document of me giving your company written consent/instructions to furnish my information to others without my consent and to provide proof via green certified mail receipt, containing my signature, proving that i was made aware of this alleged debt within the 5 days of its inception.

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
Experien and XXXX failed to perform a reinvestigation of a charge-off account reported by XXXX on my credit report. The account in question is listed under XXXX and has been marked which I believe XXXX be inaccurately reported. Experian and XXXX didnot provide the method of the reinvestigation. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681i, I am entitled to an accurate and complete credit report. The FCRA mandates that credit reporting agencies ensure the information in credit reports is both fair and accurate. Inaccurate or incomplete information must be corrected o

r removed. Moreover, the FCRA requires t hat any reported late payments must be accurate and substantiated. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c, late payments must reflect the true nature of the account status. If a late payment entry is incorrect or outdated, it should be promptly rectified.

Failure to comply with these requirements can be considered willful non-compliance under 15 U.S.C. 1681n, which addresses the responsibilities of credit reporting agencies to maintain accurate records and the legal repercussions for failing to do so.

In light of these legal obligations, I request the following information regarding the reinvestigation process : The specific procedures Experian will follow to verify the accuracy of the reported charge-off and any related late payments. 
Details on how communication with XXXX will be managed to obtain updated or corrected information. 
The anticipated timeframe for completing the reinvestigation. 
How and when I will be notified of any changes or updates resulting from this process. 
I expect a thorough reinvestigation and prompt resolution of this matter in compliance with FCRA standards. Please keep me informed of any updates or changes to my credit report.
