Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX XXXX Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Credit Report Information Credit Report Account Number : XXXX Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX Dear [ Credit Bureau Name ], I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate information on my credit report under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ). The account in question is from XXXX XXXX XXXX, with the following details : Account Number : XXXX Balance : {$52.00} Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX Date Opened : XX/XX/year> Payment Status : Seriously past due/ Assigned to attorney, collection agency, or credit XXXX 's internal collection department Balance Date : XX/XX/year> Account Status : Not Satisfying Trade Dispute Basis : No Valid Contract : I do not have any contractual relationship with XXXX XXXX XXXX. Under 15 U.S. Code 1692e of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), debt collectors must not use false, deceptive, or misleading representations. The absence of a direct contract between myself and XXXX XXXX XXXX invalidates the reporting of this debt on my credit report. 

Inaccurate Reporting : The FCRA mandates that all information on a consumer 's credit report must be accurate and verifiable. The information reported by XXXX XXXX XXXX, including the balance and status of this account, is inaccurate. Furthermore, the account was reported as " Seriously past due '' without sufficient evidence or verification of the debt. 

Potential Consumer Rights Violation : Reporting this account as derogatory without a valid contract and sufficient evidence XXXX constitute a violation of my consumer rights under the FCRA. The lack of detailed payment history and unclear status updates further questions the legality of this reporting. 

Request for Resolution : I request that [ Credit Bureau XXXX ] conduct a thorough investigation into this matter. If you are unable to verify the accuracy and legality of this information, I demand that this collections account be removed from my credit report immediately. 

Please notify me of the outcome of your investigation within the XXXX period as required by the FCRA. If the investigation reveals that the information is inaccurate, I request that the account be removed from my credit report and that I be provided with an updated copy of my report. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. If further information or documentation is required, please do not hesitate to contact me. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to formally file a complaint against Experian regarding the following accounts that have been inaccurately reported on my credit report. Despite my efforts to resolve these issues directly with Experian, the incorrect information remains on my credit report, which is negatively impacting my XXXX XXXX. I had disputed these accounts several times and Experian fails to complete a full investigation or remove the account from my credit report. 

Details of the Accounts in Question : XXXXXXXX XXXX, XXXX Account Number : XXXX This account is inaccurately reported as a collection and also shows as an open account which is a collection account should report close. I have never had any dealings with XXXX XXXX, XXXX. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Issue : This account is being reported as unpaid, but I have already settled this account in full with the company. 

XXXX XXXX Account XXXX : XXXX This account is inaccurately showing charged off when it was never delinquent and show a balance and it should have not show a balance because it was a secured card and I was the one who ask them to closed the account and there were no balance on it. As a matter of fact they should be the one paying me my secured deposit back. 

XXXX, XXXX XXXX ( XXXX, NA ) Account Number : XXXX This account is reflecting as a UNKNOWN account which I am not sure who they are and what the account is about or what was the debt for. 

XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
Account XXXX : XXXX This account reporting as a collection which listed inaccurately on my report. I have never had any dealings with XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

Desired Resolution : I request that Experian thoroughly investigate these accounts and take corrective action by removing or correcting the inaccurate information on my credit report. I also ask that they provide written confirmation once these issues have been resolved. 

I have enclosed copies of relevant documentation to support my claims. Please let me know if you need any additional information to resolve this matter. 

Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX Experian XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX. 

For the past 24 months i have submitted certified letter dispute pointing out to the company 1692 FCRA violations REGARDING THE ACCURACY AND COMPLETENESS OF CRA REPORTING INACCURATELY ON MY CREDIT FILE. 

yet they refuse to remove the in accurate INCOMPLET information and account. I have even seek the CFPB assistance SEVERAL TIMES and the inaccurate accounts remains. 
I have been documenting all certified disputes as well as the response given on this CFPB portal. I intend to include as exhibits in my FCRA complaint in federal court if necessary. 

For the last time please take a look at my attachment and follow along : Item # XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX REFORTING TWICE ITEM XXXX XXXX  # XXXX Reporting twice XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX have been reporting account with {$24000.00} balance twice on my credit report for the past 36 months. Once again they reported the same account closed several times twice. closed on XX/XX/XXXX, closed on XX/XX/XXXX and reporting as XXXX seperate accounts on credit report : All three agency reporting the same account last payment as : XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX ( see the attached ) Questions : 1 How can you verify the same account numbers reporting twice on a credit report? 2. How can you say you call the company and verified reporting inaccurate information? 3. How can you close the same account twice at the same time on a credit report? 4. How can the last payment be five ( 5 ) different dates and year??? 


Item # XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX I have never have an account or done business with XXXX XXXX XXXX Bank furthermore ALL CRA IS REPORTING DIFFERENT INFORMATION REGARDING THIS ACCOUNT : Different date account was open, different balance owed, different date of last payment, different date account was closed. 

I have ask for proof but unable to receive a contract from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, they have no record of me signing any contract with them. Yet the credit reporting agency keep verifying inaccurate information and refused to delete. 

Item # XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Inaccurate Item. ALL THREE CRA reporting. different balance, different date account was open, different date of last payment etc. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Inaccurate information I now have enough credit reports to prove FCRA and FDCPA violations and damages done to my credit and life which also include the many times i disputed with the CFPB. 

# XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Fraudulent account with different information reporting on all CRA regarding the same account. 

CRA have all failed to mark the disputed items disputed, another FCRA violation Rather than wasting time on a lawsuit i keep pointing out these errors yet they willingly refuse to remove the inaccurate information from my credit report.

They have all failed to mark each disputed items DISPUTED another FCRA and FDCPA violation which continues to cause damages to me : compensatory and punitive damages. 

XXXX : I am in possession of all credit reports and the response given by all CRA to prove the violations and errors mentioned in all my disputes to the CFPB. 

I am giving them another chance to remove/Delete the disputed items before filing a claim in the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX. 

I will be asking for relief to include compensatory and punitive damages if they continue to report inaccurately and incomplete reporting. 

EXHIBITS 1. Credit Reports 24 months 2. Certified Mailings 3. Written responses from CRA 4. Copies of all CFPB complaint and response from company

Consumer complaint narrative: I filed a complaint on XX/XX/year>, XXXX. and I am writing to formally dispute the account associated with the credit card account ending in XXXX for XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX in the amount of {$12000.00}, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account number XXXX in the amount of {$11000.00} and XXXX  account number XXXX in the amount of {$920.00} which is fraudulently reporting on my credit report. I have repeatedly notified your company that this account does not belong to me and that it was opened without my knowledge or consent. Despite my numerous attempts to resolve this issue, the fraudulent account continues to appear on my credit report with late payments and as a charge-off, severely damaging my credit score. Violations of My Rights : 1. Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) Violations : Under the FCRA, specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681i, I have the right to dispute inaccurate information in my credit report. Your continued reporting of this fraudulent account, despite my numerous disputes, violates my right to have inaccurate or unverifiable information corrected or removed. The FCRA mandates that once a consumer disputes the completeness or accuracy of any item of information, the furnisher ( in this case, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) must conduct a reasonable investigation. Failure to do so or continuing to report inaccurate information constitutes a direct violation of this federal law. 2. Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ) Violations : According to the GLBA, particularly 15 U.S.C. 6802, financial institutions are required to protect the privacy of nonpublic personal information and to provide notice before disclosing such information to nonaffiliated third parties. The fact that this account was fraudulently opened under my name suggests a breach of your duty to safeguard my personal information. This failure has resulted in unauthorized access to my sensitive data, further compounding the violation of my rights under the GLBA. 3. Equal Credit Opportunity Act ( ECOA ) Violations : The ECOA, under 15 U.S.C. 1691, explicitly prohibits creditors from discriminating against any applicant who exercises their rights under the Consumer Credit Protection Act. By refusing to remove this fraudulent account and continuing to report it negatively on my credit, despite my rightful disputes, you are effectively discriminating against me for exercising my rights under federal law. This discrimination, in turn, subjects you to penalties and legal consequences under the ECOA. Actions Requested : Given the clear violations of my rights under these federal statutes, I am formally requesting the following actions : 1. Immediate Removal of the Fraudulent Account : I demand that the fraudulent car loan account be removed from my credit report immediately. This includes removing all associated negative marks, such as late payments and the charge-off status. 2. Cease All Collection Activities : I request that you cease any collection activities related to this fraudulent account, as I did not authorize this loan or any related transactions. 3. Investigation and Response : I request a thorough investigation into this matter, including how my personal information was compromised and how this fraudulent account was opened. Please provide a detailed response outlining the steps taken during the investigation and the results. 4. Confirmation of Action Taken : Once the fraudulent account is removed from my credit report, I request that you provide written confirmation of the removal and any other corrective actions taken. Failure to Honor Request and Discrimination : If you fail to honor my request for the removal of this fraudulent account and continue to report inaccurate information on my credit report, it will be a violation of my rights under the FCRA. Additionally, if you discriminate against me in any way for exercising my rights under the FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 ) or the Equal Credit Opportunity Act ( ECOA ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1691 ), I will pursue all available legal remedies. According to the ECOA : It shall be unlawful for any creditor to discriminate against any applicant, with respect to any aspect of a credit transactionbecause the applicant has in good faith exercised any right under the Consumer Credit Protection Act. Discrimination for exercising my rights is strictly prohibited under federal law and may result in further legal action. Please consider this letter as my formal notice and request for immediate action under the relevant provisions of the FCRA, GLBA, and ECOA. If this issue is not resolved within 30 days, I will be forced to escalate this matter by filing a formal complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and possibly pursuing legal action. I appreciate your prompt attention to this urgent matter. Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am formally disputing the account XXXX XXXX  Acct # XXXX. As mandated by the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), specifically section 1629g, you are legally required to verify this debt. Failure to provide proper verification will result in a violation of federal and state regulations governing debt collection practices. 

Under the FDCPA, your verification must include the following : Proof of my agreement to pay the original creditor ; A copy of the final account statement issued by the original creditor ; A detailed breakdown of the total amount due, including principal, interest, and any additional charges ; Documentation for each charge, including the date and basis for each charge. 
I dispute this debt for the following reasons : [ Insert reason ( XXXX ) for dispute ]. 

Given this dispute, you are legally obligated not to report this debt to any credit reporting agencies. If this debt has already been reported, you must immediately notify the credit reporting agencies that the debt is disputed and remove the tradeline from my credit report. Reporting information you know to be inaccurate, or failing to correct such information, constitutes a violation of the FDCPA and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Furthermore, except for providing verification of this debt, you are required by law to cease all communication with me regarding this matter. Any attempt to contact me in violation of this request will be treated as a breach of your legal obligations under the FDCPA. 

This matter demands your immediate attention. I expect full compliance with all legal requirements without delay. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
This letter serves as a formal dispute regarding the debt reported on my credit file under Account XXXX XXXX. This debt is fraudulent, the result of identity theft, and has absolutely no connection to me. I have never opened an account with XXXX XXXX XXXX, nor have I ever authorized anyone to do so on my behalf. The presence of this erroneous and fraudulent information on my credit report is unacceptable and has caused substantial damage to my creditworthiness. 

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I am exercising my legal right to dispute this debt. You are legally obligated to investigate and remove any inaccurate or fraudulent information from my credit file. 

To substantiate my claim of identity theft, I have enclosed the following documentation : A copy of my police report or FTC Identity Theft Report. 
A copy of my government-issued ID to verify my identity. 
I demand the immediate removal of this fraudulent debt from my credit report. If this issue is not resolved promptly, I will not hesitate to take legal action to enforce my rights under the FCRA and FDCPA. This includes filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and pursuing all available legal remedies. 

I expect confirmation in writing that this fraudulent account has been removed from my credit report within 3 days. Failure to comply will result in further legal action. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt is not yours
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX I filed my 1st CFPB complaint XXXX against XXXX for attempting to collect a debt not owed upon receipt of a letter XX/XX/XXXX. I moved out of the XXXX at XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX was onsite and witnessed the movers taking my things out of the XXXX XXXXXXXX. I turned in the keys to the front desk receptionist after I completed my move on XX/XX/XXXX. I am continuing to receive current monthly rental and lease charges in the amount of {$2000.00} per month plus late fees and charges from Conservice 3rd party billing service the rental property uses. I am concerned about this attempt to collect a debt I do not owe and the negative impact it has on my credit. The actions of XXXX and XXXX at XXXX XXXX is unlawful, deceptive and unfair business practices. Such action is illegal and should be stopped. I disagree with XXXXXXXX XXXX response to CFPB XXXX " National Credit Systems , Inc. is a third-party debt collection agency that is collecting a debt on behalf of The XXXX at XXXX XXXX XXXX. Charges were not assessed by XXXX. XXXX XXXX has disputed her debt, and XXXX has submitted her dispute to the CRAs as required by law. The original creditor contends that the debt is in fact owed and has provided documentation supporting the charges they assessed. If the consumer has additional information supporting her claim ( s ), please have her provide the documents to XXXX for further investigation and action if appropriate. '' I provided a copy of the inspection report that clearly states the date I moved out of the unit. XXXX failed to review this evidence. XXXX lied to CFPB that they were working on a response. However, I received a threatening letter XX/XX/XXXX which I attached to my 2nd CFPB complaint XXXX that was closed as a duplicate. I attached a copy of the threatening demand letter for payment of debt I did not owe from XXXX. I am filing this 3rd CFPB complaint in view of the recent letter I received from XXXX with its proposed resolution amount of {$4200.00}. I am very concerned and upset that XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX d/b/a The XXXX at XXXXXXXX XXXX  continue in their deceptive, unlawful and unfair business practice. This business practice should not be allowed to continue. I am referencing my 2 CFPB complaints in this 3rd complaint because it depicts the company 's deceptive, unfair and unlawful business practice in trying to collect a debt that I do not owe in spite of having provided evidence to the fact that I moved out of the unit and turned in the keys. I do not owe the debt and all debt collection should cease forthwith and with immediate effect.

Please give proof that this account belongs on my credit report and that my rights have not been infringed upon ; otherwise, terminate this account immediately. In compliance to 15 U.S. Code 1692e ( 6 ) Debt collectors are legally obligated to adhere to 15 U.S. Code 1692e ( 6 ), which forbids them from providing false information or insinuating inaccuracies about the nature, amount, or legal standing of a debt. It is against the law to make deceptive statements or misrepresentations concerning the debt being pursued for collection.

And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In generallf, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
This CFPB complaint is being filed to request, pursuant to FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ), that XXXX, as the credit reporting agency, block the information appearing on my consumer credit report that is the result of identity theft and fraud. This action should be completed within 4 business days of receiving this complaint. 

The following is a summary of the fraudulent activity : **Credit Card Fraud : ** - **Account 1 : ** XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX **Date Opened : ** XX/XX/XXXX - **Account Number : ** XXXX - **Amount : {$2200.00} - **Details : ** This account was opened fraudulently under my name. I did not apply for this credit card, and I had no knowledge of this account until it appeared on my credit report. 

- **Account 2 : ** XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX **Date Opened : ** XX/XX/XXXX - **Account Number : ** XXXX - ** Amount : {$11000.00} - **Details : ** Similarly, this account was also opened without my authorization. I did not apply for this credit card, and it was only brought to my attention through my credit report. 

- **Account 3 : ** XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  - **Date Opened : ** XX/XX/XXXX - **Account Number : ** XXXX - ** Amount : {$640.00} - **Details : ** This credit card account was opened fraudulently. I did not authorize or apply for this account. 

**Loan Fraud : ** - **Account 4 : ** XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ( Auto Loan ) - **Date Opened : ** XX/XX/XXXX - **Account Number : ** XXXX - ** Amount : {$16000.00} - **Details : ** This auto loan was opened in my name without my knowledge or consent. I did not apply for or authorize this loan. 

- **Account 5 : XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Personal Loan ) - **Date Opened : ** XX/XX/XXXX - **Account Number : ** XXXX - ** Amount : {$530.00} - **Details : ** This personal loan was also opened fraudulently. I did not apply for or authorize this loan. 

These accounts have led to multiple fraudulent hard inquiries and collections appearing on my consumer FICO credit report. I have attached a list of the hard inquiries in question, along with a copy of the consumer FICO credit report maintained by Experian, which shows the fraudulent items mentioned above. 

I do not recognize the aforementioned accounts, collections, or hard inquiries as reported. These items were not opened, made, or initiated by me, and all are the result of identity theft and fraud. 

To support my claims, I have filed a police report with the XXXX Police Department in Florida regarding this identity theft and fraud and have attached a copy of the report for your reference. Additionally, I have attached a copy of the FTC Identity Theft Criminal Complaint # XXXX as proof from the U.S. Federal Trade Commission that all of the aforementioned consumer credit accounts, collections, and hard inquiries are the result of identity theft and fraud.

Consumer complaint narrative: According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act 15 USC 1681 section 602a states " There is a need to insure that the consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumer 's rights to privacy. '' XXXX, XXXX and Experian are consumer reporting agencies and I am the Consumer. I have the right to make sure my private information isn't shared which is backed by 15 USC 6801 which states " It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers ' nonpublic personal information. '' ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ) is a financial institution by definition under that title. 15 USC 1681 section 604a section 2 states that " in general subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. '' ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ) the financial institutions and the consumer reporting agencies XXXX and Experian do not have my consent to furnish this information and they surely do not have my written consent. Any and all consent to XXXX, Experian, whether it be verbal, non verbal, written, implied or other wise is revoked. 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) states that " A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic information to a nonaffiliated third party unless-the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. '' XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) never informed me of my right to exercise my non-disclosure option. Not only that 15 USC 1681C ( a ) ( 5 ) states 'Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information. Any other adverse item of information, other than records of the convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. '' These accounts are adverse items they are reporting again without my permission which is against the law. 15 U.S. code 1681 e states " Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681 c of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports under section 1681 b of this title. '' XXXX, XXXX and Experian are not maintaining reasonable procedures.

Issue: Threatened to contact someone or share information improperly
Sub-issue: Contacted you after you asked them to stop
Consumer complaint narrative:
Formal Complaint Regarding FDCPA Violations by NetCredit ( Account # XXXX ) Date : XX/XX/year> Complaint Details : I am filing a formal complaint against NetCredit for violating the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), specifically 15 U.S. Code 1692c, which governs communication in connection with debt collection. 

Summary of Violations : I previously filed a complaint with the CFPB under Complaint ID XXXX, opened on XX/XX/year> and closed on XX/XX/year>, regarding NetCredit 's failure to provide proof of debt as required by law. 

On XX/XX/year>, I sent a dispute letter to NetCredit via USPS tracking # XXXX, and again on XX/XX/year>, via USPS tracking # XXXX. In both disputes, I explicitly requested in writing, under 15 U.S. Code 1692c ( c ) - Ceasing Communication, that no telephone contact be made by NetCredit to my home or place of employment. 

Despite this, NetCredit has repeatedly harassed me with telephone calls on XX/XX/year>, XX/XX/year>, XX/XX/year>, XX/XX/year>, XX/XX/year>, XX/XX/year>, and XX/XX/year>. These actions are in direct violation of the FDCPA. 

Legal Basis for the Complaint : Under 15 U.S. Code 1692c ( c ) - Ceasing Communication : If a consumer notifies a debt collector in writing that they refuse to pay a debt or that they wish the debt collector to cease further communication, the debt collector shall not communicate further with the consumer regarding the debt, except under certain conditions. 
NetCredit has failed to comply with this legal requirement by continuing to contact me via telephone, despite my clear written request to cease such communication. 

Request for Action : Given these violations, I request that the CFPB take the following actions : Investigate NetCredit 's repeated violations of the FDCPA. 
Impose appropriate penalties for their non-compliance. 
Ensure that all future communications from NetCredit are conducted in writing, as requested. 
Attached Documentation : To support my complaint, I have attached the following documentation : Copies of the dispute letters were sent to NetCredit with USPS tracking numbers. 
A record of the dates and times of the harassing phone calls from NetCredit. 
I trust that the CFPB will take appropriate action to address these violations and ensure NetCredit 's compliance with federal law. 

Please consider this letter as notice of intent to file a lawsuit, where I reserve my legal right to start litigation without providing future notice. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : **Complaint Regarding FCRA Violations Unauthorized Reporting of Negative Items** Dear CFPB, I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding ongoing violations of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) by XXXX, XXXX, EXPERIAN For over [ 4/5 ] years, I have been disputing the following negative items inaccurately reported on my consumer report : Account Name/Number XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Date XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Date XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Date XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Date XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Date XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Date XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Date XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Date XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX Also I have some inquiries that were added to my report XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX These negative items were reported without proper verification or notice, which constitutes a clear violation of my rights under the FCRA. Specifically : 1. **Failure to Provide Notice** : The creditor failed to provide me with the required notice of adverse action as mandated by Section 615 ( a ) of the FCRA before reporting negative information to the credit bureaus.

2. **Lack of Proper Investigation** : Despite my repeated disputes over the past several years, the credit reporting agency has not conducted a proper investigation or corrected the inaccurate information, violating Section 611 ( a ) of the FCRA.

3. **Privacy Violation** : My privacy rights were violated as my personal information was shared without my explicit consent, contrary to Section 604 of the FCRA.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Against Experian for Violation of Fair Credit Reporting Act Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to file a formal complaint against Experian for its failure to properly investigate and remove inaccurate account information from my credit report in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 USC 611 ). 
Account Information : Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Account Number : XXXX Amount : XXXX I previously submitted a dispute to Experian regarding the inaccuracies in the above-referenced account. Despite providing evidence supporting the inaccuracies and requesting its removal from my credit report, Experian failed to conduct a thorough investigation and the disputed account remains on my credit report. 

As a consumer protected under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I have the right to request the removal of inaccurate or outdated information from my credit report. Experian failure to comply with this law is a violation of my consumer rights and has caused me financial harm and distress. 

I respectfully request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this matter and take appropriate action against Experian for its non-compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act. I am seeking the immediate removal of the inaccurate account information from my credit report and appropriate measures to ensure that Experian upholds its obligations under the law. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to a prompt resolution and your assistance in rectifying this issue.

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: You told them to stop contacting you, but they keep trying
Consumer complaint narrative:
**Your Name : ** XXXX XXXX XXXX : ** XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX **City, State, ZIP : ** XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX **Email XXXX ** XXXX **Phone Number : ** XXXX **Date : ** XX/XX/year> **Subject : ** Urgent Formal Complaint Against CREDIT COLLECTION SERV ( Account Number : XXXX ) -- - **To Whom It May Concern, ** I am writing to bring to your immediate attention a serious matter concerning the inaccurate and potentially unlawful reporting of an account by CREDIT COLLECTION SERV on my credit report. This issue has caused significant distress and potential harm to my financial standing. Despite my best efforts to resolve this matter directly, the situation remains unresolved, prompting me to seek your intervention. 

**Account Details : ** - **Balance : ** {$XXXX} - **Original Balance : ** {$XXXX} - **Account Number : ** XXXX - **Date Opened : ** XX/XX/year> - **Account Type : ** Collection - **Status : ** Collection account, {$XXXX} past due as of XX/XX/year> - **Status Updated : ** XX/XX/year> - **Payment Summary : ** Collection status as of XX/XX/year> **Violations of Federal Laws ( USC Codes ) : ** 1. **15 USC 1692c - Communication in Connection with Debt Collection : ** CREDIT COLLECTION SERV has repeatedly contacted me in ways that violate the protections afforded to consumers under this statute, including contacting me at inappropriate times and through unauthorized channels. 

2. **15 USC 1666b - Prompt Crediting of Payments : ** Payments associated with this account have not been credited in a timely manner, violating this statute, leading to erroneous reporting and unjust financial consequences.

3. **15 USC 1681b - Permissible Purposes of Consumer Reports : ** CREDIT COLLECTION SERV may have accessed my credit report without a legitimate, permissible purpose, violating the guidelines of this statute.

4. **15 USC 1605 - Determination of Finance Charge : ** The finance charges applied to this account may not have been calculated in accordance with the law, in violation of this section of the USC .

5. **15 USC 1681s-2 ( a ) - Responsibilities of Furnishers of Information : ** This statute requires furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies to ensure the accuracy and integrity of the information they report. The reporting by CREDIT COLLECTION SERV appears to violate this responsibility.

6. **15 USC 1692e - False or Misleading Representations : ** This section prohibits debt collectors from using any false, deceptive, or misleading representations. The reporting of this account by CREDIT COLLECTION SERV may involve such misrepresentation.

7. **15 USC 1692g ( b ) - Disputed Debts : ** Under this section, if a debt is disputed by the consumer, the debt collector must cease collection until the debt is verified. I have not received sufficient verification of this debt, and the continued reporting of this account violates this statute.

8. **15 USC 1681e ( b ) - Compliance Procedures : ** This section requires credit reporting agencies to follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information reported. The presence of this disputed account on my report indicates a failure to adhere to these procedures.

Given the numerous potential violations of federal law, I respectfully request that the CFPB conduct a thorough investigation into this matter. I am seeking the immediate removal of this erroneous account from my credit report and a review of the practices employed by CREDIT COLLECTION SERV to prevent future violations.

This issue is of utmost importance to me, and I trust that the CFPB will take swift and decisive action to rectify this situation. Please keep me informed of the progress and outcome of your investigation.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this serious matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Information belongs to someone else
Consumer complaint narrative: I have a credit card that I applied for from XX/XX/XXXX that is mine but its another credit card from XXXX that is issued to my brother that I am currently getting reported on my credit cards. Capital one was notified and still hasnt taken off my credit as of yet. If a furnisher reports information concerning a delinquent account placed for collection, charged to profit or loss, or subject to any similar action, the furnisher must, within 90 days after reporting the information, provide the CRA with the month and the year of the commencement of the delinquency that immediately preceded the action, so that the agency will know how long to keep the information in the consumer 's file. Section 623 ( a ) ( 5 ). Any person, such as a debt collector, that has acquired or is responsible for collecting delinquent accounts and that reports information to CRAs may comply with the requirements of Section 623 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( until there is a consumer dispute ) by reporting the same delinquency date previously reported by the creditor. If the creditor did not report this date, they may comply with the FCRA by establishing reasonable procedures to obtain and report delinquency dates, or, if a delinquency date can not be reasonably obtained, by following reasonable procedures to ensure that the date reported precedes the date when the account was placed for collection, charged to profit or loss, or subjected to any similar action. Section 623 ( a ) ( 5 ). I continually receive emails about the debt of my twin brother XXXX XXXX we have similar names being that I am XXXX XXXX. Our socials are similar and only are XXXX number apart. The emails include my brothers name but continue to be sent to my credit report. Law 15 U.S.C. 1681-1681x states The Act ( Title VI of the Consumer Credit Protection Act ) protects information collected by consumer reporting agencies such as credit bureaus, medical information companies and tenant screening services. Information in a consumer report can not be provided to anyone who does not have a purpose specified in the Act. Companies that provide information to consumer reporting agencies also have specific legal obligations, including the duty to investigate disputed information. In addition, users of the information for credit, insurance, or employment purposes must notify the consumer when an adverse action is taken on the basis of such reports. The Fair and Accurate Credit Transactions Act added many provisions to this Act primarily relating to record accuracy and identity theft. The Dodd-Frank Act transferred to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau most of the rulemaking responsibilities added to this Act by the Fair and Accurate Credit Transactions Act and the Credit CARD Act, but the Commission retains all its enforcement authority. All furnishers must have in place reasonable procedures to respond to notifications from CRAs that information furnished is the result of identity theft, and to prevent refurnishing the information in the future. A furnisher may not furnish information that a consumer has identified as resulting from identity theft unless the furnisher subsequently knows or is informed by the consumer that the information is correct. Section 623 ( a ) ( 6 ). If a furnisher learns that it has furnished inaccurate information due to identity theft, it must notify each consumer reporting agency of the correct information and must thereafter report only complete and accurate information. Section 623 ( a ) ( 2 ). When any furnisher of information is notified pursuant to the procedures set forth in Section 605B that a debt has resulted from identity theft, the furnisher may not sell, transfer, or place for collection the debt except in certain limited circumstances. Section 615 ( f ).

Consumer complaint narrative:
Target bank is showing a balance of XXXX and this account was discharged in bankruptcy. I should be showing a XXXX balance because I am no longer liable for the debt under chapter XXXX bankruptcy laws. I would like Target to change this incorrect to show XXXX it it ruining mt credit worthiness to purchase a home. 
Account number XXXX A bankruptcy discharge is granted by the bankruptcy court to release the debtor permanently from personal liability for certain specified types of debts. In other words, the debtor is no longer legally required to pay any debts that are discharged. The debtor will usually automatically receive a discharge, excepting there is litigation involving objections to the discharge. The discharge prohibits the creditors from taking any form of collection action on discharged debts, including legal action and communications with the debtor. If a creditor attempts collection efforts on a discharged debt, the debtor can file a motion with the court, reporting the action and asking that the case be reopened to address the matter. A creditor can be sanctioned by the court for violating the discharge injunction.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I write to you with deep concern and dissatisfaction regarding the unauthorized inclusion of information in my consumer report, a clear violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681b. This letter serves as an official dispute, urging your agency to conduct an immediate and thorough investigation into this serious breach of my rights. 

Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX I am writing to dispute the accuracy of the information contained in my consumer credit report. Upon recent review, I have discovered entries that violate the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), particularly Section 611, which mandates the maximum possible accuracy of information in a consumer 's file. 

Furthermore, the entries in question were reported without my written permission, contravening the requirements outlined in 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) of the FCRA. As such, I request an immediate, comprehensive, and impartial investigation into these entries. I expect a detailed response outlining the findings of this investigation, including the original written instructions from me ( Consumer ) with my wet signature.

Moreover, I am not aware of any legitimate purpose for reporting these late payments, and I affirm that I did not authorize the reporting of such information to your agency. Therefore, in accordance with Section 604 ( a ) ( 3 ) of the FCRA, I demand a thorough investigation into these disputed late payments, along with written confirmation of the investigation 's completion and details of any actions taken to rectify this matter.

Additionally, I request documentation, including the periodic statement and tracking number, to prove that each periodic statement was delivered to me at least 21 days before the payment due date, as mandated by 15 U.S. Code 1666b.

I request that you provide me with the name and address of the person ( s ) that you contacted to allegedly verify the information that I have rightfully disputed. 

Failure to comply with the legal requirements outlined in this letter will necessitate pursuing all available legal remedies to address this violation of my rights under the FCRA. I trust that your agency will approach this matter with the urgency and seriousness it deserves. 

FCRA Section 607 ( a ) ( 4 ) - Consumer Right to Privacy : You are continuing to report fraudulent accounts on my credit report that do not belong to me, which is a clear infringement upon my privacy rights. As I mentioned before, I have the sole authority to determine what information should be considered private. I insist that my hard inquiries and account information not be shared on my credit report.

FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( 2 ) - Misleading False Reporting : The information you continue to report falsely suggests that I applied for multiple inquiries and accounts, when in reality, these were the result of a scammer\ 's actions. This misleading and unverified reporting is in direct violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and its fairness requirements.

FCRA Section 616 - Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance : Despite my previous dispute, you have failed to verify the accuracy of the credit information you have accepted, thereby demonstrating willful noncompliance. This non-compliance is subject to civil liability of up to {$1000.00} per violation. 

FCRA Section 603 ( d ) ( 2 ) ( A ) - Obligations with Respect to Disclosures of Personal Information : You have yet to fulfill your obligation to disclose my right to opt out of sharing my personal information. This omission is deceptive and a direct violation of my consumer rights. 

FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( 3 ) - Furnishing Deceptive Forms : Despite my previous dispute, you persist in furnishing inaccurate inquiries and accounts without proper validation, which potentially violates Generally Accepted Accounting Principles ( GAAP ). Reporting such deceptive information is unacceptable In addition to the aforementioned violations, I remind you of the previous violations outlined in my initial dispute letter, including the violation of Debt Collection Practices Act, Identity Theft Laws, Acquiring Location Information Regulations, Timely Payments Regulations, Finance Charge Determination, and Credit Report Permissible Purposes. These violations require your immediate attention and resolution. 

In accordance with The Fair Credit Reporting Act, Public law 91-506, Title VI, Section 611, Subsection A-D, please provide the names and business addresses of each individual with whom you verified the above, so that I may follow up.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt was paid
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally request the removal of an account that is inaccurately reported as being in collections on my credit report. The account in question, was paid in full on XX/XX/year>. Despite this, the account continues to be listed under the collections section of my credit report, which is a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Under the FCRA, credit reporting agencies are required to ensure that all information reported on a consumer 's credit report is accurate and up-to-date. Since this account has been paid in full, it should no longer be reported as a collection account. I have attached proof of payment for your review. 

I request that you immediately update my credit report to accurately reflect the paid status of this account and remove any mention of collections.

Consumer complaint narrative:
. Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Information on Credit Report and Detailed Description of Verification Methods Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding the handling of my credit report dispute by Experian XXXX, and XXXX. Despite my efforts to resolve inaccuracies on my credit report, I have encountered several issues that I believe warrant further investigation by the CFPB. 
Background : On XX/XX/year>, I submitted a dispute to Experian XXXX, and XXXX regarding inaccurate information on my credit report. The items in question were not properly verified, yet the agency concluded that the information was accurate. I am concerned about the thoroughness and accuracy of their reinvestigation process. 
Details of the Complaint : XXXX. Inadequate Verification Process : Despite my detailed dispute, the credit reporting agency failed to verify the accuracy of the disputed information adequately. The verification process seems to lack transparency and thoroughness, which raises concerns about its compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
XXXX. Lack of Detailed Verification Methods : I requested a detailed description of the verification methods used by the credit reporting agency, including the specific procedures, sources consulted, documentation reviewed, and criteria for validation. However, this information has not been provided, despite multiple requests. 
XXXX. Timeline of Investigation : There is a lack of clarity on the timeline of the investigation, including key dates and actions taken during the process. This lack of transparency hinders my ability to understand how the investigation was conducted and whether it adhered to FCRA requirements.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative: I logged into my credit card app, which shows my XXXX XXXX  credit score, to discover that it had dropped XXXX points. It was XXXX, so it has effectively been ruined. Apparently XXXX reported to Experian that I had a derogatory account, with a balance of {$350.00} dollars. It states that the account with XXXX was opened in XXXX of 2024 and closed in XXXX of 2024. I have no account with XXXX at all. My father has XXXX, and I am on a family plan with him, but the account is on autopay and is linked to his credit card and SSN. This would in no way impact my score ( plus the payments are up to date ). I called XXXX just to confirm what I already knew, that I had no account with them. They found nothing in their systems under my name and SSN. I filed a dispute with Experian. It makes you create an account with them before you can file a dispute. I noticed after I put my name and social in that it auto-populated my address and asked if the information was accurate. It was not, it was some address in XXXX, VA that I have never lived at in my entire life. I corrected the information and proceeded to file my dispute. It should also be noted that if you look through all of my accounts, not XXXX has ever been late or derogatory, and all of a sudden this XXXX one just pops up. Clearly something is wrong, whether it be a typo or fraud. I just received the results, and they are continuing to say that their information is accurate. I am beyond frustrated as it has ruined my credit and is completely false. Both Experian and XXXX have done little to help, and it seems their is a breakdown somewhere. If I have no account with XXXX, then how could they report a derogatory account with my SSN? Experian clearly did nothing, as I filed the dispute on Friday and received results on a Sunday. I have tried multiple times to call Experian, and it is impossible to speak to a live human being. This is truly ridiculous, and my next best option was to file a complaint, so here I am.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account information incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint to formally request your assistance in correcting incomplete and inaccurate information on my consumer report, which violates my federal consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
I have requested the following information from the compaines that says they own the debts and they haven't provide the following information to me yet. 
Provide breakdown of fees including how you calculated what you claim I owe. 
Then provide a copy of my signature on the contract or document that holds me responsible for this alleged debt.

Verification of the debt amount and its origin.

Documentation proving that I am legally obligated to pay this debt.

Verification of your authority to collect this debt. 
Proof of the validity of the debt, including any contracts or agreements. 

Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account # : XXXX Relevant Statutes : 15 USC 1681 ( Fair Credit Reporting Act ) : Ensures accuracy and privacy of information in consumer reports.

15 USC 1681 Section 602 ( a ) : States that consumers have the right to privacy and that their consumer reports should be maintained with the utmost confidentiality.

15 USC 1681b : Limits the purposes for which a consumer report may be furnished, ensuring that reports are accessed only for permissible purposes.

15 USC 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ) : Specifies the time limits for the inclusion of certain adverse information in consumer reports, ensuring outdated information is not reported. 
Given these violations, I request the CFPB to : Investigate the handling and reporting of the accounts in question. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I trust that the CFPB will take the necessary steps to resolve this issue and uphold my rights as a consumer.

15 U.S. Code 1666b - Timing of payments ( a ) TIME TO MAKE PAYMENTS Acreditormay not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless thecreditorhas adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required bysection 1637 ( b ) of this titleis mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. 
I requested the information that must have or possess by law in order for you to furnish a payment as late. 
This is being request pursuant rule 1002.

In other words, to properly report information as verified, the furnisher must have sufficient evidence to support the conclusion that the information was true, and in doing this the conditions required by 15 USC 1666b must be met.

You failed to provide the required requested information, you failed to proceed in accordance with the requires for a creditor to treat a payment as late. 
It has been over 30 days and you have not properly verify the information. 

Id. at XXXX ; see also XXXX XXXX XXXX ( 11th ed. 2019 ) ( defining verify as [ t ] o prove to be true ; to confirm or establish the truth or truthfulness of ; to authenticate ). 
Importantly, a furnishers inability to conclusively determine that the disputed information is inaccurate does not mean that the furnisher is permitted to report back to the consumer reporting agency that its investigation verified the accuracy of that information. Instead, if the evidence available to the furnisher is insufficient to establish the truth or falsity of the disputed information, then, under the statutory framework, the furnisher must report that its investigation concluded that the disputed information can not be verified. 
XXXX, XXXX XXXX at XXXX. So, for example, if a furnisher is unable to verify that a consumer missed a payment, then it may be appropriate for the furnisher to delete any mentions of the missed payment while continuing to report other information about the account. 
Delete the information you are furnishing to the Consumer Reporting Agencies as late from account. 
Your Name XXXX  XXXX Without Recourse UCC 1-308

Consumer complaint narrative:
Urgent Request for Assistance with Equifax - Human Trafficking Victim Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to seek your urgent assistance regarding a distressing issue I have been facing with Equifax. As a victim of human trafficking, I have made numerous attempts to have fraudulent accounts, opened against my will, removed from my credit report. Unfortunately, Equifax has not addressed these issues despite my efforts, and this is significantly hindering my ability to rebuild my life and support my child as a single mother. 

The following accounts, which were fraudulently opened in my name while I was under duress, remain on my credit report : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX XXXX Amount : {$5100.00} XXXX  XXXX XXXX Account XXXX : XXXX Amount : {$2200.00} XXXX Account Number : XXXX XXXX Amount : {$2700.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account XXXX : XXXX XXXX Amount : {$10000.00} XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX 
Account Number : XXXX XXXX Amount : {$5600.00} XXXX XXXX Account XXXX : XXXX XXXX Amount : {$60000.00} XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX XXXX Amount : {$17000.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Despite providing Equifax with detailed documentation and information about my victim status, the accounts have not been removed. It appears that Equifax 's process is inadequately addressing the unique needs of trafficking survivors and is, in fact, creating additional barriers for us as we try to move forward. 

Given the situation, I kindly request that the CFPB intervene to ensure that Equifax fulfills its obligations to victims of human trafficking by removing these fraudulent accounts from my credit report and revising their process to better accommodate individuals in my position. 

Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter. I appreciate your support in helping me and others in similar circumstances rebuild our lives and secure a better future.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
15 U.S. Code 1681, also known as the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), governs the access to consumer credit report records and how Credit Reporting Agencies ( CRAs ) collect and sell personal information. The FCRA 's purpose is to ensure that CRAs collect and use information in a fair and equitable way that protects consumers ' privacy and promotes accuracy. The FCRA includes several findings and requirements, including : Congressional findings The FCRA states that the banking system relies on accurate and fair credit reporting, and that inaccurate or unfair reporting can harm the banking system and public confidence.

Subchapter requirements The FCRA requires CRAs to use information properly and ensure it's relevant. It also includes compliance procedures, such as requiring CRAs to follow reasonable procedures to ensure the accuracy of their reports, and to allow users of consumer reports to disclose the report 's contents to the consumer. 
I dispute and want this off my credit report.

Consumer complaint narrative: We were approved for a " forbearance on a current account '' while we try to sell this home. We received a notification from all XXXX credit bureaus that our XXXX XXXX balance increased from {$470000.00} to over {$470000.00}. I was extremely confused as there's no reason for our balance to increase while payments are paused. When I called the executive team at XXXX XXXX they confirmed that our balance has not increased, and our payments have simply been paused. They also confirmed that paused payments do not get added to the existing balance of the loan, they just get added to the life of the loan. She said she would inquire about how they reported it, but she said she only shows that it was reported as a forbearance, nothing more. I explained to her that all XXXX credit bureaus are showing an " increased balance '' so it is more than likely not something that the credit agencies are doing and I asked if she could check into this again because something either isnt getting reported correctly, or is being left out. Our balance is the exact same as of today ( XX/XX/XXXX ). It hasn't changed or increased at all. Someone is reporting it to the credit agencies incorrectly and they are adding our paused payments as additional payments and causing a notification of an " increased balance '' instead of reporting them as paused payments. My husband and I both took a XXXX point hit on our credit scores because of this, resulting in damaged credit. We also confirmed with XXXX XXXX that there is no negative reporting to our credit as it is a forbearance on a current account, and we are also under a XXXX XXXX until XX/XX/XXXX regardless. So, the decrease in our scores was simply because of an increased balance, which makes zero sense. This needs to be fixed.

Consumer complaint narrative: In order to comply with FCRA and METRO 2 compliance regulations, my profile must be accurate and thorough. You must finish your information verification within a reasonable time frame and be able to evaluate and confirm all of the information in my credit report. My credit history, as well as the following information, have never been validated or correctly reported. I will exercise my consumer rights by requesting that factually truthful, verifiable, and compliant data be obtained and placed on my credit report. I also require that any mistakes be fixed permanently. Below is a summary of the data in which I am challenging : XXXX. XXXX Inquiry date - XX/XX/XXXX Equifax XXXX. XXXX Inquiry date - XX/XX/XXXX Equifax XXXX. XXXX Inquiry date- XX/XX/XXXX Equifax XXXX. XXXX XXXX Inquiry date - XX/XX/XXXX Equifax XXXX. XXXX Inquiry date XX/XX/XXXX Equifax XXXX. XXXX XXXX Inquiry date - XX/XX/XXXX Equifax XXXX. XXXX Inquiry date - XX/XX/XXXX Equifax XXXX. XXXX Inquiry date - XX/XX/XXXX Equifax Summary of Inquiries being challenged in list form I received a credit report from you that showed a few unfamiliar companies. It looks like they put an inquiry on my file without my knowledge, but this shouldn't be possible unless it was something approved by me first. Under U.S. Code, 15, U.S.C 1681 es seq. Section 604, all users must have a permissible purpose under the Fair Credit Reporting Act to obtain a consumer report. Please have this inquiry removed from my credit file or forward me documentation ( physical proof ) that you have proven permissible purpose for this inquiry. I am reporting that there are some negative items in my credit profile, and I have confirmed that they are not accurate. I dispute these claims and demand that any negative information be removed from the reports immediately. The claims that this information in my report is negative, untrue, incorrect, incomplete, untimely, and not verifiable are unsubstantiated. I have yet to be provided physical verifiable proof that the claims of negativity within my report are true. After reviewing my report, I noticed several deviations from mandatory reporting standards therefore the data in my report can not be accurate and complete! With that said, I refute your allegations and challenge you to provide proof that you have the right to report this incomplete negative information about me. Document that you have complied with the reporting requirements, and report without any deviations. If you have not complied with the requirements or there are any negative aspects below that have been challenged, you must remove them from my report. Per 15 U.S.C 1681e Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates " Also per 12 CFR Part 1022 ( Regulation V ) requires furnishers to : A - Furnish information about accounts or other relationships with a consumer that has integrity. B - Furnish information about accounts or other relationships with a consumer that is accurate. C - Conduct reasonable investigations of consumer disputes According to XXXX, in order to make a lawful report, you must follow the Metro 2 compliance standards. Also as stated in the XXXX Any Deviation From These Standards Jeopardizes the Integrity of The Data. This means that any mistakes in reporting claims can make the information less accurate. This is important to remember because it affects the accuracy of any federally regulated reports. With that said! I found some mistakes and inaccuracies in your report, and I would like to invoke my rights to dispute/challenge these inaccurate and non-compliant items. If you continue to report claims that are not perfect, it shows that you do not care about my rights as a consumer.I don't think it's fair for you to report on me in a way that isn't confirmed to be ethical and meets the standards of certified reporting.The following claims about me were not reported correctly and do not meet federal requirements. I am challenging these claims and asking for proof that the proper reporting standards were followed. I found credit inquiries on my credit report that I don't remember authorizing. This could be a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, and a serious breach of my privacy rights. I would like you to investigate this and get back to me with documentation of these inquiries with my signature on them. If they are found to be fraudulent, I would like them immediately deleted from my credit file. Appreciatively I have listed the concerns I have about your reporting in this document. It is not complete and does not meet my standards. According to the law, you and the data furnishers must certify all aspects of the required FCRA and Metro 2 compliance. This must be done in a truthful, correct, complete, and timely manner as to not violate my consumer and civil rights. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, Section 611 of FCRA, credit bureaus have a responsibility to delete any information from credit reports which is inaccurate or incomplete. This is important to note, as even if an account has only been speculated upon or never confirmed in any way, the burden falls on the credit bureau to provide evidence of its veracity before it can be placed on a credit report. If the information in a credit report is wrong, it was never proven to be factual, and the consumer has the right to take legal action against the credit bureau. Inquiries from a company that I don't remember authorizing need be deleted expeditiously. I understand that you shouldn't be allowed to put an inquiry on my credit file without my authorization, so please remove these inquiries from my credit file immediately. Please forward me documentation that you have investigated and removed the unauthorized inquiries. Appreciatively You are violating my rights! I have listed the concerns about your reporting in this document. It's not complete and does not meet my standards ; according to law, you must certify all aspects of required FCRA/ Metro 2 compliance which is done truthfully, correctly ( in a timely manner ), completely AND accurately as well - or else I would have to escalate these issues to the CFPB , FTC and my Attorney General XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Please send your written response to my address of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX FL XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX XXXX Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Credit Report Information Credit Report Account Number : XXXX Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX Dear XXXX Credit Bureau Name ], I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate information on my credit report under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ). The account in question is from XXXX XXXX XXXX, with the following details : Account Number : XXXX Balance : {$52.00} Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX Date Opened : XX/XX/year> Payment Status : Seriously past due/ Assigned to attorney, collection agency, or credit grantor 's internal collection department Balance Date : XX/XX/year> Account Status : Not Satisfying Trade Dispute Basis : No Valid Contract : I do not have any contractual relationship with XXXX XXXX XXXX. Under 15 U.S. Code 1692e of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), debt collectors must not use false, deceptive, or misleading representations. The absence of a direct contract between myself and XXXX XXXX XXXX invalidates the reporting of this debt on my credit report. 

Inaccurate Reporting : The FCRA mandates that all information on a consumer 's credit report must be accurate and verifiable. The information reported by XXXX XXXX XXXX, including the balance and status of this account, is inaccurate. Furthermore, the account was reported as " Seriously past due '' without sufficient evidence or verification of the debt. 

Potential Consumer Rights Violation : Reporting this account as derogatory without a valid contract and sufficient evidence may constitute a violation of my consumer rights under the FCRA. The lack of detailed payment history and unclear status updates further questions the legality of this reporting.

Request for Resolution : I request that [ Credit Bureau Name ] conduct a thorough investigation into this matter. If you are unable to verify the accuracy and legality of this information, I demand that this collections account be removed from my credit report immediately.

Please notify me of the outcome of your investigation within the 30-day period as required by the FCRA. If the investigation reveals that the information is inaccurate, I request that the account be removed from my credit report and that I be provided with an updated copy of my report.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. If further information or documentation is required, please do not hesitate to contact me. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: My cheaking, saving and credit card account was flagged due to frau. I was told someone had opened another bank account under my name and DOB but with a different SSN. I was not notified of this until I attempted to log into my account using the mobile app. On XX/XX/XXXX I rushed to a branch where I met with the branch manager XXXX in XXXX, AZ. I was told to submit an appeal to have my count reopened. I submitted XXXX & XXXX XXXX, Social Security Card, XXXX XXXX XXXX and 3mo current paystubs as proof of my personal information and SSN to a bank I've been a member with of 5yrs. I was told that the review of the appeal would take up to 15 days. On XXXX XXXX I recevied an email stating that my appeal had been carefull reviewed and the information provided. " In veiew of the unsatifactory manner in which I maintained my previous accounts they are unable to remove th restriction at this time. Not understanding what this means, I drove back to XXXX branch which is a 3hr drive for me for understanding. He was told that the incident is still under investigation. As of now we are past the 15 business day the appeals process states. My account is deposit only, meaning money can come in, but I will have to go into branch to remove funds which is a 3hr drive for me. I have no way pay my mortgage, auto and many other bills electroniclly. Not to mention my direct deposit go 's into this account. Nor do I have a way to pay my credit card bill in which I have with Navy Federal Credit Union. This is no way to treat a Veteran who give 20yrs of service to this company.

Consumer complaint narrative: This letter is to provide you with knowledge of intent to sue. The lawsuit will filed due to the utter lack of response from your company. When someone is the victim of identity theft, it is simply a nightmare trying to get false information removed from a credit file. I have contacted all of the false creditors listed on my credit file. I have challenged all of the false listings on my credit file. Nothing ever happens to fix the situation. Over 90 days ago I wrote each the creditors in question and demanded proof that I am their customer. I asked for proof of the alleged debt, including specifically the alleged contract or other instrument bearing my signature. So far none of them has been able to provide such proof to me. I have sent follow-up letters to each of them and there is still no proof. I have attempted phone contact, but I simply get transferred around and nothing ever gets accomplished. I have fully investigated my rights in this matter. Under the doctrine of estoppel by silence, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, I may presume that no proof of the alleged debt, nor therefore any such debt, in fact exists. I have copies of the certified letters and dates prepared to bring to court. Also, under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, these disputed items may not appear on my credit report if they can not be supported by any evidence. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, if they can not verify the debt within 30 days, then it must be removed. Your letters to me claim to have " verified '' the debt, but this is in fact not true under law. Simply contacting the alleged creditor and asking them to match up numbers in their database is no sufficient verification for identity theft. Of course the information matches up. Someone clearly used my information without my authorization. Now I am suing EQUIFAX for being such a pain in the posterior to me. I have provided more than sufficient evidence to get these false accounts removed. Feel free to reach out to address this issue before it escalates legally.. via letter at my address listed at the top of this letter. This matter can be settled simply by your agreement to remove the false information from my credit file. I require a response, on point, in writing, hand signed, and in a timely manner. If I get another pointless letter from you saying that it has already been " verified '' then there will be no more opportunity for negotiation. This will proceed in court until I have successfully proven to a judge that this false information must be removed from my credit file. I will also be aggressively pursuing the full judgment that I can get against EQUIFAX for violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act and Defamation. Accounts that I didnt authorize and had no knowledge of or reporting accurately, police report and FTC report is on file, Please DELETE THEM Account Name XXXX XXXX XXXX Date open XX/XX/XXXX Account Number XXXX Reason for dispute_IDENTITY THEFT_/UNVERIFIED__ Account Name XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Date open XX/XX/XXXX Account Number XXXX Reason for dispute__IDENTITY THEFT Account Name XXXX XXXX Date open XX/XX/XXXX Account Number XXXX Reason for dispute_IDENTITY THEFT_/UNVERIFIED__Account Name XXXX XXXX Date open XX/XX/XXXX Account Number XXXX Reason for dispute_IDENTITY THEFT_/UNVERIFIED__ Account Name XXXX Date open XX/XX/XXXX Account Number XXXX Reason for dispute__IDENTITY THEFT Account Name XXXX XXXX Date open XX/XX/XXXX Account Number XXXX Reason for dispute_IDENTITY THEFT_/UNVERIFIED__ Account Name XXXX XXXX XXXX Date open XX/XX/XXXX Account Number XXXX Reason for dispute_IDENTITY THEFT_/UNVERIFIED__ Account Name XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Date open XX/XX/XXXX Account Number XXXX Reason for dispute__IDENTITY THEFT Account Name XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX Account Number XXXX Reason for dispute_IDENTITY THEFT_/UNVERIFIED__Account Name XXXX XXXX XXXX Reason for dispute_IDENTITY THEFT_/UNVERIFIED__

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account information incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am reaching out to you in a state of utter desperation. The inaccuracies on my credit report have shattered my dreams, torn apart my sense of security, and left me in a constant state of anxiety. My life is unraveling before my eyes, and I dont know where else to turn. 

I recently filed complaints ( Complaint IDs : XXXX, XXXX, XXXX ) concerning several accounts that are inaccurately reported on my credit file. Despite my best efforts, XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX have told me they can not even find my accounts, leaving me helpless in providing details that I dont have. How can I defend myself against something they claim doesnt exist? 

Because of these errors, my life is falling apart. The car I need to go to work and the home Ive dreamt of owning are both slipping through my fingers. I am mentally and emotionally broken. The weight of this situation is unbearable, and I fear that it could destroy everything Ive worked so hard to build. 

The accounts in question are as follows : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX These accounts are wrongly holding me XXXX, violating my federally protected rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. I reviewed my XXXX credit report on XXXX XXXX XXXX, and was devastated to find glaring inaccuracies that are completely beyond my control. 

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ), consumer reporting agencies are legally required to follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information in consumer reports. Additionally, under 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ), if disputed information is found to be inaccurate or unverifiable, it must be promptly deleted or corrected. And yet, despite these clear legal protections, I remain trapped in this nightmare.

Furthermore, under 15 USC 1681s-2, furnishers are prohibited from providing information they know or have reasonable cause to believe is inaccurate. And yet, my life is being destroyed by false information that continues to haunt me. 

My Previous Complaint Details : Complaint ID : XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX ID : XXXX ( XXXX ) Complaint ID : XXXX ( Equifax ) These complaints remain unresolved, and the inaccuracies persist, wreaking havoc on my life. I am begging youplease, remove this inaccurate information from my credit report. I feel like Im drowning in a sea of injustice, with no way out. This is not just a matter of numbers on a report ; this is my life, my future, and my sanity at stake. I can not bear this burden any longer. 

Please help me fix this before its too late. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
