Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern : I recently received a copy of my credit report and I noticed some account/s on my consumer report that should not be on there. I demand the below accounts deleted from my consumer report immediately. 

XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX The reporting of these account ( s ) is/are violations of 15 USC 1681a , The Fair Credit Reporting Act [ 15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 2 ) ( B ) ] : ( 2 ) EXCLUSIONS.Except as provided in paragraph ( 3 ), the term consumer report does not include ( B ) any authorization or approval of a specific extension of credit directly or indirectly by the issuer of a credit card or similar device ; So let me explain. Under the Truth in Lending Act 15 USC 1602 ( g ), credit card is defined as the following : The term credit card means any card, plate, coupon book or other credit device existing for the purpose of obtaining money, property, labor, or services on credit.

This makes my social security card, drivers license/ID, and license plate credit cards that are/were used for the extension of credit.

I am writing in regard to the above-referenced account/s and transactions. This vehicle was purchased at ( dealership name ) Date ( the date it was purchased ).

I have recently come across inform from the Federal trade Commission ( FTC ) more specifically the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX obligations with respect to disclosures of personal information ( a ) NOTICE REQUIREMENTS Except as otherwise provided in this subchapter, a financial institution may not, directly or through any affiliate, disclose to a nonaffiliated third party any nonpublic personal information, unless such financial institution provides or has provided to the consumer a notice that complies with section 6803 of this title.

( b ) OPT OUT ( 1 ) IN GENERALA financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless ( A ) such financial institution clearly and conspicuously discloses to the consumer, in writing or in electronic form or other form permitted by the regulations prescribed under section 6804 of this title, that such information may be disclosed to such third party ; ( B ) the consumer is given the opportunity, before the time that such information is initially disclosed, to direct that such information not be disclosed to such third party ; and ( C ) the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) did not disclose this information to me that is required by federal law.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ) knowingly and willfully withheld pertinent information regarding the disclosure of my information to affiliated and unaffiliated third parties.

( XXXX XXXX XXXX ) knowingly and willfully withheld information that explained how I the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option.

( XXXX XXXX XXXX ) did not disclose this information to me that is required by federal law.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) knowingly and willfully withheld pertinent information regarding the disclosure of my information to affiliated and unaffiliated third parties.

( Auto dealership name ) knowingly and willfully withheld information that explained how I the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option.

You are in violations of several federal law you have 10 calendar days from the receipt of this letter to delete this account from all credit reporting agencies that you have furnished this information to along with all my Consumer reports that this information is on. Should you decide to discriminate against me for future business and or product because I exercised my rights under this or any chapter I will be coming after you for damages and I will use the contents of this correspondence as proof of such decision.

15 USC 1691 a ( 3 ) ( a ) ACTIVITIES CONSTITUTING DISCRIMINATION It shall be unlawful for any creditor to discriminate against any applicant, with respect to any aspect of a credit transaction ( 1 ) on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, sex or marital status, or age ( provided the applicant has the capacity to contract ) ; ( 2 ) because all or part of the applicants income derives from any public assistance program ; or ( 3 ) because the applicant has in good faith exercised any right under this chapter. 
Best Regards XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: This CFPB complaint is being filed to request, pursuant to FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ), that XXXX, XXXX the credit reporting agency, block the information appearing on my consumer XXXX credit report that is the result of identity theft and fraud.This action should be completed within XXXX business days of receiving this complaint.The following is a summary of the fraudulent activity XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  This account was opened fraudulently under my name. I did not apply for this credit card, and I had no knowledge of this account until it appeared on my credit report. - XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Similarly, this account was also opened without my authorization. I did not apply for this credit card, and it was only brought to my attention through my credit report. - XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  This credit card account was opened fraudulently. I did not authorize or apply for this account. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  This auto loan was opened in my name without my knowledge or consent. I did not apply for or authorize this loan. - XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  This personal loan was also opened fraudulently. I did not apply for or authorize this loan. These accounts have led to multiple fraudulent hard inquiries and collections appearing on my consumer FICO credit report. Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I am writing to file a formal complaint against the following accounts listed on my credit reports, which have violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. These violations are detailed below : Violations : 15 U.S.C 1681 Section 602 ( a ) : This section affirms my right to privacy, which has been compromised by the improper furnishing and handling of my personal information.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 ( a ) ( 2 ) : This section clearly states that a consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written instructions, which has not been provided in these cases.

15 U.S.C 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ) : This section prohibits the inclusion of any adverse information in a consumer report that is more than seven years old. The accounts listed below contain adverse information that predates the legally allowed time frame.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) : This section prohibits the furnishing of information that is known to be inaccurate. The accounts listed below contain inaccuracies that have been reported despite reasonable cause to believe they were incorrect.

15 U.S.C. 6802 : I did not receive the required opt-out notice at the time of account creation, which violates my right to opt-out from the reporting of non-public information.

List of Accounts : Below is the list of accounts that have violated the aforementioned sections of the FCRA and other related laws : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint to formally request your assistance in correcting incomplete and inaccurate information on my consumer report, which violates my federal consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
I have requested the following information from the companies that says they own the debts, and they haven't provided the following information to me yet. 
Provide breakdown of fees including how you calculated what you claim I owe. 
Then provide a copy of my signature on the contract or document that holds me responsible for this alleged debt.

Verification of the debt amount and its origin.

Documentation proving that I am legally obligated to pay this debt.

Verification of your authority to collect this debt.

Proof of the validity of the debt, including any contracts or agreements. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Relevant Statutes : 15 USC 1681 ( Fair Credit Reporting Act ) : Ensures accuracy and privacy of information in consumer reports.

15 USC 1681 Section 602 ( a ) : States that consumers have the right to privacy and that their consumer reports should be maintained with the utmost confidentiality.

15 USC 1681b : Limits the purposes for which a consumer report may be furnished, ensuring that reports are accessed only for permissible purposes.

15 USC 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ) : Specifies the time limits for the inclusion of certain adverse information in consumer reports, ensuring outdated information is not reported.

Given these violations, I request the CFPB to : Investigate the handling and reporting of the accounts in question.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I trust that the CFPB will take the necessary steps to resolve this issue and uphold my rights as a consumer.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I write to you with deep concern and dissatisfaction regarding the unauthorized inclusion of information in my consumer report, a clear violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681b. This letter serves as an official dispute, urging your agency to conduct an immediate and thorough investigation into this serious breach of my rights. 

XXXX XXXX I am writing to dispute the accuracy of information contained in my consumer credit report. Upon recent review, I have discovered entries that violate the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), particularly Section 611, which mandates the maximum possible accuracy of information in a consumer 's file. 

Furthermore, the entries in question were reported without my written permission, contravening the requirements outlined in 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) of the FCRA. As such, I request an immediate, comprehensive, and impartial investigation into these entries. I expect a detailed response outlining the findings of this investigation, including the original written instructions from me ( Consumer ) with my wet signature. 

Moreover, I am not aware of any legitimate purpose for reporting these late payments, and I affirm that I did not authorize the reporting of such information to your agency. Therefore, in accordance with Section 604 ( a ) ( 3 ) of the FCRA, I demand a thorough investigation into these disputed late payments, along with written confirmation of the investigation 's completion and details of any actions taken to rectify this matter. 

Additionally, I request documentation, including the periodic statement and tracking number, to prove that each periodic statement was delivered to me at least 21 days before the payment due date, as mandated by 15 U.S. Code 1666b.

I request that you provide me with the name and address of the person ( s ) that you contacted to allegedly verify the information that I have rightfully disputed. 

Failure to comply with the legal requirements outlined in this letter will necessitate pursuing all available legal remedies to address this violation of my rights under the FCRA. I trust that your agency will approach this matter with the urgency and seriousness it deserves. 

FCRA Section 607 ( a ) ( 4 ) - Consumer Right to Privacy : You are continuing to report fraudulent accounts on my credit report that do not belong to me, which is a clear infringement upon my privacy rights. As I mentioned before, I have the sole authority to determine what information should be considered private. I insist that my hard inquiries and account information not be shared on my credit report. 

FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( 2 ) - Misleading False Reporting : The information you continue to report falsely suggests that I applied for multiple inquiries and accounts, when in reality, these were the result of a scammer\ 's actions. This misleading and unverified reporting is in direct violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and its fairness requirements. 

FCRA Section 616 - Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance : Despite my previous dispute, you have failed to verify the accuracy of the credit information you have accepted, thereby demonstrating willful noncompliance. This noncompliance is subject to civil liability of up to {$1000.00} per violation. 

FCRA Section 603 ( d ) ( 2 ) ( A ) - Obligations with Respect to Disclosures of Personal Information : You have yet to fulfill your obligation to disclose my right to opt out of sharing my personal information. This omission is deceptive and a direct violation of my consumer rights. 

FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( 3 ) - Furnishing Deceptive Forms : Despite my previous dispute, you persist in furnishing inaccurate inquiries and accounts without proper validation, which potentially violates Generally Accepted Accounting Principles ( GAAP ). Reporting such deceptive information is unacceptable In addition to the aforementioned violations, I remind you of the previous violations outlined in my initial dispute letter, including the violation of Debt Collection Practices Act, Identity Theft Laws, Acquiring Location Information Regulations, Timely Payments Regulations, Finance Charge Determination, and Credit Report Permissible Purposes. These violations require your immediate attention and resolution. 

The entries in question were reported without my written permission, contravening the requirements outlined in 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) of the FCRA. As such, I request an immediate, comprehensive, and impartial investigation into these entries. I expect a detailed response outlining the findings of this investigation, including the original written instructions from me ( Consumer ) with my wet signature.

The information reported is incorrect, and despite my previous attempts to resolve this matter, the inaccuracies persist. These inaccuracies have caused significant disruption in my life and household, affecting my financial stability and well-being. 

In accordance with 1681e ( b ), which mandates that you use reasonable procedures to ensure MAXIMUM ACCURACY, and 1681i, which requires you to delete or correct information found to be inaccurate, I request that you immediately delete this account from my credit report. 

Please provide written confirmation once this account has been removed. Additionally, kindly update my credit report and inform me of any changes made. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Subject : **Complaint Regarding FCRA Violations Unauthorized Reporting of Negative Items** Dear CFPB, I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding ongoing violations of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) by XXXX, EQUIFAX, XXXX For over [ 4/5 ] years, I have been disputing the following negative items inaccurately reported on my consumer report : Account Name/Number XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX These negative items were reported without proper verification or notice, which constitutes a clear violation of my rights under the FCRA. Specifically : 1. **Failure to Provide Notice** : The creditor failed to provide me with the required notice of adverse action as mandated by Section 615 ( a ) of the FCRA before reporting negative information to the credit bureaus.

2. **Lack of Proper Investigation** : Despite my repeated disputes over the past several years, the credit reporting agency has not conducted a proper investigation or corrected the inaccurate information, violating Section 611 ( a ) of the FCRA.

3. **Privacy Violation** : My privacy rights were violated as my personal information was shared without my explicit consent, contrary to Section 604 of the FCRA.

Consumer complaint narrative: Dispute Authorization and Multiple Violations of Fair Credit Reporting Act I '' hereby authorize this dispute. It is important to note that this dispute was not sent by an unauthorized third party or credit clinic, '' I am writing to address the ongoing violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) that have yet to be resolved, despite my previous dispute letter. The violations are as follows : FCRA Section 607 ( a ) ( 4 ) - Consumer Right to Privacy : You are continuing to report fraudulent accounts on my credit report that do not belong to me, which is a clear infringement upon my privacy rights. As I mentioned before, I have the sole authority to determine what information should be considered private. I insist that my hard inquiries and account information not be shared on my credit report. FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( 2 ) - Misleading False Reporting : The information you continue to report falsely suggests that I applied for multiple inquiries and accounts, when in reality, these were the result of a scammer 's actions. This misleading and unverified reporting is in direct violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and its fairness requirements. FCRA Section 616 - Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance : Despite my previous dispute, you have failed to verify the accuracy of the credit information you have accepted, thereby demonstrating willful noncompliance. This noncompliance is subject to civil liability of up to {$1000.00} per violation. FCRA Section 605B - Aggravated Identity Theft : Your continued sharing of my personal information with numerous creditors without obtaining my consent is a criminal act of aggravated identity theft. I remind you that this offense carries a penalty of up to 2 years of imprisonment. FCRA Section 603 ( d ) ( 2 ) ( A ) - Obligations with Respect to Disclosures of Personal Information : You have yet to fulfill your obligation to disclose my right to opt out of sharing my personal information. This omission is deceptive and a direct violation of my consumer rights. FORA Section 623 ( a ) ( 3 ) - Furnishing Deceptive Forms : Despite my previous dispute, you persist in furnishing inaccurate inquiries and accounts without proper validation, which potentially violates Generally Accepted Accounting Principles ( GAAP ). Reporting such deceptive information is unacceptable In addition to the aforementioned violations, I remind you of the previous violations outlined in my initial dispute letter, including the violation of Debt Collection Practices Act, Identity Theft Laws, Acquiring Location Information Regulations, Timely Payments Regulations, Finance Charge Determination, and Credit Report Permissible Purposes. These violations require your immediate attention and resolution. Once again, I demand that you take immediate action to address these violations and fulfill the following requests : Unauthorized inquiry : XXXX  Date of inquiry : XX/XX/2022 DELETE!!!

Consumer complaint narrative: NOTICE TOAGENT IS NOTICE TO PRINCIPLE NOTICE TO PRINCIPLE IS NOTICE TO AGENT I am writing to formally dispute the information you have reported on my credit report maintained by your company. I assert that your company is subject to the arbitration agreement as stated on your company 's website, as well as the arbitration proceedings provided by XXXX. I am fully aware of the financial implications associated with initiating arbitration proceedings, I am offering you a one-time opportunity to settle. You can compensate me with {$6000.00} for the mental distress, XXXX emotional distress, and financial hardship this inaccurate reporting has caused me. Additionally, you must delete the disputed trade-in from all reporting agencies. Here is a breakdown of the costs you will incur if this matter proceeds to arbitration : - Filing fee for both parties- Arbitration initiation fee- Arbitration deposit - Legal costs incurred throughout the arbitration process According to ADR.org, these costs will be covered by you, and they can amount to tens of thousands of dollars. Therefore, it is in your best interest to settle this dispute amicably. I also demand that you cease and desist all illegal activities related to this matter, including any form of communication other than through mail. As per 15 USC 1692c ( c ), you are prohibited from contacting me via any other means once you receive this notice. This statute states : " 15 USC 1692c ( c ) - If a consumer notifies a debt collector in writing that the consumer refuses to pay a debt or that the consumer wishes the debt collector to cease further communication with the consumer, the debt collector shall not communicate further with the consumer with respect to such debt. '' Please respond to this letter within 15 days to confirm the removal of the disputed trade line and your agreement to compensate me for the damages incurred. Failure to respond will result in the initiation of arbitration proceedings, which will be significantly more costly for your company. Please send all correspondence related to this matter to the address listed below. Issue of Matter : Dept of Education/XXXX Account ID : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX FL XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Against Equifax for Violation of Fair Credit Reporting Act Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to file a formal complaint against Equifax for its failure to properly investigate and remove inaccurate account information from my credit report in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 USC 611 ). 

Account Information : Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Account Number : XXXX Amount : {$480.00} I previously submitted a dispute to Equifax regarding the inaccuracies in the above-referenced account. Despite providing evidence supporting the inaccuracies and requesting its removal from my credit report, Equifax failed to conduct a thorough investigation and the disputed account remains on my credit report. 

As a consumer protected under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I have the right to request the removal of inaccurate or outdated information from my credit report. Equifax failure to comply with this law is a violation of my consumer rights and has caused me financial harm and distress. 

I respectfully request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this matter and take appropriate action against Equifax for its non-compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act. I am seeking the immediate removal of the inaccurate account information from my credit report and appropriate measures to ensure that Equifax upholds its obligations under the law. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to a prompt resolution and your assistance in rectifying this issue.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2, data furnishers are required to provide complete and accurate information to credit reporting agencies. Reporting an incorrect or inflated amount, particularly after a charge-off, constitutes a violation of this statute. If the balance includes fees, interest, or charges that are unlawful or inaccurately represented, it must be corrected or removed from my credit report.

Violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) Furthermore, under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S. Code 1692e ( 2 ), debt collectors are prohibited from making false or misleading representations about the amount, character, or legal status of a debt. If the reported amount includes unlawful fees, interest, or other charges, it is a violation of this federal law. My rights have been violated under the Fair Debt Collection Practice Act and Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2

Product: Mortgage
Sub-product: Home equity loan or line of credit (HELOC)
Issue: Applying for a mortgage or refinancing an existing mortgage
Sub-issue: Changes in loan terms during the application process
Consumer complaint narrative:
Id like to file a formal complaint into NFCUs illegally accessing my bank, XXXX and illegally taking money out of my accounts without my permission and engaging in unfair lending and dept collection practices NOW and in the Past, as this is retaliation for reporting NFCU for discrimination and unfair lending practices and dept collection with my HELO application from XX/XX/year>. 

Recently, on XX/XX/year>, I was contacted by NFCU claiming that my HELO had not been paid since XX/XX/year>, and stated on a recorded line that I was over {$1000.00} dollars in arears. I manually pay my HELO monthly out of my XXXX account and I have faithfully paid all NFCU bills that were sent to me. 

I do not trust NFCU to access my accounts, as I was discriminated against by XXXX when applying for this HELO and subjected to unfair lending and dept collection practices when NFCU tried to force me to sign loan documents without disclosing the terms of that agreement because they had added 3-interest points as I was a single female and didnt have a man as a co-signer or a man on my propertys title. 

When I tried on XX/XX/year> to access my accounts online, NFCU had locked me out of all my accounts. After 2 hours on the phone, I gained access to my account, only to learn that they had denied my XX/XX/year> payment from XXXX, a payment in full for XX/XX/year> of {$380.00}. While on the phone with NFCU, I submitted payment of {$500.00} to cover XX/XX/year> and any fees they were going to charge me. 

Without my permission, NFCU withdrew both {$500.00} and {$380.00} from my XXXX account. I complained to the online representative that it was illegal to withdraw funds from my account without my permission. The representative told me, on a recorded line, that it was NFCU policy to take 2 months, the XXXX and the XXXX payment. I reminded him that he did not have my permission to take next months payment out of my XXXX account and I wanted that amount returned to my XXXX account. He refused to refund my money. The representative stated that the XX/XX/year> payment NFCU had illegally withdrew from my XXXX account would be posted as my XX/XX/year> payment. It was not! Now I am now being called by NFCU collections claiming my account is in arrears. 

This bank/credit union is engaging in illegal acts, unfair leading practices, and they have openly preyed upon me and discriminated against me. I have only had this HELO since XX/XX/year>- and they can not stop retaliatory harassing me. 

What I would like as a remedy to their retaliatory and unabated and uncorrected discrimination, harassment, and unfair lending and dept collection practices is for NFCU to forgive in total my HELO and close it. And or for NFCU pay all fees/loan points associated with moving all my NFCU accounts, saving/checking, Home Loan, and HELO to another lending institution of my choosing, one that does not engage in illegal acts against its customers and members. And with both both options, they must repair any damage they have done to my credit history. 

I will agree to sever all ties now and future with NFCU, when they agree and comply with the above remedy.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Public record information inaccurate
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to lodge an urgent and forceful complaint against XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion regarding their persistent failure to remove an inaccurate bankruptcy entry from my credit reports ; Account number XXXX. Despite my numerous efforts to provide ample and irrefutable evidence proving the error, these credit bureaus have unacceptably continued to display this erroneous information.

This process began in XXXX of 2023, yes a full year and they have not resolved it, where I disputed with the court ( attached ). The court states that it doe snot supply information to the Bureaus. I submitted Disputed to XXXX, XXXX, and Transunion on XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX, to no avail. When they finally sent information back, they stated that it is verified by a 3rd party called XXXX XXXX. So I submitted a dispute to XXXX XXXX in XXXX. XXXX XXXX said I was correct about the inaccurate bankruptcy and removed it from their files ( attached documentation ). I submitted another Dispute to the bureaus in XXXX with the letters sent by XXXX XXXX and Trans Union said it was verified, which is impossible. XXXX and XXXX did not even respond ( illegals ) Here is a summary of the egregious missteps by the credit bureaus : Failure to Correct Errors : Despite providing all necessary evidence, each bureau has inexplicably failed to correct the inaccuracy. Their responses have been dismissive and inadequate, lacking any substantive action to rectify the mistake.

Negligent Handling of Disputes : The process followed by the credit bureaus in handling my dispute has been grossly inefficient and unprofessional. Their failure to resolve the dispute in a timely manner reflects a troubling disregard for consumer rights.

Impact on Creditworthiness : The erroneous bankruptcy record is significantly damaging my creditworthiness and, consequently, my financial stability. This ongoing issue has led to undue stress and has negatively impacted my ability to secure credit.

I demand immediate action to rectify this situation. Specifically, I require : Prompt Removal : Immediate removal of the inaccurate bankruptcy entry from all three credit reports.

Written Confirmation : Written confirmation from each credit bureau acknowledging the removal and detailing the corrective actions taken.

Investigation and Accountability : A thorough investigation into the handling of my dispute, including a detailed explanation of why my evidence was ignored and what measures will be implemented to prevent such issues in the future.

If these demands are not met within 15 days from the date of this letter, I will be compelled to escalate this matter further, including but not limited to seeking legal redress and filing formal complaints with additional regulatory bodies.

The lack of action and accountability from XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion is unacceptable and reflects a serious breach of my consumer rights. I trust that the CFPB will act swiftly to ensure that this matter is resolved with the seriousness it warrants.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Notice to Agent is Notice to Principal, Notice to Principal is Notice to Agent You replied that the alleged transaction you furnished as late was { accurate/ verified } choose the response they used } ] but my previous dispute did not ask you for accuracy or validation. 
you furnished to { XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX } } an alleged transaction as Late.

15 U.S. Code 1666b - Timing of payments ( a ) TIME TO MAKE PAYMENTS Acreditormay not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless thecreditorhas adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required bysection 1637 ( b ) of this titleis mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date.

I requested the information that must have or possess by law in order for you to furnish a payment as late.

This is being request pursuant rule 1002. 
In other words, to properly report information as verified, the furnisher must have sufficient evidence to support the conclusion that the information was true, and in doing this the conditions required by 15 USC 1666b must be met. 
You failed to provide the required requested information, you failed to proceed in accordance with the requires for a creditor to treat a payment as late. 
It has been over 30 days and you have not properly verify the information. 

Id. at 1303 ; see also Blacks Law Dictionary ( 11th ed. 2019 ) ( defining verify as [ t ] o prove to be true ; to confirm or establish the truth or truthfulness of ; to authenticate ). 
Importantly, a furnishers inability to conclusively determine that the disputed information is inaccurate does not mean that the furnisher is permitted to report back to the consumer reporting agency that its investigation verified the accuracy of that information. Instead, if the evidence available to the furnisher is insufficient to establish the truth or falsity of the disputed information, then, under the statutory framework, the furnisher must report that its investigation concluded that the disputed information can not be verified.

Hinkle, 827 F.3d at 1304. So, for example, if a furnisher is unable to verify that a consumer missed a payment, then it may be appropriate for the furnisher to delete any mentions of the missed payment while continuing to report other information about the account. 
Delete the information you are furnishing to the Consumer Reporting Agencies as late from account. 

XXXX XXXX _________________________________ Without Recourse UCC 1-308

Subject : **Complaint Regarding FCRA Violations Unauthorized Reporting of Negative Items** Dear CFPB, I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding ongoing violations of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) by TRANSUNION, XXXX, XXXX For over [ 4/5 ] years, I have been disputing the following negative items inaccurately reported on my consumer report : Account Name/Number XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX Also I have some inquiries that were added to my report XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX These negative items were reported without proper verification or notice, which constitutes a clear violation of my rights under the FCRA. Specifically : 1. **Failure to Provide Notice** : The creditor failed to provide me with the required notice of adverse action as mandated by Section 615 ( a ) of the FCRA before reporting negative information to the credit bureaus.

2. **Lack of Proper Investigation** : Despite my repeated disputes over the past several years, the credit reporting agency has not conducted a proper investigation or corrected the inaccurate information, violating Section 611 ( a ) of the FCRA.

3. **Privacy Violation** : My privacy rights were violated as my personal information was shared without my explicit consent, contrary to Section 604 of the FCRA.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dispute Authorization and Multiple Violations of Fair Credit Reporting Act I '' hereby authorize this dispute. It is important to note that this dispute was not sent by an unauthorized third party or credit clinic, '' I am writing to address the ongoing violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) that have yet to be resolved, despite my previous dispute letter. The violations are as follows : FCRA Section 607 ( a ) ( 4 ) - Consumer Right to Privacy : You are continuing to report fraudulent accounts on my credit report that do not belong to me, which is a clear infringement upon my privacy rights. As I mentioned before, I have the sole authority to determine what information should be considered private. I insist that my hard inquiries and account information not be shared on my credit report. FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( 2 ) - Misleading False Reporting : The information you continue to report falsely suggests that I applied for multiple inquiries and accounts, when in reality, these were the result of a scammer 's actions. This misleading and unverified reporting is in direct violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and its fairness requirements. FCRA Section 616 - Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance : Despite my previous dispute, you have failed to verify the accuracy of the credit information you have accepted, thereby demonstrating willful noncompliance. This noncompliance is subject to civil liability of up to {$1000.00} per violation. FCRA Section 605B - Aggravated Identity Theft : Your continued sharing of my personal information with numerous creditors without obtaining my consent is a criminal act of aggravated identity theft. I remind you that this offense carries a penalty of up to 2 years of imprisonment. FCRA Section 603 ( d ) ( 2 ) ( A ) - Obligations with Respect to Disclosures of Personal Information : You have yet to fulfill your obligation to disclose my right to opt out of sharing my personal information. This omission is deceptive and a direct violation of my consumer rights. FORA Section 623 ( a ) ( 3 ) - Furnishing Deceptive Forms : Despite my previous dispute, you persist in furnishing inaccurate inquiries and accounts without proper validation, which potentially violates Generally Accepted Accounting Principles ( GAAP ). Reporting such deceptive information is unacceptable In addition to the aforementioned violations, I remind you of the previous violations outlined in my initial dispute letter, including the violation of Debt Collection Practices Act, Identity Theft Laws, Acquiring Location Information Regulations, Timely Payments Regulations, Finance Charge Determination, and Credit Report Permissible Purposes. These violations require your immediate attention and resolution. Once again, I demand that you take immediate action to address these violations and fulfill the following requests : Unauthorized Inquiry : XXXX XXXX  Date of inquiry : XX/XX/year> DELETE!!! 

Unauthorized Inquiry : XXXX XXXX Date of inquiry : XX/XX/year> DELETE!!! 

Unauthorized Inquiry : XXXX XXXX  XXXX Date of inquiry : XX/XX/year> DELETE!!!

Consumer complaint narrative:
The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. 
Collection account 1. XXXX XXXX XXXX Original creditor XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX mos ) 2. XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX ( XXXX mos ) has violated my rights. 
I looked at my transUnion credit report on XXXX XXXX and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. And according to the fair credit reporting act Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ). 


And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In generallf, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

XXXX, Trans Union and XXXX has been notified 4 times each in XXXX, XXXX, XXXX and in XXXX Asking them to send me a contract from each company making a claim i owe them Money and they all have failed to respond with evidence that the Alleged debit belongs to me, its been 8 months and this has cause me great grief in my life it has hindered me for securing a place to live, obtain credit to improve my livelihood here are the names of the Company 's who have refused to abide by the laws and verify the Alleged debit or remove it from my personal credit report according to : UNDER FCRA SECTION 616 & SECTION 617, Section 616 and Section 617 if the UNVERIFIED items listed below are not deleted immediately.

You have NOT provided me a copy of ANY original documentation ( a consumer contract with my signature on it ) as required under Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) & Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). Furthermore you have failed to provide the method of verification as required under Section 611 ( a ) ( 7 ). Please be advised that under Section 611 ( 5 ) ( A ) of the FCRA you are required to promptly DELETE all information which can not be verified. 
The law is very clear as to the Civil liability and the remedy available to me ( Section 616 & 617 ) if you fail to comply with Federal Law. I am a litigious consumer and fully intend on pursuing litigation in this matter to enforce my rights under the FCRA. 

XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : Alleged Amount {$5400.00}, on XXXX it says " Closed '' on Transunion it Says " Closed '' and on XXXX it says " Closed '' Why is it still on the report?

XXXX : Alleged Amount {$830.00}, On the TransUnion Report it say " Open '', but has Been Removed for the XXXX and XXXX Reports, Why is that? 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX : Alleged Amount {$340.00} : On the Transunion report status is " Open '' XXXX Status is " Closed '' and On the XXXX it has been removed why is that? 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX : Alleged Amount {$890.00}, On Transunion Status is " Open '' and Has been Removed from the XXXX and XXXX Reports, Why is that?.

Consumer complaint narrative: This letter is to provide you with knowledge of intent to sue. The lawsuit will filed due to the utter lack of response from your company. When someone is the victim of identity theft, it is simply a nightmare trying to get false information removed from a credit file. I have contacted all of the false creditors listed on my credit file. I have challenged all of the false listings on my credit file. Nothing ever happens to fix the situation. Over 90 days ago I wrote each the creditors in question and demanded proof that I am their customer. I asked for proof of the alleged debt, including specifically the alleged contract or other instrument bearing my signature. So far none of them has been able to provide such proof to me. I have sent follow-up letters to each of them and there is still no proof. I have attempted phone contact, but I simply get transferred around and nothing ever gets accomplished. I have fully investigated my rights in this matter. Under the doctrine of estoppel by silence, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, I may presume that no proof of the alleged debt, nor therefore any such debt, in fact exists. I have copies of the certified letters and dates prepared to bring to court. Also, under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, these disputed items may not appear on my credit report if they can not be supported by any evidence. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, if they can not verify the debt within 30 days, then it must be removed. Your letters to me claim to have " verified '' the debt, but this is in fact not true under law. Simply contacting the alleged creditor and asking them to match up numbers in their database is no sufficient verification for identity theft. Of course the information matches up. Someone clearly used my information without my authorization. Now I am suing TRANSUNION for being such a pain in the posterior to me. I have provided more than sufficient evidence to get these false accounts removed. Feel free to reach out to address this issue before it escalates legally.. via letter at my address listed at the top of this letter. This matter can be settled simply by your agreement to remove the false information from my credit file. I require a response, on point, in writing, hand signed, and in a timely manner. If I get another pointless letter from you saying that it has already been " verified '' then there will be no more opportunity for negotiation. This will proceed in court until I have successfully proven to a judge that this false information must be removed from my credit file. I will also be aggressively pursuing the full judgment that I can get against TRANSUNION for violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act and Defamation. Accounts that I didnt authorize and had no knowledge of or reporting accurately, police report and FTC report is on file, Please DELETE THEM Account Name XXXX XXXX XXXX  Date open XX/XX/XXXX Account Number XXXX Reason for dispute_IDENTITY THEFT_/UNVERIFIED__ Account Name XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Date open XX/XX/XXXX Account Number XXXX Reason for dispute__IDENTITY THEFT Account Name XXXX XXXX Date open XX/XX/XXXX Account Number XXXX Reason for dispute_IDENTITY THEFT_/UNVERIFIED__Account Name XXXX XXXX Date open XX/XX/XXXX Account Number XXXX Reason for dispute_IDENTITY THEFT_/UNVERIFIED__ Account Name XXXX Date open XX/XX/XXXX Account Number XXXX Reason for dispute__IDENTITY THEFT Account Name XXXX XXXX Date open XX/XX/XXXX Account Number XXXX Reason for dispute_IDENTITY THEFT_/UNVERIFIED__ Account Name XXXX XXXX XXXX Date open XX/XX/XXXX Account Number XXXX Reason for dispute_IDENTITY THEFT_/UNVERIFIED__ Account Name XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Date open XX/XX/XXXX Account Number XXXX Reason for dispute__IDENTITY THEFT Account Name XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number XXXX Reason for dispute_IDENTITY THEFT_/UNVERIFIED__Account Name XXXX XXXX XXXX Reason for dispute_IDENTITY THEFT_/UNVERIFIED__

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
Notice of Legal Violations Credit Report Inaccuracies I am writing to bring to your attention certain inaccuracies on my credit report and to formally notify TransUnion of potential legal violations that require immediate attention. 

Identification of Inaccuracies : Upon reviewing my credit report, I have identified several inaccuracies that have adversely affected my financial standing. These inaccuracies include : incorrect balance, late payments, account number, credit limit, date of reported and others inconsistencies. 

Impact on My Financial Well-being : The inaccuracies outlined above have severely affected my creditworthiness and overall financial health. In XX/XX/XXXX, I experienced a major financial setback due to a family emergency, which led me to apply for a personal loan with XXXX XXXX  and other creditors offered loans with significantly high interest rates and I have been wrongfully denied which was highly embarrassing and has negatively impacted my lifestyle. This misinformation has had a detrimental impact on my financial options and opportunities. Would you reinvestigate the accounts listed below. 

Account Name : XXXX XXXX  XXXX Number : XXXX Reinvestigate the completeness of every piece of information and if its not accurate, please remove it from my credit report. 

Reference to Relevant Laws : I believe that these inaccuracies violate consumer protection laws, including but not limited to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). The FCRA mandates accurate reporting and stipulates that consumers have the right to dispute and correct inaccuracies on their credit reports. 
Based of consumer law 15 U.S. Code 1681i - Procedure in case of disputed accuracy, if within 30 days you can not verify the accuracy of the information, please remove the account from my credit report. 

Request for Thorough Investigation : I kindly request that TransUnion conducts a thorough investigation into the inaccuracies outlined above and takes immediate corrective action. I believe that rectifying these errors is crucial to maintaining the integrity of the credit reporting system and upholding consumer rights. 

Potential Legal Consequences : Please be advised that if these violations are not addressed promptly, I may be compelled to take legal action to protect my rights under the FCRA and other applicable laws. 

Optionally with the proof I am attaching to this letter, you will agree it needs to be removed ASA. 

I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and request that you keep me informed of the progress of your investigation. 

Thank you for your understanding and cooperation. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

As my credit is being cleaned up you can see that XXXX found out that I paid long ago and they removed the account but my credit used to be great and then the second XXXX XXXX closed all three my credit report an XXXX went to XXXX overnight. Consumer complaint narrative:
Notice to agent is notice to principal notice to principal is notice to agent You [ XXXX, Transunion, XXXX replied that the alleged transaction you furnished as late was { accurate/ verified } but my previous dispute did not ask you for accuracy or validation. 
On { XX/XX/XXXX } you { XXXX, Transunion, XXXX } reported an alleged transaction as Late.

15 U.S. Code 1666b - Timing of payments ( a ) TIME TO MAKE PAYMENTS Acreditormay not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless thecreditorhas adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required bysection 1637 ( b ) of this titleis mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date.

15 USC 1681e ( b ) ( b ) ACCURACY OF REPORT Whenever aconsumer reporting agencyprepares aconsumer reportit shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.

I requested the information that you must have or possess by law in order for you to report a payment as late.

This is being request pursuant rule 1002.

In other words, to properly report information as verified, the furnisher must have sufficient evidence to support the conclusion that the information was true, and in doing this the conditions required by 15 USC 1666b must be met.

You failed to provide the required requested information, you failed to proceed in accordance with the requires for a creditor to treat a payment as late and the evidence that must be sent to you to prove that this transaction was late.

It has been over 30 days and you have not properly verify the information.

Id. at 1303 ; see also Blacks Law Dictionary ( 11th ed. 2019 ) ( defining verify as [ t ] o prove to be true ; to confirm or establish the truth or truthfulness of ; to authenticate ).

15 U.S. Code 1681i - Procedure in case of disputed accuracy ( a ) REINVESTIGATIONS OF DISPUTED INFORMATION ( 1 ) REINVESTIGATION REQUIRED ( A ) In general Subject to subsection ( f ) and except as provided in subsection ( g ), if the completeness or accuracy of any item of information contained in aconsumersfileat aconsumer reporting agencyis disputed by theconsumerand theconsumernotifies the agency directly, or indirectly through XXXX, of such dispute, the agency shall, free of charge, conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to determine whether the disputed information is inaccurate XXXX current status of the disputed information, or delete the item from XXXX accordance with paragraph ( XXXX ), before the end of the XXXX period beginning on the date on which the agency receives the notice of the dispute from XXXX. 

Importantly, a furnishers inability to conclusively determine that the disputed information is inaccurate does not mean that the furnisher is permitted to report back to the consumer reporting agency that its investigation verified the accuracy of that information. Instead, if the evidence available to the furnisher is insufficient to establish the truth or falsity of the disputed information, then, under the statutory framework, the furnisher must report that its investigation concluded that the disputed information can not be verified.

Hinkle, 827 F.3d at 1304. So, for example, if a furnisher is unable to verify that a consumer missed a payment, then it may be appropriate for the furnisher to delete any mentions of the missed payment while continuing to report other information about the account.

I am requesting pursuant 15 USC 1681i ( 6 ) NOTICE OF RESULTS OF REINVESTIGATION ( B ) Contents ( iii ) a notice that, if requested by theconsumer, a description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information shall be provided to theconsumerby the agency, including the business name and address of any furnisher of information contacted in connection with such information and the telephone number of such furnisher.

when disputed information can not be verified is to delete that information.

In particular, Section 1681i outlines consumer reporting agencies responsibilities in responding to consumers disputes and, like Section 1681s-2 ( b ), provides that when a disputed item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency must delete or modify it as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation. 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ).

Section 1681i goes on to provide that, [ f ] ollowing any deletion of information which is found to be inaccurate or whose accuracy can no longer be verified, the consumer reporting agency must in some circumstances notify certain people who previously received a report with the now-deleted information. That provision thus contemplates that when information can no long
er be verified, the proper response is to delet [ e ] it. See XXXX, XXXX XXXX at XXXX Delete the information you are Reporting as Late from account : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, XXXX XXXX _________________________________ Without Recourse UCC 1-308

CFPB, 15 U.S. Code 1681- Congressional findings and statement of purpose ( 2 ) An elaborate mechanism has been developed for investigating and evaluating the credit worthiness, credit standing, credit capacity, character, and general reputation of consumers.

( 3 ) Consumer reporting agencies have assumed a vital role in assembling and evaluating consumer credit and other information on consumers.

( 4 ) There is a need to insure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers.FCRA Impermissible Use Meaning Much of the information in a consumers credit report is sensitive. It should be protected to avoid identity theft and potential embarrassment if the consumer is delinquent on payments or has other debt issues.

There are limited purposes for companies and/or individuals to access your credit report. If you do not specifically give a company written permission, they may not access your credit information. If they do without valid purpose or permission, it is impermissible use. And it is illegal. ( TRANSUNION ) is in Violation of the FCRA. I did not give Oral, Written Consent for there company to disclose XXXX XXXX XXXX Account on my credit report.

Consumer complaint narrative:
To whom this may concern, After reviewing my credit reports I noticed that you are alleging that the following accounts are negative without furnishing any proof of verification of this debt or that you followed all laws and regulations to report therefore you must remove all negative and adverse remarks. 

The inaccuracies involve the following accounts : From XXXX XXXX XXXX - **Account Number : XXXX ( XXXX XXXX ) Miss payment - **Account Number : XXXX ( XXXX XXXX ) Miss Payment As you know it is against the law to report any information not proven accurate. 

I demand that you provide me with concrete evidence of my obligation to said accounts. 
( If These Matters Have Been properly taken care of please disregard ) Please be aware that all negative remarks found on my credit report is a violation of the FCRA and FDCPA when you can not furnish the validity of the remark. 
I am not in dispute of the ownership of the account but if you are unable to provide the full reports of how you validated, verified, and how you are in compliance then you must remove the negative information or the account from my credit report. Also According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act 15 USC 1681 section 602 a states " There is a need to insure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. '' TransUnion and XXXX are consumer reporting agencies and I Am the Consumer. Which would certainly have the right to Assert that my private information is not shared which is backed by 15 USC 6801 which states " It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information. '' is a financial institution by definition under that title. 15 USC 1681 section 604 ( a ) section 2 states that " In general Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. '' The financial institution and the Consumer reporting agencies Transunion and XXXX do not have my consent to furnish this information and they surely do not have my written consent. Any and all consent to Transunion, XXXX, whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written, implied or otherwise is revoked. 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) states that " A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise. that nondisclosure option. '' i was Never informed of my right to exercise my nondisclosure option. Not only that 15 USC 1681C ( a ) ( 5 ) states '' Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), but no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. '' This account is an adverse item they are reporting again without my permission which is against the law. 15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A states " A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 15 U.S. Code 1681e states '' Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681c of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681b of this title. Transunion and XXXX are not maintaining reasonable procedures. Also 12 CFR 1016.7 states that " A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. '' I am opting out of your reporting services.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt was paid
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally request the removal of an account that is inaccurately reported as being in collections on my credit report. The account in question, was paid in full on [ XX/XX/year> ]. Despite this, the account continues to be listed under the collections section of my credit report, which is a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Under the FCRA, credit reporting agencies are required to ensure that all information reported on a consumer 's credit report is accurate and up-to-date. Since this account has been paid in full, it should no longer be reported as a collection account. I have attached proof of payment for your review. 

I request that you immediately update my credit report to accurately reflect the paid status of this account and remove any mention of collections.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with fair credit reporting Act. These accounts has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681 account : XXXX XXXX XXXX account number : XXXX account : XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX amount : {$100.00} account : XXXX XXXX account number : XXXX amount : {$730.00} account : XXXX XXXX amount : {$100.00} I looked at my transunion credit report on XX/XX/year> and noticed some thing are inaccurate and incomplete. and according to the Fair Credit Reporting Act whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow proper procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ).

And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In generallf, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. 

and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account information incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Credit Report Information Credit Report Account Number : XXXX Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Dear CFPB I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate information on my credit report under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ), which gives me the right to dispute information I believe to be inaccurate or incomplete. 

The account in question is from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, a collections company, with which I have no contractual relationship. Specifically, the details are as follows : Account Number : XXXX Balance : {$2400.00} Date Opened : XX/XX/year> Payment Status : Seriously past due/ Assigned to attorney, collection agency, or credit grantor 's internal collection department Last Reported : XX/XX/year> Dispute Basis : No Contractual Relationship : Under 15 U.S. Code 1692e of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), debt collectors are required to report accurate information and must not use any false, deceptive, or misleading representations. I do not have any contractual agreement with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, which invalidates the reporting of this debt on my credit report. 

Inaccurate Reporting of Debt : The FCRA mandates that all information on a consumer 's credit report must be accurate and verifiable. Since there is no contract or agreement between myself and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, the accuracy of this reported debt is in question. Additionally, the absence of payment history and the derogatory information reported without adequate evidence further violates the FCRA. 

Potential Violation of Consumer Rights : The continued reporting of this account as derogatory, without proper verification and in the absence of a valid contract, may constitute a violation of my consumer rights under the FCRA. Additionally, the failure to provide complete information about the payment history and the terms of the alleged debt raises concerns about the legality of this reporting.

Request for Resolution : I request that [ Credit Bureau Name ] conduct a thorough investigation into this matter. If you are unable to verify the accuracy and legality of this information, I demand that this collections account be removed from my credit report immediately.

Please notify me of the outcome of your investigation within the 30-day period as required by the FCRA. If the investigation reveals that the information is inaccurate, I request that the account be removed from my credit report and that I be provided with an updated copy of my report.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. If further information or documentation is required, please do not hesitate to contact me. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Against Transunion for Violation of Fair Credit Reporting Act Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to file a formal complaint against Transunion for its failure to properly investigate and remove inaccurate account information from my credit report in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 USC 611 ). 
Account Information : Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Account Number : XXXX Amount : XXXX I previously submitted a dispute to transunion regarding the inaccuracies in the above-referenced account. Despite providing evidence supporting the inaccuracies and requesting its removal from my credit report, Transunion failed to conduct a thorough investigation and the disputed account remains on my credit report. 

As a consumer protected under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I have the right to request the removal of inaccurate or outdated information from my credit report. Transunion failure to comply with this law is a violation of my consumer rights and has caused me financial harm and distress. 

I respectfully request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this matter and take appropriate action against Transunion for its non-compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act. I am seeking the immediate removal of the inaccurate account information from my credit report and appropriate measures to ensure that Transunion upholds its obligations under the law. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to a prompt resolution and your assistance in rectifying this issue.

TransUnion has processed your request and forwarded a copy of the Investigation Results through US mail. You should expect to receive those results in approximately 7 business days. We have mailed a copy of your TransUnion credit report to the current address we have on file for you. You can expect to receive it in approximately 7 business days In response to your request to block fraudulent information appearing on your credit report, we sent you a letter to inform you we were unable to block the information for the reason described in the letter and we investigated the information by contacting the creditors to verify the accuracy of the information. In response to your request for a description of the dispute procedure, we sent you a letter listing the actions we take : TransUnion reviews all available relevant information and contacts the data furnisher to verify the accuracy of the information if we are unable to make the change based on the information you provided, we update our records with the information the creditor provides in response to the dispute, and then we send you the results of the investigation including the contact information of the company that verified the data so you can contact them directly if needed.

Violating my rights under FCRA 605 ( b ) ( 15 U.S. Code 1681c2 ) -Block of information resulting from identity theft. 

TRANSUNION violated my rights under the FCRA by failing to remove all items on my credit report as a result of identity theft and Fraud. 
TRANSUNION failed to remove the items listed in their CFPB response in section 2 above and update my credit file. 

TRANSUNION has removed several accounts and collections from my report and reinserted the information on my report. Failing to notify me of this reinsertion in writing not later than 5 business days after the reinsertion or, if authorized by the consumer for that purpose, by any other means available to the agency. Violating my rights under FCRA 15 USC 1681i ( 5 ) ( b ) ( ii ) - Procedure in case of disputed accuracy. Violating my rights under FCRA 15 USC 1681 I ( 5 ) ( a ) ( i ) - Treatment of inaccurate and unverifiable information. 

TRANSUNION in violation of my right under the following FCRA laws : 1. FCRA 605 ( b ) ( 15 U.S. Code 1681c2 ) -Block of information resulting from identity theft.

2. FCRA 15 USC 1681i ( 5 ) ( b ) ( i ) 3. FCRA 15 USC 1681i ( 5 ) ( b ) ( ii ) 4. 15 USC 1681 Section 602 ( A ) - Right to Privacy 5. 15 USC 1681 Section 604 ( A ) Section 2- States a consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written consent and instructions.

FCRA15 USC 1681n 15 USC 1681n ( 1 ) ( a ) and ( b ) Civil liability for willful noncompliance and FCRA 15 USC 1681n ( 2 ) ( b ) -Civil liability for knowing noncompliance states : Any person who obtains a consumer report from a consumer reporting agency under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose shall be liable to the consumer reporting agency for actual damages sustained by the consumer reporting agency or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater.

In XX/XX/year>, pursuant to the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, my wife and Is student loan in the amount of {$XXXX} with ED Financial was forgiven. 
XXXX continues to incorrectly report this account this account as owing {$XXXX} ( The other credit bureaus have removed it. ) I have twice filed complaints with XXXX ( XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX & XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX : XXXX ) ) to get the balance removedagain, as the other XXXX reporting agencies ( XXXX and XXXX ) have correctly done.

Product: Prepaid card
Issue: Problem with a purchase or transfer
Sub-issue: Card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase or transfer
Consumer complaint narrative: On XXXX I transferred {$1800.00} from my XXXX prepaid credit card to my XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX checking account via the Money Network website. The money was never deposited, in spite of receiving a confirmation of the transfer request. Customer service said there was an error and the money would be returned to my debit card in XXXX business days. That did not happen either. I filed a dispute claim, as instructed, and included screenshots of the transaction, with my correct bank information listed, and the confirmation. I received a letter stating that my claim was denied, without explanation. I have reached out several times, over the last XXXX months, both by telephone and email. Customer service can not help me and tell me to send an email to the prepaid card dispute address and those inquiries are ignored. I never get a response. There has been no XXXX trace, that I am aware of, or any kind of investigation to see what happened to my money and where it went. It is the equivalent of almost a month 's worth of unemployment benefits. I am unable to get a hold of anyone that can/will help me resolve the matter. At this point, I consider it fraud and theft. I have filed a complaint with the FDIC, FTC and OCC. I have also written my local and state representatives. I have updated my XXXX account, as they now offer direct deposit, so I will never have to deal with Money Network again.

We successfully completed all three payments and were told that our new monthly payment would be {$2200.00} due to our successful completion of the trial period. On XX/XX/XXXX our loan was sold to Flagstar Bank. They told us that they never received our payment for the month of XXXX. Ive requested it be escalated and still there has been no progress on our case. On XX/XX/XXXX they wouldnt accept our mortgage payment for {$2200.00} because it wasnt the amount of {$2900.00} which we had modified. Please help

Product: Checking or savings account
Issue: Problem with a lender or other company charging your account
Sub-issue: Transaction was not authorized
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX XX/XX/2024 RE : DEMAND FOR IMMEDIATE ACTION ON DISPUTE CLAIM ID : XXXX Account Number Ending In : XXXX Primary Claim ID : XXXX Original Dispute Amount : {$2400.00} Revised Dispute Amount : {$2400.00} Date of Initial Dispute Filing : XX/XX/2024 Type of Dispute : Debit - Unauthorized Transactions To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to express my severe frustration and outright dissatisfaction with Chime 's handling of my dispute, which I initially filed on XX/XX/2024. It is appalling that a financial institution like Chime would repeatedly fail to uphold its obligations under the Electronic Fund Transfer Act ( EFTA ) and Regulation E. Your institutions behavior in this matter has been nothing short of egregious, demonstrating a clear pattern of unfair and deceptive practices that will not be tolerated. 

Timeline of Dispute XXXX : XX/XX/2024 : I filed an initial dispute for unauthorized transactions totaling {$2400.00} across 92 transactions. Despite providing clear evidence that my account was compromised, Chime denied my claim in less than 24 hours. It is impossible for any reasonable investigation, let alone one involving coordination with other financial institutions and merchants, to be completed in this timeframe. 

XX/XX/2024 : I requested documentation of the supposed " investigation. '' Chime responded by providing only my Intake Form and the evidence I submitted. There was absolutely no indication that a proper investigation, including the filing of chargebacks, had been conducted. 

XX/XX/2024 : After submitting a rebuttal, Chime once again produced the same incomplete documentation, confirming that no actual investigation was carried out. Your institutions negligence in this matter is unacceptable. 

XX/XX/2024 : After directly contacting XXXX of the merchants involved, I received a credit of {$31.00}, which Chime conveniently acknowledged separately, reducing the disputed amount to {$2400.00}. Chimes decision to isolate this transaction and revise the claim amount reeks of an attempt to downplay the severity of the issue. 

XX/XX/2024 : Chime again erroneously closed my dispute, claiming no error occurred, despite my ongoing communications with multiple merchants conducting internal fraud investigations. This demonstrates a clear disregard for the truth and a deliberate effort to avoid your responsibilities under Regulation E. 

XX/XX/2024 : I filed a second rebuttal, providing further evidence of unauthorized transactions and communication with merchants. Chimes continued refusal to address this information and coordinate with merchants as you are obligated to do, is a blatant violation of my consumer rights. 

XX/XX/2024 : Just days before the 10-business-day deadline to avoid issuing the provisional credit I am entitled to, Chime once again denied my dispute, failing to perform chargebacks or investigate properly. This is a deliberate attempt to evade your legal responsibilities. 

Additional Example of Unfair Practices : Claim ID XXXX XX/XX/2024 : I filed a separate dispute for 12 unauthorized transactions totaling {$95.00} ( Claim ID : XXXX ). As expected, Chime denied this claim without conducting any investigation or coordinating with the merchant, XXXX, which is also involved in Claim ID XXXX. However, after I reached out to XXXX directly, they confirmed fraud and issued a full refund. 

XX/XX/2024 : Chime then reversed its position on this claim, acknowledging the error and crediting my account. This pattern of initially denying disputes only to acknowledge them after I, the customer, do your job for you, is absolutely unacceptable and further illustrates Chimes unfair and deceptive practices. 

DEMAND FOR IMMEDIATE ACTION : It is beyond clear that Chime has failed in its duty to protect its customers from unauthorized transactions. I am demanding that Chime : XXXX. Reopen Dispute Claim ID XXXX and properly investigate unauthorized transactions. This investigation must include the filing of chargebacks and coordination with the merchants involved. 

XXXX. Issue Provisional Credit* for the full disputed amount of {$2400.00} immediately**, as you have failed to resolve this matter within the timeframe required by law. 

XXXX. Provide a Written Explanation : detailing all actions taken, including chargebacks and communications with merchants, to resolve these disputes. 

I am filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) today, using this letter as the basis for my complaint. Your actionsor lack thereofdemonstrate a clear pattern of unfair and deceptive practices that violate consumer protection laws, including the EFTA and Regulation E. If I do not receive a satisfactory response within **5 business days** I will escalate this matter further, including filing a complaint with the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) and exploring all legal avenues available to hold Chime accountable. 

I expect a prompt and comprehensive response to this letter. Failure to address these issues will result in further action, and I will ensure that Chime 's practices are brought to the attention of the appropriate regulatory bodies. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX [ Account Number Ending In : XXXX ] [ Claim ID : XXXX ]
