Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Personal information incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to bring to your attention a serious issue with my credit report that I have been unable to resolve despite multiple attempts. My credit report contains an incorrect name and address, and there are accounts listed under this incorrect information that do not belong to me. I have only one correct name and one correct address, which I have provided above.

1. Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) - 15 U.S.C. 1681 The inclusion of incorrect name and address information on my credit report violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which mandates that credit reporting agencies maintain accurate and complete information. Under the FCRA, I have the right to dispute inaccurate information, and the credit reporting agencies are required to investigate and correct these errors within 30 days.

2. Violation of the Fair and Accurate Credit Transactions Act ( FACTA ) - Address Discrepancy Rules The incorrect information on my credit report also implicates the Fair and Accurate Credit Transactions Act ( FACTA ). The Act requires that any substantial discrepancies in address information be addressed and resolved by the credit reporting agencies. Failure to comply with these provisions can result in significant harm to consumers.

3. Potential Financial Compensation for Violations Under the FCRA, if the credit reporting agencies fail to correct these errors or continue to report inaccurate information, I may be entitled to monetary compensation. Specifically : Actual Damages : I may recover actual damages incurred as a result of the errors, such as increased interest rates, denied credit, or other financial losses.

Statutory Damages : In cases of willful non-compliance, I may be entitled to statutory damages ranging from {$100.00} to {$1000.00} per violation.

Punitive Damages : In cases of willful or reckless violations, the court may award punitive damages.

Attorneys Fees and Costs : The FCRA also allows for the recovery of attorneys fees and court costs if legal action becomes necessary.

4. Request for Deletion of Incorrect Accounts As a result of these violations, there are accounts associated with the incorrect name and address that do not belong to me. I am formally requesting that all accounts linked to the incorrect name and address be deleted from my credit report.

5. Previous Attempts to Resolve I have reached out to the credit reporting agenciesEquifax, XXXX, and XXXXon multiple occasions to address these errors. Unfortunately, I have not received any responses or confirmation that these issues have been addressed. The lack of response is not only frustrating but also constitutes further non-compliance with federal law.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Recently, I did an investigation on my credit report and found several items on there to be inaccurate. 

Under 15 U.S Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report. It shall follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.

15 U.S. Code 1691i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information as appropriate, based on the results of the investigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to bring to your attention certain inaccuracies on my credit report and to formally notify XXXX of potential legal violations that require immediate attention. 

Identification of Inaccuracies : Upon reviewing my credit report, I have identified several inaccuracies that have adversely affected my financial standing. These inaccuracies include : incorrect balance, late payments, account number, credit limit, date of reported and others inconsistencies. 

Impact on My Financial Well-being : The inaccuracies outlined above have severely affected my creditworthiness and overall financial health. In XX/XX/XXXX, I experienced a major financial setback due to a family emergency, which led me to apply for a personal loan with XXXX XXXX  and other creditors offered loans with significantly high interest rates and I have been wrongfully denied which was highly embarrassing and has negatively impacted my lifestyle. This misinformation has had a detrimental impact on my financial options and opportunities. Would you reinvestigate the accounts listed below. 

Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Number : XXXX Reinvestigate the completeness of every piece of information and if its not accurate, please remove it from my credit report. 

Reference to Relevant Laws : I believe that these inaccuracies violate consumer protection laws, including but not limited to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). The FCRA mandates accurate reporting and stipulates that consumers have the right to dispute and correct inaccuracies on their credit reports. 
Based of consumer law 15 U.S. Code 1681i - Procedure in case of disputed accuracy, if within 30 days you can not verify the accuracy of the information, please remove the account from my credit report.

Request for Thorough Investigation : I kindly request that XXXX conducts a thorough investigation into the inaccuracies outlined above and takes immediate corrective action. I believe that rectifying these errors is crucial to maintaining the integrity of the credit reporting system and upholding consumer rights. 

Potential Legal Consequences : Please be advised that if these violations are not addressed promptly, I may be compelled to take legal action to protect my rights under the FCRA and other applicable laws.

Optionally with the proof I am attaching to this letter, you will agree it needs to be removed XXXX. 

I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and request that you keep me informed of the progress of your investigation. You may reach me at XXXX XXXX to discuss this further. 

Thank you for your understanding and cooperation. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX NY XXXX XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX SSN : XXXX

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom it may concern.. 

Company : AMERICAN CREDIT ACCEPTAN Account number : XXXX You are in Violation of furnishing my consumer reports to person/s that do not have any permissible purpose or any legitimate business reason to receive those reports which is a clear violation of my right to privacy. 

Under 15 U.S. Code 1681b - Permissible purposes you must receive written instructions from me to release my information to third parties such as ( XXXX, XXXX and XXXX ). 

I request that you send me proof of the letters I have sent in writing to you ( AMERICAN CREDIT ACCEPTAN ) authorizing my personal disclosure to third parties and authorizing the permissible purpose, it is my right as a consumer to receive written proof under the ( FCRA ) within 30 days of receipt of this letter as provided by law.

If the company AMERICAN CREDIT ACCEPTAN can not provide proof of my written authorization for permissible purposes under 15 U.S. Code 1681b within 30 days, the account must be immediately removed from my credit report XXXX, XXXX and XXXX. 

15 U.S. Code 6802 - Obligations with respect to disclosures of personal information ( b ) Opt out ( 1 ) In general A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless ( A ) such financial institution clearly and conspicuously discloses to theconsumer, in writing or in electronic form or other form permitted by the regulations prescribed under section 6804 of this title, that such information may be disclosed to such third party ; ( B ) the consumer is given the opportunity, before the time that such information is initially disclosed, to direct that such information not be disclosed to such third party ; and ( C ) the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumercan exercise that nondisclosure option.

I have never received or signed any document of American Credit Acceptan.

15 U.S.C 1681s-2 ( A ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 

My dealings were only with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, I never did business with AMERICAN CREDIT ACCEPTAN, they are reporting inaccurate, dubious and unverifiable information, I demand the immediate deletion of the account in XXXX, XXXX and XXXX. 

Show me written evidence that American Credit Acceptan complied with all these laws.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Information belongs to someone else
Consumer complaint narrative:
I did not consent to, authorize nor benefit from any of the following inquiries or account. Block and remove them NOW!! Please remove all fraudulent and inaccurate account information as I am unaware of this account due to the XXXX XXXX XXXX data breaches/identity theft. All is being investigated by the FTC & CFPB. According to FCRA 605B, this information should be blocked immediately until the investigation in complete. Since 4 business days from receipt of this information is allotted under Federal Law to block there entries, it should be understood that failure to do so within a 4 business days period after receiving this letter, constitutes reason to promptly delete the information form my credit file. Refer to : ( FCRA USC s 168li ( S ) ( A ) ). 

In addition, I am requesting Capital One to provide me & the CFPB with the following to show proof of said credit card account : Original or a copy of the original Credit Card Application as it relates to the inception of said credit card account with Capital One, N.A., along with detailed supporting documents to include the following : Date in which the Capital One credit card application was initiated by me. 
My name and address at time of application initiation Credit inquiry and credit score at time of application initiation My total household income at time of application initiation My employer and employment status at time of application initiation Approval status along with credit line total/limit issued at time of application initiation Records indicating/showing that all deposits made towards said credit card account with Capital One, N.A, were in fact direct payments made by me and from my bank account. 

Signed merchant receipts and surveillance evidence indicating that all transactions processed by said credit card account with Capital One, N.A., were in fact authorized and made directly by me.

Product: Student loan
Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Received bad information about your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
Prior to XX/XX/XXXX, I was pursued by SOFI who endorsed : " you will save more money if you refinance your loans through Sofi ''. Sofi encouraged me to look into their student loan calculator ( on their website ) and I began to complete research to see if Sofi would be a good refinance option for me. I entered in the information ( current federal loan borrower, interest rate, amount I owed ) and the calculator spit out a number ( that I never screenshotted for evidence, but remember ) was well over {$90000.00}. 

Prior to Sofi I was with XXXX XXXX and my loan amount was {$230000.00}. On XX/XX/XXXX, I signed an agreement for a 15 year loan term. I updated that loan term on XX/XX/XXXX to a 20 year loan term with a 6.299 % interest rate. 

Enclosed in attachments, you will find evidence of how to utilize Sofi 's Calculator in order to see if Refinancing with them is a good option. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, my attorney, XXXX XXXX, sent Sofi a demand letter asking for them to provide proof I would save money through the lifespan of my loan if I refinanced with them. 

Sofi was also asked to credit my account with the difference of what exceeds the account balance.

As you can see, in Sofi 's response, they did not address the questions being asked and provide evidence to the claims and promises stated as they pursued me They have chosen to state " XXXX signed the loan application and approval disclosure '', which I did. They also chose to state Sofi 's calculator is offered for " educational purposes to explore a potential loan application. '' Sofi has endorsed, in their respond letter to XXXX, " calculated payments and savings are only estimates. '' As a potential consumer in their product, this has been misleading because in XXXX when I filled out the calculator, it was calculated that I would be saving well over {$90000.00} otherwise I would have not left XXXX XXXX. 

In the enclosed screenshot, it is stated that I will be in a deficit of over $ XXXX with a 20 year loan. 

I have relied on SoFi to act in my interests in advising me about options to address my financial situation, including helping me when I experienced financial hardship or distress select a suitable alternative repayment plan. That reliance was reasonable in part because both SoFi and the U.S. Department of Education repeatedly encouraged me to rely on their servicer to help them in this way. As described above, in numerous instances, SoFi took unreasonable advantage of my reasonable reliance on SoFi to act in their interests. SoFi did not act in my interest because it steered me to a longer loan lifespan with increased monthly payments rather than adequately advising me about income-driven repayment plans that would have been financially beneficial to me or stay with XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit card
Sub-issue: Application denied
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing this letter to formally register a notice of dispute. It has come to my attention that frankly my securities have been stolen from your organization. I am XXXX XXXX XXXX and on XX/XX/XXXX I applied an application for a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX miles, listed for {$310000.00}. The dealership knew there was no cash involved in this transaction because the vehicle was being financed as a consumer credit transaction. 15 USC 1605 clearly states that the finance charge is the sum of ALL charges. I attempted to call your organization and was met with only resistance. I know my securities were accessed because of the inquiries on my consumer reports, I am deeply concerned about the failure of consideration in our transactions. Failure of consideration is a concept which relates to the law of contracts. In contract law, a party trades something of value ( My application ) in exchange for consideration ( My truck ). The term failure of consideration implies that the consideration, which was sufficient at the time of bargaining, has ceased to be sufficient. This could happen if the consideration offered becomes worthless or miniscule compared to the value of the contract, or if the party promising to furnish the consideration fails to do so. Furthermore, the definition Congress gave adverse action in 15 USC 1681a ( k ) never mentions a denial of credit, only for insurance or employment, neither of which I applied. The Federal Reserve Act is clear. Federal Reserve Act-Any Federal Reserve bank may make application to the local Federal Reserve agent for such amount of the Federal Reserve notes hereinbefore provided for as it may require. Such application shall be accompanied with a tender to the local Federal Reserve agent of collateral in amount equal to the sum of the Federal Reserve notes thus applied for and issued pursuant to such application. The collateral security thus offered shall be notes, drafts, bills of exchange, or acceptances acquired under section 10A, 10B, 13, or 13A of this Act, or bills of exchange endorsed by a member bank of any Federal Reserve district and purchased under the provisions of section 14 of this Act, or bankers ' acceptances purchased under the provisions of said section 14, or gold certificates, or Special Drawing Right certificates, or any obligations which are direct obligations of, or are fully guaranteed as to principal and interest by, the United States or any agency thereof, or assets that Federal Reserve banks may purchase or hold under section 14 of this Act or any other asset of a Federal reserve bank. In no event shall such collateral security be less than the amount of Federal Reserve notes applied for. The Federal Reserve agent shall each day notify the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System of all issues and withdrawals of Federal Reserve notes to and by the Federal Reserve bank to which he is accredited. The said Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System may at any time call upon a Federal Reserve bank for additional security to protect the Federal Reserve notes issued to it. Collateral shall not be required for Federal Reserve notes which are held in the vaults of, or are otherwise held by or on behalf of, Federal Reserve banks. Legal tender- Legal Tender also includes Federal Reserve notes as well as notes from Federal Reserve Banks and national banking associations for purposes of settling public and private debts, duties, dues, and taxes. Legal tender generally does not include personal checks, credit cards, or other general forms of noncash payments., the specific act of tendering the payment absolves the debt. '' The Bill of Exchange Act clearly says that the way to properly perform your bills are with interest. I know its not a common low people know, however I do. I have put in my application and attached my tender of payment with specific instructions for {$310000.00} plus any additional cost for warranties, insurance and delivery which is more than {$1.00}. 15 USC 1615. I have already stated that I am creditworthy. I understand that my current consumer report has some inaccurate and fraudulent accounts, however, I am rectifying all of my accounts and holding everyone accountable. I have read The Federal Reserve Act multiple times, but I have not come across the passage that calls a XXXX score into a consumer credit transaction, but I did read where congress calls consumer reporting agencies elaborate mechanisms. I understand that in a consumer credit transaction, I am extending my credit to you, and its discrimination to deny me access to something I applied for in good faith. I know that each consumer has an open ended credit plan, which is another reason I know I should be approved in this situation. I will preform all of my accounts, including this one, monthly for as long as the contract stays active. One of my inalienable right is the right to choose. I choose the best option for me and my family, and no one gets to take that away. This is my version of Life, Liberty and the Pursuit of Happiness. I dont want any special treatment, just what already belongs to me. My original instructions stated to have my XXXX delivered no later than Monday XX/XX/XXXX. You are already in breach of the contract. I will be filing a case with the SEC, CFPB, XXXX XXXX XXXX, and FTC reports for every unauthorized use of my card. The CEO and CFO of your company and anyone else I feel needs to hear about this humongous error. I will be pursuing Section 29 of the Federal Reserve Act until I receive remedy. Civil Money Penalty ( d ) Maximum Amounts Of Penalties For Any Violation Described In Subsection ( c ). The maximum daily amount of any civil penalty which may be assessed pursuant to subsection ( c ) for any violation, practice, or breach described in such subsection is -- in the case of any person other than a member bank, an amount to not exceed {>= $1,000,000} ; and in the case of a member bank, an amount not to exceed the lesser of -- {>= $1,000,000} ; or 1 percent of the total assets of such member bank. 

such section ) and any such assessment shall be subject to the provisions of such section. Since I have applied my credit to this transaction on XX/XX/XXXX I have been deceived, lied to, mentally abused and discriminated against. My tender had specific instructions to have the automobile delivered no later than XX/XX/XXXX. Its now XX/XX/XXXX and no resolve has been made. It has now been 10 days since my application which has your total at XXXX XXXX dollars and counting. Not to mention the thousands you will have to pay in arbitration, and all my court fees on the back end. All I want is what is owed to the principal, a clean XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX keys and a full tank of premium gas or {$100000.00} in revolving credit. I have cited the law for you, and will remind you again that as a corporation, willful non compliance comes with many fines as well as possible prison time. 15 USC 1681n. I dont want to take this to arbitration or make this a lawsuit, but if my rights are going to continue to be violated I will. I have done my due diligence and now its time for you to do yours. Again all I want is what is owed to the principal, which is my XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX delivered to me with two ( 2 ) working keys and a full tank of premium gas as requested or {$100000.00} in revolving credit. I would like this matter handled yesterday, however from Monday XX/XX/XXXX, you have 5 days, Friday XX/XX/XXXX to have my property delivered or I will be forced to take my next steps. I trust that you will treat this matter with the gravity it deserves and that you will collaborate with me to resolve this issues promptly. 15 U.S. Code 1681s2 - Responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION 1 ) PROHIBITION ( A ) Reporting information with actual knowledge of errors A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 
Duty : a moral or legal obligation ; a responsibility Accurate : correct in all details ; exact. 
PROHIBITION : a law or regulation forbidding something As Defined by The IRS Even if you didn't receive a Form 1099-C, you must report canceled debt as gross income on your tax return. 

The IRS Clearly defines a charge off as Gross or Ordinary income, INCOME DOES NOT GET REPORTED ON THE CONSUMER REPORT which in fact makes your reporting of this account inaccurate! 


By Definition The IRS Clearly says a Cancelled debt or Charge off is Income. The reporting of this account as a debt is in accurate.

15 USC 1681 s-2 Says your company are a furnisher of information to a consumer reporting agency.

You ARE PROHIBITED BY LAW to furnish inaccurate information. I demand you to Cease and Desist the reporting of incorrect/ in accurate information immediately.

15 USC 1681 s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate You are hereby put on NOTICE that you are furnishing incorrect inaccurate information. 

The lender must file Form 1099-C and send you a copy if the amount of debt canceled is {$600.00} or more and the lender is a financial institution, credit union XXXX federal government agency, or other applicable entity as discussed earlier in chapter 1.

The above paragraph is taken directly from the IRS 2021 publication.

SEND ME MY FORM 1099-C that you should have sent when you Filled the account as a canceled debt.

My Address is listed below! 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION 1 ) PROHIBITION ( B ) Reporting information after notice and confirmation of errors A person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate ; and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate.

In conclusion I have shown you and you have been put on notice that you are reporting inaccurate information. The information is, in fact, inaccurate.

The continued reporting of this inaccurate information is a clear violation of the Law 15 USC 1681 s-2 of your responsibilities as a furnisher of information. 
You have caused me and my family severe harm due to your negligence and inaccurate reporting. This is a final opportunity to Cure and DELETE This Erroneous, inaccurate account from my Consumer report.

YOU HAVE 10 Calendar days to DELETE THIS ACOOUNT FROM MY CONSUMER REPORTS!

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to formally file a complaint against Capital One for its failure to adequately investigate my claims against the merchant XXXX XXXX XXXX for engaging in unscrupulous business practices. I believe Capital Ones reluctant inaction has directly contributed to the severe impact on my credit report an significant monetary lost. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I disputed multiple charges from XXXX  XXXX XXXX  on my Capital One credit card. I provided substantial evidence to support my claim that XXXX XXXX XXXX  engaged in fraudulent and deceptive business practices for each of the charges. I have since then mailed, emailed, called & fax Capitol Ones dispute team on countless occasions to seek assistance/ resolution in finding out what checks were made for the investigations into my claims and what feedbacks where provided by the merchant to have a dialogue to resolve the issues ; However Capitol One is reluctant to do any investigation because they seem to be concerned about the small cost they would bear for the investigations, instead of honor their obligations to protect the consumers from such fraudulent practices. 

The respective charges are {$130.00} on XX/XX/XXXX, {$290.00} on XX/XX/XXXX, {$290.00} on XX/XX/XXXX, {$84.00} on XX/XX/XXXX, {$260.00} on XX/XX/XXXX, {$490.00} on XX/XX/XXXX, {$440.00} on XX/XX/XXXX, {$130.00} on XX/XX/XXXX. 

Additionally I have reported difficulties contacting XXXX XXXX XXXX to resolve issues with Software, refunds, or general inquiries to Capitol One. This pattern of behavior suggests a deliberate attempt to avoid accountability and Keep my Money without justification. 

Other customers have complained of the exact same issue by XXXX XXXX XXXX, and I have shown my evidence along with these complains ; clearly outlined how the merchant manipulated its software to prematurely terminate services, forcing myself to repurchase their services. Additionally The merchant falsely advertised itself as a platform that allowed customers to become " XXXX XXXX '' by sharing in trading profits, on the contrary, XXXX XXXX XXXX actively manipulated the trading platform to minimize customer profits and increase customer losses through various deceptive tactics. These actions resulted in me losing significantly more money, damaging my credit and massive XXXX  ramifications on my XXXX. 

Despite providing compelling evidence, Capital One has failed to conduct a investigation into my claims. Their lack of action has allowed XXXX XXXX XXXX to continue to rob consumers of their hard-working money. This inaction is not only a significant violation of my consumer rights but also contributes to the ongoing fraudulent charges of XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

I am requesting that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate Capital One 's handling of my dispute and take appropriate action to hold them accountable for their failure to protect consumers from such predator actions.

Consumer complaint narrative: YOUR COMPLAINT I already submitted a complaint and it sounds like laws changed over the summer and the banks are now having to reimbuse some customers. Complaint number XXXX It all started on XX/XX/XXXX when I called Wells fargo to dispute a charge for an item I never received. They told me the fraud dept would be calling me to ask me a few more questions. About 3hours later I received a text stating Wells fargo bank did you attempt a XXXX  transaction for {$3500.00} reply yes or no. I replied no so a got another text stating Wells Fargo Fraud dept due to the NO response A representative will be contacting you shortly. About 1hr 15min later I get a face time call from a number that is labeled XXXX he told me there were 4 pending {$3500.00} XXXX  payments to a XXXX XXXX XXXX I told him no and he said the only way to stop the pending XXXX  payments I would have to transfer money from my wells fargo bank account to XXXX and the to cancel the pending XXXX  payments. There were 8 transactions 4 online and 4 XXXX  payments. He then asked me to contact my sons to finish the process. He got about {$12000.00} from 4 of my accounts. I kept telling him this did not seem right that the money was getting pulled out of my bank account and he said that was normal because all the payments were still pending and it would be back in my account tomorrow. At the end of the call he made a comment about no need to contact them back today that there was nothing more I could do about it until tomorrow and he will call me no need to call them and when they got ahold of me tomorrow the money would be back in my acct tomorrow I told them I work all day and I am not waiting for them to get ahold of me to get my money back. The whole thing felt weird but the end of the call really felt weird. So I called wells fargo less than 5 minutes after hanging up with the scammer and was on the phone with Wells fargo for 3hrs trying to stop all the payments. WF said I called them in time that all the charges were still pending and the should be able to stop them. WF said it should take a week to hear something and get money back. I got a letter from WF stating the case was closed that I authorized payments. So I called WF and asked them how they could close a dispute without looking into it. They said it was escalated to the next level and they were still working on it and I should hear something in about a month. The scammer tried breaking into my XXXX  acct, my XXXX, and XXXX XXXX. I am still getting text messages from them acting like Wells Fargo fraud dept. I filed a police report yesterday XX/XX/XXXX which was pointless but I felt necessary. I called Wellsfargo again on XX/XX/XXXX and they said my dispute was never reopened or escalated and it was not their problem because the scammer told me what to do and I did it. Please help. This is our lifesavings and the only way we can afford to pay our mortgage. If you cant help me please let me know who can. I will do or try whatever it takes to get our money back. This has turned our whole world upside down that was all the savings we had. I am now working 60 plus hours to make up some of the money we lost. I just found out I have XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX and I will have to be out of work for a while. Wellsfargo never tried to help us get our money back they denied the claim almost from the beginning.I called Wellsfargo less than five minutes after I hung up with the fraud and the lady at Wellsfargo told me everything was still pending and they should be able to stop it. Then a week later I called back and they said they have no record of me talking to anyone and the claim was denied. I told them to find the recording of the phone call. They said there was no need that it was my fault for the missing money because I let the scammer into my account. The whole thing seemed weird and they knew this scam was going on and did NOTHING to help in anyway. I felt like they were in on it. They knew there were not financially responsible in anyway because they ridiculous laws that protect them and not us. Thank You

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a complaint against Capital One Bank USA Na, XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX for inaccurate reporting of a charged-off debt, violations of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), the Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ), the Privacy Act of 1974, and the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ). 


Capital One Bank USA Na has reported a charged-off debt to XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX on my credit report. This is in violation of the FDCPA, which states that when an account is more than 180 days past due, it must generally be charged off. Despite being charged off, Capital One Bank USA Na has failed to provide me with a 1099-C form, as required by IRS code 4681. 

Capital One Bank USA Na has violated the FCRA ( 15 US. .Code 1681s2 - Responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies ) by reporting inaccurate information to the credit bureaus. Specifically, they have reported the charged-off debt without having reasonable cause to believe that the information is accurate. This has severely affected my overall score and financial stability. 

Capital One Bank USA Na actions also violate the Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ) - 12 CFR 31.3 and the CFPA 's prohibition against unfair, deceptive, or abusive acts or practices. By continuing to report the charged-off account as a debt, Capital One Bank USA Na is engaging in deceptive conduct that harms consumers ( Me ). 

Furthermore, Capital One Bank USA Na has violated my rights under the Privacy Act of 1974. The Privacy Act of 1974, as amended, 5 U.S.C. 552a, establishes a code of fair information practices that governs the collection, maintenance, use, and dissemination of information about individuals that is maintained in systems of records by federal agencies. A system of records is a group of records under the control of an agency from which information is retrieved by the name of the individual or by some identifier assigned to the individual. The Privacy Act prohibits the disclosure of a record about an individual from a system of records absent the written consent of the individual, unless the disclosure is pursuant to one of twelve statutory exceptions. Capital One Bank USA Na improperly disclosed my personal information to credit reporting agencies, specifically XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX without my permission. 

Additionally, Capital One Bank USA Na has violated the GLBA ( 15 U.S.C. 6802, also known as section 502 ( b ) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ) by failing to provide me with a clear and conspicuous notice of their intent to share my nonpublic personal information with nonaffiliated third parties, such as XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX. This coincides with 16 CFR 313.7 ( Form of opt out notice to consumers ; opt out methods ) 16 CFR 313.10 ( Limits on disclosure of non-public personal information to nonaffiliated third parties ) and 248.124 ( Reasonable opportunity to opt out ). 

Supporting Documentation : Credit Reports to Show Lack of Unison and Accurate Reporting Opt Out Letter to Capital One Bank USA Na that was ignored FDCPA Documentation concerning charge-off statuses Requested Relief : I request that the CFPB investigate this matter and take appropriate action against Capital One Bank USA Na , XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX. I seek the removal of the inaccurate information from my credit report, as well as compensation deemed appropriate and upholding the law per violation committed.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Amazon/JPMorgan Chase ( `` JPMC '' ), I applied for a Amazon Visa card in which by not approving me when i have 100 % payment history and owe no debt to JPMC, not to mention I have a preliminary hearing tomorrow in an arbitration claim that one of the reasons was issue just as this one. I am done playing games and sick of being harmed. As soon as I seen JPMC was the bank that was behind the Amazon card I made sure I took screenshots because i predicted this would happen. I was buying a new phone and accessories in which i was going to get I believe it was like 40 % of my full purchase. Of course, JPMC sends me an identity theft report claiming thats why it was denied and not approved. Knowing, that I have already had to issue a default to JPMC for a reason similar and not providing me requested documentation which was abiding by the law. I am writing this regarding that Amazon credit card application which in my belief was an strategic action, thinking they can have an argument after denying me ( and yes, denied, i was not approved and I am attaching harm caused ) if they send me an Identity theft protection notice, reference number on the identity theft notice ( XXXX ). Knowing they had no reason what so ever to think identity theft. I have much more evidence in my XXXX arbitration claim that just strengthens my claim and this because of all the wrongdoing they keep doing and how it adds up there is no denying it. So, that application I submitted electronically on or around XX/XX/2024, which has been denied, trying to be masked by that Identity theft notice. From my application which was not approved, and me continuously being harmed, I am requesting the immediate return of any deposits or securities related to this application. 
As no specific information was provided regarding the amount of the deposit or the terms for its return at the time of the denial, I hereby request a full accounting and prompt refund of all such funds. This request is made pursuant to applicable laws, including the Electronic Fund Transfer Act ( 15 USC 1693 et seq. ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( 15 USC 1601 et seq. ), which govern such transactions. 
Please provide a detailed statement showing the total amount to be refunded, including any interest accrued. This will ensure the refund is complete and accurate. I expect this matter to be resolved promptly and request that the funds be returned within 10 business upon receipt of this complaint. 
Should there be any delay in processing this refund, I will take the legal actions that is needed. I will mention this at my arbitration preliminary hearing. Giving them notice of this issue as it will be an exhibit regardless. But, I am requesting for the immediate return of any deposit or securities held in relation to this application. Failure to address this request within the 10 days will compel me to make another claim to retrieve my funds. Even though I am beyond stressed and frustrated and sick of being violated. I do thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response and the satisfactory resolution of my request. 
Respectfully Submitted, XXXX

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I sent {$1.00} from my SOFI account, via a " pay a friend '' function, to my partner 's XXXX bank account. SOFI asked for an email address for the recipient so I entered her email address. She got an email that I had sent her money, she entered her account number and routing number. She promptly received the {$1.00} successfully in her account. Knowing that this {$1.00} transaction worked, we went ahead with a second transaction ; on XX/XX/XXXX, I sent her a second transaction of {$4900.00}. She entered the exact same account number and routing number. 

Here is where things get fishy. The amount is deducted from my account on XX/XX/XXXX but she never gets the money in her account. After waiting a few days, I call SOFI on XX/XX/XXXX and tell SOFI that my partner does not have the money in her account. I am told to be patient, even though the prior {$1.00} transaction arrived very quickly. They open a ticket and after the call, they send me an email ( XX/XX/XXXX ) : -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- - XXXX XXXX, Thank you for previously contacting SoFi. I am following up regarding your transaction research request ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ). 

At this time, you can provide trace number XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  to your external institution to help locate this missing transaction and have them reject the funds if needed/wanted. We do regret any inconvenience this may cause you but hope the information was helpful. Thank you, and have a wonderful rest of your day! 

This line of communication is now closed and new replies will not be received, but we truly value your SoFi XXXX. If you have any other questions or concerns, please contact us via chat or call XXXX. Our XXXX XXXX is available XXXX and can assist with future questions through our mobile app and website. 

Thank you, SoFi XXXX XXXX XXXX -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- - On XX/XX/XXXX, I receive an email from XXXX from SOFI, stating : Hi XXXX XXXX, I hope this message finds you well. We want to thank you for bringing your concerns to our attention. We understand the importance of locating the missing funds from an unreceived XXXX a XXXX transaction and are committed to resolving the issue as quickly and efficiently as possible. I understand providing the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX did not help in finding the funds so a dispute was filed on the transaction. As long as an investigation is not needed, you can expect a resolution in XXXX business days. If an investigation is needed, a resolution can take up to XXXX business days. Please keep an eye on your email inbox as that is how our back office team will be communicating updates to you about updates this dispute. 

Please rest assured that we are reviewing your complaint. Your patience and understanding during this process are greatly appreciated. 

Thank you for your understanding and cooperation. 



Kind regards, XXXX -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- - No updates happen. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I call SOFI again to tell them that my partner does not have the money in her XXXX account. SOFI issues another " investigation '' and opens a ticket. They say that all they can do is provide me the XXXX government trace ID # which is XXXX digits. SOFI says that it is out of their hands because the money has been sent. SOFI says it is XXXX " responsibility and that I should contact XXXX with the trace ID #. A few days pass by and still nothing. On XX/XX/XXXX, I call XXXX with my partner and we are told, by a supervisor, that the {$4900.00} is apparently sent to an account number ending in XXXX, which we do not recognize. My partner 's XXXX account number ends in XXXX. My partner reiterates that she is XXXX XXXX positive that she entered the right account and routing number ; the same account and routing number that she used to successfully receive the {$1.00} transaction on XX/XX/XXXX. After some time on the phone, they tell us that they can see that she entered the exact same account number and routing number for both of the transactions when she accepted the money transfer from me. The person on the phone says they will start a claim and at this point, we are given a XXXX trace #. The supervisor states that something is suspicious here and that this is not normal. We are told that it would take up to XXXX business days for a response and action to take place. On XX/XX/XXXX, my wife calls XXXX to check up and she is told that they are still investigating. The representative double checks the contact information and the best time of day to reach her once any updates/results are found. 

Today is XX/XX/XXXX. It has been now XXXX  days and my partner has not received a single communication from XXXX. The {$4900.00} is not in my partner 's XXXX account nor has it been returned to my SOFI account. 

Today, XX/XX/XXXX, she calls XXXX again and they say that they can not do anything and that the funds are " lost ''. 

After this, I decide to call SOFI. I speak to an account XXXX who tells me that they can not do anything because the money is out of their hands. He tells me that we have to go back to XXXX and talk to a supervisor. I state that we have done this. He states that he is sorry about this but that he can not help further. 

Together, we have spent countless hours with no result. We have been given the run around. We can provide screenshots of our account to show that the {$4900.00} transaction is not in my wife 's account and as of XX/XX/XXXX, it has been deducted from my SOFI account.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I was contacted by phone by individuals claiming to be Wells Fargo Bank employees with granular knowledge about my checking account. I was informed by said individuals that a {$XXXX} charge was attempting to be processed from my checking account. I tried to check my mobile banking application and could not log in, trying multiple times with my login information. I was told that was because of the attempt to withdraw funds from my account. I hung up and immediately called Wells Fargo to inform them that suspicious activity was going on, and to not authorize any transactions out of my accounts. Nonetheless, the {$XXXX} transaction was fraudulently approved by my bank that night, after I notified them in real time, as a result of my online banking account being compromised. Rather than stopping the fraudulent transaction, the bank honored it despite the suspicious nature of the charge and closed the claim without contacting me. I was told that I would receive resolution on my case number that I was given while on the phone with a Wells Fargo representative the night of the XXXX. Also, on the night of XX/XX/XXXX, I issued a fraud alert on XXXX and XXXX credit reporting agencies and requested that my credit file be locked, and to notify me of any further attempts to open accounts or move funds. On XX/XX/XXXX, the transaction was posted in my checking account transaction history as authorized on XX/XX/XXXX with the bank transaction number and last XXXX digits of my debit card number. In a letter dated XX/XX/XXXX, and received by me on XX/XX/XXXX, claim # XXXX, I was informed that the transaction was " authorized or that a processing error did not occur. Please consider your claim closed. '' On XX/XX/XXXX, I filed an FBI report for wire fraud. The same day, I called Wells Fargo bank to dispute the resolution of my claim and to try to obtain more information. As none was forthcoming, I asked them to reopen my claim and elevated the dispute with Wells Fargo 's Line of Business Executive Office for further review. I spoke with another representative at that point and was told that they would attempt to reopen the claim. I informed them that I expected to hear from them within XXXX hours. During this conversation with the elevated service representative, he said that they received authorization for the fraudulent transaction. I informed them that I did not receive any request for authorization via text, phone call, or email and I did not authorize any transactions. It would be apparent from my account history that I do not have, and would not make, large transactions of this nature and it is inconceivable that I did not receive a phone call or further attempts from Wells Fargo Bank to verify this suspicious transaction. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I received an email from XXXX simply stating that they would respond within 10 days, providing me with a new claim number XXXX. The next day, XX/XX/XXXX, I received a phone call from a Wells Fargo XXXX representative in response to the XXXX hour deadline I had demanded from them on XX/XX/XXXX. I was told only that they would continue to investigate and that once a transaction is processed, they can not undo it. I again reiterated that I did not authorize this transaction. She did not provide me with any further information despite my continued request for more information about why this happened in light of my notification in real time to prevent the fraudulent transaction from posting. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I called Wells Fargo bank with the new phone number and case number contained in the email I received on XX/XX/XXXX, mentioned above. Again, I requested more information and repeated that I had not authorized this fraudulent transaction, and had notified Wells Fargo immediately that fraud was being attempted. My own investigation in the pursuit of more information as to what courses of action to take indicates that my checking account was compromised via my debit card in my XXXX XXXX. The night of the fraudulent transaction, I removed my debit card from my XXXXXXXX XXXX while on the phone with Wells Fargo, as I was suspicious that was how my account was compromised. The Wells Fargo employee deflected to XXXX. When initially asked about the status of my case number and if there was any further information including a person to speak to on a direct phone line, he initially stated that the case was still pending assignment. Later, when pushed about the lack of action on the behalf of the bank, he suddenly stated that it had been assigned to another representative, whose full name he did not disclose with an extension number. This new representative would not be able to speak with me until at least Monday, XX/XX/XXXX. This is 6 days after receiving the email from their Line of XXXX XXXX XXXX that the issue would be looked into, starting the clock again on the 10 day time frame and delaying further action by me. The Wells Fargo employee kept arguing that the transaction was authorized, despite my continuing assertion backed up by factual evidence that it was not, and that their only course of action can begin after the fraudulent transaction goes through. The transaction was fraudulently authorized XX/XX/XXXX by Wells Fargo Bank despite the fact that I was on the phone with a Wells Fargo representative alerting them to fraudulent activity in real time. This makes it impossible for them to assert that this transaction was authorized by me, as I was on a recorded line the entire night asking them to stop the transaction, freeze my accounts, and send me a new debit card. I was told again to wait to hear from their XXXX during this call on XX/XX/XXXX. 

This transaction eliminated my entire life savings. This negligence and delay tactics on the part of Wells Fargo Bank have cost me considerable time, resources, and money in addition to the fraudulent {$XXXX} money transfer to persons unknown to me. The only difference is the card XXXX XXXX XXXX an email stating I would not have a payment due on my account because of an allegation of fraud. This has not been the case since I called to inquire about my card being replaced. 
XXXX XXXX I received an email stating my new card was sent out but never arrived. The number on the card still does not match the card I have noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. And according to the fair credit reporting act Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ).

And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In generallf, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. 

and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
FYI I sent 2 of this letter to this company and never has a response fro them To : MIDLAND CREDIT MANAGEMEN XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX, MI XXXX Re Acct # XXXX This letter is my second letter regarding the account listed above, which you claim is a collection that I have with your company. This is a formal notice that your claim is disputed. 
I am requesting validation, made pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act. Please note that I am requesting " VALIDATION that is competent evidence bearing my signature and or any type of ID showing that I have ( or ever had ) some contractual obligation to pay you. I am also requesting any type of document that proves your company has the authority to collect debts in my state. 
Please also be aware that any negative mark found on my credit reports ( including XXXX, XXXX and XXXX ) from your company or any company that you represent, for a debt that I don't owe, is a violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act FDCPA 807 [ 15 USC 1962e ] if you can not validate the debt, you must request that all credit reporting agencies delete the entry ASAP. 
Pending the outcome of my investigation of any evidence that you submit, you are instructed to take no action that could be detrimental to any of my credit reports. 
Failure to respond within 30 days of receipt of this certified letter will result in small claims legal action against your company at my local venue. I will be seeking up to {$10000.00} in damages for : 1. Defamation 2. Negligent Enablement of Identity Fraud 3. Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act and Fair Debt Collection Practices Act You will be required to appear in a court venue local to me, since you are clearly doing business in my area. 
For the purposes of 15 USC 1692 et seq, this Notice has the same effect as a dispute to the validity of the alleged debt and a dispute to the validity of your claims. 
Please Note : This notice is an attempt to correct your records, and any information received from you will be collected as evidence should any further action be necessary. 

Thank you in advance for your cooperation. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a complaint against NCB Management Services , Inc. ( NCB ), XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX for inaccurate reporting of a charged-off debt, violations of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), the Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ), the Privacy Act of 1974, and the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ).

NCB Management Services , Inc. ( NCB ) has reported a charged-off debt to XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX on my credit report. This is in violation of the FDCPA, which states that when an account is more than 180 days past due, it must generally be charged off. Despite being charged off, NCB Management Services , Inc. ( NCB ) has failed to provide me with a 1099-C form, as required by IRS code 4681. 

NCB Management Services , Inc. ( NCB ) has violated the FCRA ( 15 US. .Code 1681s2 - Responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies ) by reporting inaccurate information to the credit bureaus. Specifically, they have reported the charged-off debt without having reasonable cause to believe that the information is accurate. This has severely affected my overall score and financial stability.

NCB Management Services , Inc. ( NCB ) actions also violate the Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ) - 12 CFR 31.3 and the CFPA 's prohibition against unfair, deceptive, or abusive acts or practices. By continuing to report the charged-off account as a debt, NCB Management Services , Inc. ( NCB ) is engaging in deceptive conduct that harms consumers ( Me ).

Furthermore, NCB Management Services , Inc. ( NCB ) has violated my rights under the Privacy Act of 1974. The Privacy Act of 1974, as amended, 5 U.S.C. 552a, establishes a code of fair information practices that governs the collection, maintenance, use, and dissemination of information about individuals that is maintained in systems of records by federal agencies. A system of records is a group of records under the control of an agency from which information is retrieved by the name of the individual or by some identifier assigned to the individual. The Privacy Act prohibits the disclosure of a record about an individual from a system of records absent the written consent of the individual, unless the disclosure is pursuant to XXXX of XXXX statutory exceptions. NCB Management Services , Inc. ( NCB ) improperly disclosed my personal information to credit reporting agencies, specifically XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX without my permission. 

Additionally, NCB Management Services , Inc. ( NCB ) has violated the GLBA ( 15 U.S.C. 6802, also known as section 502 ( b ) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ) by failing to provide me with a clear and conspicuous notice of their intent to share my nonpublic personal information with nonaffiliated third parties, such as XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX. This coincides with 16 CFR 313.7 ( Form of opt out notice to consumers ; opt out methods ) 16 CFR 313.10 ( Limits on disclosure of non-public personal information to nonaffiliated third parties ) and 248.124 ( Reasonable opportunity to opt out ).

Supporting Documentation : Credit Reports to Show Lack of Unison and Accurate Reporting Opt Out Letter to NCB Management Services , Inc. ( NCB ) that was ignored FDCPA Documentation concerning charge-off statuses Requested Relief : I request that the CFPB investigate this matter and take appropriate action against NCB Management Services , Inc. ( NCB ) XXXX XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX. I seek the removal of the inaccurate information from my credit report, as well as compensation deemed appropriate and upholding the law per violation committed.

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive notice of right to dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I am writing to file a formal complaint against Portfolio Recovery Associates ( PRA ) for attempting to collect a debt from me in Wisconsin without being legally licensed to do so. Their actions have violated my rights under several federal and state consumer protection laws. 

Details of the Issue : XXXX. Unlicensed Debt Collection : PRA is not licensed to collect debt in the state of Wisconsin. According to Wisconsin state law, any entity engaged in debt collection must be licensed by the XX/XX/XXXXDepartment of Financial Institutions. PRA 's failure to obtain this license renders their collection efforts illegal under the Wisconsin Consumer Act ( Wis. Stat. 421.301 ( 9 ) and Wis. Stat. 427.104 ). 

XXXX. Violations of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) - 15 U.S.C. 1692 : PRA has engaged in practices that violate the FDCPA, including : 15 U.S.C. 1692e : Making false or misleading representations regarding their legal right to collect the debt.

15 U.S.C. 1692f : Using unfair practices by attempting to collect a debt without proper licensing.

15 U.S.C. 1692g : Failing to provide proper validation of the debt upon request. 

XXXX. Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) - 15 U.S.C. 1681 : PRA has provided inaccurate information to credit reporting agencies, damaging my credit report. They failed to : 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) : Ensure the accuracy of the information reported.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ) : Investigate and correct inaccuracies after I disputed the debt.

4. Violations of the Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ) - 12 U.S.C. 5531 : PRAs actions constitute unfair, deceptive, and abusive acts or practices ( UDAAPs ), violating the CFPA. The CFPBs prior actions against PRA, including significant penalties for similar practices, underscore their continued non-compliance with the law.

5. Violations of the Telephone Consumer Protection Act ( TCPA ) - 47 U.S.C. 227 : If PRA has used automated calls to contact me, they may also be in violation of the TCPA, which restricts the use of automated dialing systems and prerecorded messages.

I request that the CFPB take immediate action to investigate PRA 's illegal collection practices and enforce the necessary penalties.

Sub-issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
TO WHOM IT MAY CONCERNED THIS ACCOUNT IS INVOLVED IN A CIVIL LITGATION WHEN IT SHOULD BE GOING THRU ARBITRATION DUE TO AN ARBITRATION CLAUSE THAT MIDLAND CREDIT MANAGEMENT AND THE ORIGINAL HOLDE OF ACCOUNT HAVE. 

have not supplied proof under the doctrine of estoppel by silence, Engelhardt v Gravens ( Mo ) 281 SW 715 719. I may presume that no proof of the alleged debt, nor therefore any such debt in fact exists. 

XXXX. **Debt Collection and Validation Failure** Midland Credit Management has reported accounts on my credit reports without providing me with the necessary validation of the debt, as required by 15 U.S. Code 1692g. Specifically, I did not receive a notice of debt collection or validation of the debt. This failure to provide required documentation violates my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), which mandates that debt collectors must send a written notice within five days of their initial contact.

2. **Arbitration Clause and Legal Proceedings** The account in question was originally held with WebBank/Fingerhut and has since been transferred to Midland Credit Management. As per the legal precedent set in XXXX XXXX Midland Credit Management XXXX XXXX ( No. XXXX - Document XXXX ( XXXX XXXX ) ), Midland Credit Management holds the right, title, and interest to these accounts, including the right to enforce arbitration clauses. The arbitration clause, as outlined in their agreements, mandates binding arbitration for disputes. 

Despite this, Midland Credit Management is pursuing legal action against me in a civil court in XXXX. This is contrary to the arbitration clause stipulated in their agreements, which is meant to resolve disputes through arbitration rather than court proceedings. 

XXXX. **Consumer Rights and Arbitration Clauses** According to Midland Credit Managements arbitration clause : - Any dispute or claim related to the account must be resolved through binding arbitration rather than court proceedings. - The arbitration clause is designed to replace the right to a jury trial and restricts the resolution of disputes to individual cases rather than class actions. 

It appears that Midland Credit Management has not adhered to this arbitration provision, which significantly affects my legal rights. 

XXXX. *XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX* Under the principle of " volenti non fit injuria, '' which means " to one who is willing, no harm is done, '' I do not owe this debt, as I have not been provided with proper validation. Additionally, the pursuit of legal action in court contradicts the binding arbitration agreement that governs this account. 

In light of the above, I respectfully request that the CFPB investigate these issues and take appropriate action to ensure that Midland Credit Management complies with federal debt collection regulations and their own arbitration provisions. I also request that the CFPB assist in addressing the inaccuracies on my credit report resulting from Midland Credit Managements actions. 

Enclosed with this letter are copies of relevant documents, including my credit report showing the disputed accounts and any correspondence related to the debt collection efforts. Please let me know if additional information or documentation is required. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your assistance in resolving these issues. 

Sincerely, XXXX, XXXX Enclosures : Credit Report with Disputed Accounts Highlighted Midland Credit Management Arbitration Agreement page XXXX. 

Documentation Related to Legal Proceedings : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX PENNSYLVANIA XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX Terms Agreement-Arbitration pages XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Und

er 15 U.S. Code 1692, the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) aims to protect consumers from abusive debt collection practices, which can include invasions of privacy and actions that compromise an individual 's capacity to contract. The law acknowledges that abusive practices contribute to personal bankruptcies, marital instability, and job loss, thereby highlighting the need to safeguard consumer privacy and competence in contractual matters. When a creditor or debt collector communicates through consumer reports without consent, it can be considered an invasion of privacy. The FDCPA restricts debt collectors from using any false, deceptive, or misleading representations in connection with debt collection, which includes unauthorized use of consumer reports. By asserting your rights under this law, you can demand that such communications cease and that any damaging information be removed from your consumer report, thereby protecting your right to privacy and ensuring your competency to contract is not compromised.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I request a detailed description of the procedure used to determine that I have a contractual obligation from the date of account creation until the date of last activity. Please ensure this information is 100 % correct and accurate based on the total amount you claim I owe. Also provide me with the name, address, telephone number of each person who verified this alleged account that you have purchased or been assigned from the original creditor or account holder that vou are stating is your source for the inaccurate information that you claim is 100 % correct and accurate. Be sure to provide the name of the employee, the number that was called, their position in the company. 

I am sure you know that a printout of a bill or itemized document does not constitute verification according to FTC opinion letter from Attorney XXXX XXXX XXXX. I have attached the documents that were sent in response to my request. 
I require compliance with the terms and conditions of this letter within 30 days of your receipt, or a complete removal from my credit profile, in writing, of your claim.

After thoroughly reviewing 15 U.S.C. 1692g, I noticed multiple violations. As stipulated by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), any information reported to credit bureaus must be accurate, complete, and verifiable. And according to 15 USC 1681b, this company has not provided sufficient evidence demonstrating that there is a permissible purpose for the reporting of this debt according to my facts. 

I am requesting that you thoroughly reinvestigate this. Make sure that all relevant documents and information supporting the validity of this debt are available for examination in a timely manner. Specifically, I ask for verification of the original creditor, the amount owed, and any applicable contracts or agreements such as the debt agreement. Please also provide proof that this company is able to collect this debt on behalf of the original creditor or any other subsequent purchasers. 
I require compliance with the terms and conditions of this letter within 30 days of your receipt. If you can not comply, I demand a complete removal of your claim from my credit profile in writing. In the event of noncompliance, I reserve the right to file charges and/or complaints with the FTC, attorney general, and appropriate county, state, and federal authorities. I also reserve the right to take private civil action against this company to recover damages. 

Stop all collection efforts, including communications such as phone calls, texts, automated messages and reporting to credit reporting agencies and/ or third parties until this request is fulfilled. Reporting inaccurate information to the credit bureaus is fraud. 

This notice serves as my final attempt to urge your compliance with the laws under the FDCPA and FCRA. If deemed necessary, I will seek legal advice, which may result in federal or small claims court action to seek damages against your company for violations, including defamation and false claims.

Product: Credit card
Sub-issue: Privacy issues
Consumer complaint narrative:
To : Comenity Capital Bank XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, OH XXXX Subject : Dispute of Unauthorized Sharing of Financial Information under 15 U.S. Code 6802 Credit Card with account # XXXX To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute the unauthorized sharing of my personal financial information by Comenity Capital Bank as outlined under the provisions of 15 U.S. Code 6802, which mandates the protection of consumer financial information.

Upon reviewing my recent financial statements and communications, I have discovered that my personal financial information has been shared with third parties without my explicit consent. This is in direct violation of the aforementioned statute, which requires financial institutions to provide clear notice of their information-sharing practices and obtain consumer consent before sharing nonpublic personal information with non-affiliated third parties. 

As a consumer, I have the right to : XXXX. Receive clear, conspicuous, and accurate notices regarding the sharing of my personal financial information. 
XXXX. Opt-out of having my nonpublic personal information shared with non-affiliated third parties. 
XXXX. Have my financial information handled with strict confidentiality and security measures. 

I request that you immediately cease any further sharing of my personal financial information without my explicit consent and provide me with : XXXX. A detailed explanation of the information shared and the third parties with whom my information was shared.

2. Assurance that all necessary measures have been taken to prevent further unauthorized sharing of my information.

3. Copies of any notices or opt-out disclosures that were supposedly provided to me.

Furthermore, I expect that you will conduct a thorough investigation into this matter and take all necessary corrective actions to ensure compliance with 15 U.S. Code 6802. Please acknowledge receipt of this letter and provide a response within the time frame required by law. If you do not comply with my request within a period time of no more than 30 days, I will file a complaint with the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), which has the authority to bring a civil action in a U.S. district court and you will be exposed to a lawsuit. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this serious matter. I trust that you will handle this issue with the utmost urgency and respect for my privacy rights. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX RE : Formal Compliant Against Lakeview Mortgage Company NMLS ID XXXX To Whom It May Concern : This is a formal compliant against Lakeview Mortgage Servicer regarding an uncompleted loan assumption request. The mortgage company has been unresponsive since XX/XX/XXXX after numerous attempts to receive an answer this issue is unresolved. Their inability to complete the requested loan assumption has negatively impacted my ex-husband and his ability to borrow due to the liability still reporting on his credit. 

The situation : My Ex-Husband and myself owned our marital home jointly located at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX  XXXX, OK XXXX utilizing a VA loan which is serviced by Lakeview Mortgage. Upon the divorce settlement and then an additional incidental real estate settlement agreement that superseded the divorce decree, I was awarded the home and the mortgage associated with the property. According to our incidental property settlement agreement, I am required to assume the mortgage for the property. My ex-husband and myself completed the required paperwork and submitted it to the mortgage company on XX/XX/XXXX. At that time, we were told it would take 180 days from XX/XX/XXXX. Since this time the mortgage servicer has refused to accept our documentation to complete the loan assumption. The mortgage servicer has requested we amend our divorce decree which is not legally possible in the state of Oklahoma. What is legal in Oklahoma is completing an incidental property settlement agreement, of which we did and submitted to the mortgage servicer. However, they are refusing to accept the documentation even though the VA Underwriting guidelines state it is acceptable form of documentation of mortgage loan assumptions. The mortgage servicer has recommended I refinance the home at a cost and a much higher interest rate, which I see the mortgage servicer would profit from a refinance at a much higher rate than the current loan I have. My ex-husband and myself are both in agreement and would like this to be completed. Unfortunately, the mortgage servicer is refusing to comply and complete the loan assumption. I have called multiple times of which a several week period in XXXX of XXXX when the mortgage servicer didnt answer the phone. After trying several weeks in a row I finally was able to speak with someone who said their phone lines had been down. The representative also explained that I am unable to speak with someone over the phone regarding the assumption that I may only email. Unfortunately, this Lakeview mortgage servicer just opted to stop responding to me by email. Since I can not speak with someone via phone or email, filing a compliant with the CFPB is my last resort at attempting to comply with my ex-husband and myselfs legally binding agreement for me to assume this mortgage. Everything has been executed except for the compliance of the mortgage servicer with the legally binding contract. 

My ex-husband moved to Georgia in XXXX of XXXX to care for his terminally ill mother which is why I agreed to take the house post our divorce, leading us to draft the incidental property settlement agreement. My ex-husband has since purchased a home in Georgia where he resides today. I am the sole legal owner of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX  XXXX, OK XXXX since XX/XX/XXXX ( per the deed attached ). The only piece of business left unfinished from our divorce is this mortgage loan assumption. Again, this negatively impacts XXXX XXXX XXXX and his ability to borrower when this servicer refuses to remove this liability from his credit report. I am solely liable for this debt. XXXX XXXX XXXX and Myself would greatly appreciate if the mortgage servicer would do its job and complete the loan assumption request. We are very much looking forward to a resolution and quickly as taking 1 year and 4 months to complete this is ridiculous. 

Kind Regards, XXXX XXXX Under VA underwriting guidelines, I have the right to assume the mortgage removing the loan and liability from my ex-husband. The acceptable documentation to complete the loan assumption is outlined in the VA underwriting guidelines utilizing the last bullet point. A transfer resulting from a decree to dissolve a marriage, legal separation agreement, OR from a incidental property settlement agreement by which the spouse of the borrower becomes the sole owner of the property. VA Pamphlet 26-7, Revised Chapter 5 : How to Process VA Loans and Submit them to VA

Consumer complaint narrative:
NOTICE TO AGENT IS NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL NOTICE TO PRINCAL IS NOTICE TO AGENT You are furnishing inaccurate and incorrect information to the consumer reporting agencies. 
The reporting of such inaccurate information has caused severe damage to my character, my reputation, my general mode of living and my ability to obtain credit for personal and house purposes. 
You and your inaccurate reporting have damaged my livelihood. 

15 U.S. Code 1681s2 - Responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION 1 ) PROHIBITION ( A ) Reporting information with actual knowledge of errors A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 
Duty : a moral or legal obligation ; a responsibility XXXXccurate : correct in all details ; exact.

PROHIBITION : a law or regulation forbidding something As Defined by The IRS Even if you didn't receive a Form 1099-C, you must report canceled debt as gross income on your tax return.

The IRS Clearly defines a charge off as Gross or Ordinary income, INCOME DOES NOT GET REPORTED ON THE CONSUMER REPORT which in fact makes your reporting of this account inaccurate!

By Definition The IRS Clearly says a Cancelled debt or Charge off is Income. The reporting of this account as a debt is in accurate.

15 USC 1681 s-2 Says you XXXX company are a furnisher of information to a consumer reporting agency. 
You ARE PROHIBITED BY LAW to furnish inaccurate information. I demand you to Cease and Desist the reporting of incorrect/ in accurate information immediately. 
15 USC 1681 s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate You are hereby put on NOTICE that you are furnishing incorrect inaccurate information. 

The lender must file Form 1099-C and send you a copy if the amount of debt canceled is {$600.00} or more and the lender is a financial institution, credit union , federal government agency, or other applicable entity as discussed earlier in chapter 1.

The above paragraph is taken directly from the IRS 2021 publication.

SEND ME MY FORM 1099-C that you should have sent when you Filled the account as a canceled debt.

My Address is listed below! 


15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION 1 ) PROHIBITION ( B ) Reporting information after notice and confirmation of errors A person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate ; and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate. 

In conclusion I have shown you and you have been put on notice that you are reporting inaccurate information. The information is, in fact, inaccurate. 

The continued reporting of this inaccurate information is a clear violation of the Law 15 USC 1681 s-2 of your responsibilities as a furnisher of information.

You have caused me and my family severe harm due to your negligence and inaccurate reporting. This is a final opportunity to Cure and DELETE This Erroneous, inaccurate account from my Consumer report.

YOU HAVE 10 Calendar days to DELETE THIS ACOOUNT FROM MY CONSUMER REPORTS! 


XXXX XXXX
