I was XXXX  at the XXXX  reserve at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX at this time and received a text message fraud alert from Chase Bank. I checked my email and also had a fraud alert message. At XXXX XXXX  XX/XX/XXXX, I called the fraud line at Chase Bank to cancel my card. The representative asked if the card was lost and verified the surrounding purchases. Since I was XXXX, I wasn't able to verify that the card wasn't in my possession until XXXX. The representative canceled the card and submitted the claim. At XXXX XXXX, I made it back from my hike and realized that my card was not in my possession. Back tracking, I last had it in my possession at the XXXX on XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX around XXXX XXXX  XX/XX/XXXX. On Tuesday XX/XX/XXXX, I received a digital copy of a receipt from XXXX in the dollar amount of {$200.00}. This happened because my debit card was connected to my XXXX account. Anytime that debit card is used, XXXX provides a receipt of the purchase. The receipt showed that a {$200.00} gift card was purchased. It also showed that the PIN was bypassed by running the card as a credit sale. XXXX does not use tap to pay so the chip was inserted. On XX/XX/XXXX, I learned that Chase denied the fraud claim. I called to learn why and to appeal the decision. I was told they weren't able to confirm unauthorized use. On XX/XX/XXXX, I went to the Chase Bank Branch on XXXX XXXX in XXXX Idaho. The branch consultant said to fill out a police report and submit it to the Chase fraud claims department. I contacted the XXXX Police Department and completed a police report regarding the stolen debit card. This report was submitted on XX/XX/XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, Chase again denied the claim. When I called on XX/XX/XXXX, the claims department said the reason was too technical to explain. They also said they do not consider police reports as evidence. On XX/XX/XXXX, I also contacted the loss prevention team at the XXXX to obtain XXXX  camera evidence that I was not the purchaser but did not receive a response. I am providing all evidence, including location evidence that I was not at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX at XXXX XXXX  on XX/XX/XXXX. I did not authorize this purchase and do not have possession of the debit card that was stolen. I would like Chase to reverse their decision and return the {$200.00} in funds to my account.

Sub-issue: Didn't receive notice of right to dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
As of today XXXX XXXX XXXX. I herby declare i am unaware of this debt.

According to 15 U.S. Code 1692g - Validation of debts ( a ) Notice of debt ; contents Within five days after the initial communication with a consumer in connection with the collection of any debt, a debt collector shall, unless the following information is contained in the initial communication or the consumer has paid the debt, send the consumer a written notice containing ( 1 ) the amount of the debt ; ( 2 ) the name of the creditor to whom the debt is owed ; ( 3 ) a statement that unless the consumer, within thirty days after receipt of the notice, disputes the validity of the debt, or any portion thereof, the debt will be assumed to be valid by the debt collector ; ( 4 ) a statement that if the consumer notifies the debt collector in writing within the thirty-day period that the debt, or any portion thereof, is disputed, the debt collector will obtain verification of the debt or a copy of a judgment against the consumer and a copy of such verification or judgment will be mailed to the consumer by the debt collector ; and ( 5 ) a statement that, upon the consumers written request within the thirty-day period, the debt collector will provide the consumer with the name and address of the original creditor, if different from the current creditor. I did not have an opportunity. 



I did not recieve any letter or notification from this company within the 5 days of this account being opened. I did not have an opportunity to address the alleged debt prior to this company billing me for it and placing the account along with its experiences on my credit report. If in fact you believe you gave me proper notification, which would give you legal right to assume the debt belongs to me due to unresponsiveness, please send me the ORIGINAL DOCUMENT containing the CERTIFIED RECIPT WITH THE DATE, MY NAME AND SIGNATURE PROVING I RECIEVED IT AND WAS MADE AWARE WITHIN THE PROPER TIME FRAME. 



ALSO, according to 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( a ) ( 2 ) for Permissible purposes of consumer reports A consumer reporting agency may only furnish my information to a third party or affiliate company unless it is for a court case or In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. Please also furnish the ORIGINAL DOCUMENT OF WRITTEN INSTRUCTIONS THAT I GAVE YOUR COMPANY PERMISSION to report this ALLEGED DEBT to a third party without my consent and other affiliates with whom i have no business. THIS LETTER SHOULD ALSO HAVE MY SIGNATURE PROVING IT WAS ME AND I GAVE WRITTEN INSTRUCTION AND AUTHORIZATION TO DO SO. 



You have 30 days from the date of this notice and complaint through the CFPB to furnish the document of me giving your company written consent/instructions to furnish my information to others without my consent and to provide proof via green certified mail receipt, containing my signature, proving that i was made aware of this alleged debt within the 5 days of its inception.
Company: Rowland Avenue Management, Inc. A/KA Columbia Debt Recovery, LLC d/b/a Genesis

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account information incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to bring to your attention several violations of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) by the following entities : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  In accordance with the FCRA, specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681, I believe my rights have been infringed upon as follows : 1. Right to Privacy ( 15 U.S.C. 1681a ) : I am entitled to privacy regarding my credit information. However, I have reason to believe that the aforementioned entities have mishandled my personal information in violation of this provision. Despite my expectation of privacy, my credit information has been improperly handled or disclosed.

2. Failure to Obtain Written Instructions ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b, Section 604 ( a ) ( 2 ) ) : According to this section, a consumer reporting agency is prohibited from furnishing credit information without my written instructions. It has come to my attention that the aforementioned entities have reported information about my accounts without obtaining such instructions from me, thereby violating this section of the FCRA.

I am deeply concerned about these violations and the potential impact they may have on my financial standing and reputation. I request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this matter thoroughly and take appropriate action against the aforementioned entities to ensure compliance with the FCRA.

Enclosed with this letter, please find copies of relevant documentation supporting my claim, including credit reports, correspondence with the listed entities, and any other pertinent information.

I appreciate your attention to this matter and look forward to a prompt resolution. Should you require any further information or clarification, please do not hesitate to contact me at the above-listed contact information. 

Additionally, I request that the CFPB publish this complaint or the details of this case, ensuring that my sensitive information is redacted. 

Thank you for your assistance in protecting consumer rights under the FCRA. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, I formally requested that Equifax provide proof of my authorization for the inquiry listed on my credit report via the CFPB portal. In response, Equifax requested that I submit proper identification to proceed with the investigation, which I promptly provided. Despite this, on XX/XX/year>, I received a letter from Equifax claiming that the inquiry was valid because my information was allegedly used to obtain a mortgage. 

Let me be clear : I am not disputing the validity of the inquiry. I am disputing that this inquiry was fraudulent and unauthorized. I never granted permission or authorized anyone to make an inquiry regarding a mortgage on my behalf. To substantiate my claim, I subsequently provided Equifax with an FTC affidavit of fraud confirming that this inquiry was unauthorized. 

Equifax has blatantly violated my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and CFPB guidelines by failing to provide proofsuch as my signature or any documentationauthorizing this inquiry. They are now legally obligated to remove this unauthorized inquiry from my credit report immediately. 

This is a formal demand for the immediate removal of the fraudulent inquiry. Failure to comply will leave me with no option but to escalate this matter further, including pursuing legal action to enforce my rights under the law. I expect prompt confirmation of the removal of this inquiry from my credit report.

Product: Checking or savings account

Consumer complaint narrative: My current employer ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ) submitted my direct deposit on Friday morning, XX/XX/XXXX. While speaking to a Chime customer service representative, they stated that if the check was deposited before XXXX Friday ( XX/XX/XXXX ), I should then receive it by the end of the day Saturday ( XX/XX/XXXX ). It is currently Sunday, ( XX/XX/XXXX ) and I have yet to receive my direct deposit. Chime ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) posted publicly yesterday on XXXX that they were having issues with a third party company that processes payments, and then stated that Chime had received the data from the third-party for deposits from Friday and were processing them. But here we are Sunday still with no deposits and no clear answer on when the deposits from Friday will be deposited. I reached out to customer service on numerous occasions since the tweet, and they either refuse to acknowledge that they are having an issue, or claim that my employer has yet to deposit the money into my account ( which is a lie because every co-worker at my job that does not bank with Chime already received their direct deposit Saturday morning. At one point, one of Chime 's reps stated that my employer might of deposited my check last or late, which makes no sense whatsoever since the state of NJ issues our checks. Once I provided a screenshot of the tweet, they then admitted to having issues with a third party processing company. Not only are they lying to their customers, they are also withholding our money without a clear and proper response. I have no clue if and when I'll receive my direct deposit, and because of this I am now experiencing late fee 's on most of my bills ( since most of my bills fall during the beginning of the month ). I live paycheck to paycheck and this is making a huge negative impact each day I go without money in my account.This is completely unacceptable and I feel I should be compensated for the lack of effort by Chime.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
NOTICE TO AGENT IS NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL IS NOTICE TO AGENT XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally notify you of inaccuracies in the information you have furnished to the consumer reporting agencies, namely XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX XXXX The reporting of this inaccurate information has caused severe damage to my character, reputation, and general mode of living, as well as my ability to obtain credit for personal and housing purposes. Your inaccurate reporting has significantly harmed my livelihood. 
15 U.S. Code 1681s2 - Responsibilities of Furnishers of Information to Consumer Reporting Agencies ( a ) Duty of Furnishers of Information to Provide Accurate Information Prohibition ( A ) Reporting Information with Actual Knowledge of Errors As per 15 U.S.C. 1681s2, you are prohibited by law from furnishing any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if you know or have reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 
The IRS defines a charge-off as gross or ordinary income, which is not to be reported on a consumer report. This makes your reporting of this account inaccurate. The IRS clearly states that canceled debt or charge-offs are considered income. Therefore, reporting this account as a debt is inaccurate and a violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681s2, which states that as a furnisher of information to a consumer reporting agency, you are legally obligated to provide accurate information. 
You are hereby notified that you are furnishing incorrect and inaccurate information. 
IRS Requirement for Form 1099-C The IRS requires that a lender file Form 1099-C and send a copy to the borrower if the amount of debt canceled is {$600.00} or more, and the lender is a financial institution, credit union, federal government agency, or other applicable entity. As you have filed this account as a canceled debt, I demand that you send me my Form 1099-C, as required by law. 
Address for Correspondence : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX 15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( a ) Duty of Furnishers of Information to Provide Accurate Information Prohibition ( B ) Reporting Information After Notice and Confirmation of Errors A person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if : ( i ) The person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate ; and ( ii ) The information is, in fact, inaccurate. 
In conclusion, you have been put on notice that you are reporting inaccurate information. The information you have reported is, in fact, inaccurate. 
The continued reporting of this inaccurate information is a clear violation of 15 U.S.C.

1681s2, which outlines your responsibilities as a furnisher of information. Your negligence and inaccurate reporting have caused severe harm to me and my family. 
This letter serves as your final opportunity to correct this issue and delete the erroneous, inaccurate account from my consumer reports. 
You have 10 calendar days from the receipt of this notice to delete this account from my consumer reports. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX, GA XXXX

Product: Vehicle loan or lease
Sub-issue: Loan balance remaining after the vehicle is repossessed and sold
Consumer complaint narrative:
My vehicle was repossessed due to financial hardships I was going through at the time. I was in communication with Gm financial and it was depending on which employee would help you type basis. After missing 2 payments they had repossessed my vehicle with no after notices. In California, after a vehicle is repossessed, the lender or repossession agency must send the owner several notices : Notice of Seizure Within 48 hours of taking possession, the repossession agency must send a notice that includes the names, addresses, and phone numbers of the legal owner and the agency. The notice should also state that the agency is responsible for any damage to the vehicle during repossession. If the agency doesn't send this notice, the owner can sue them for repossession and storage fees. 
Inventory of Personal Effects Within 48 hours of taking possession, the repossession agency must send an inventory of all personal items found in the vehicle. 
Notice of Intent to Sell Vehicle Within 60 days of repossession and at least 15 days before the sale, the lender must send a notice that includes the following information : The car will be sold after 15 days from the date the notice was mailed or given The amount required to get the car back before the sale The reason why the full amount must be paid The owner 's rights regarding reinstating the loan or redeeming the vehicle Post-Sale Accounting After the sale, the creditor must provide the owner with an accounting that includes the sale price, how the funds were used, and any surplus or deficiency.

Product: Student loan

Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX, private student loans were taken out from Navient to attend XXXX XXXX XXXX University. At the time, I was XX/XX/XXXX years old and not fully aware of the long-term implications of these loans, particularly the variable interest rates attached to them. Despite my attempts to locate the original promissory note and other documentation, Navient has not provided these essential documents, leaving me uncertain if I am legally obligated to repay this debt. 

Additionally, I never received proper guidance or counseling from Navient or my school regarding the terms of the loans, the implications of the variable interest rates, or who actually owns the loans now ( as the current owner is listed as Navient Private Loan Trust, which I am unfamiliar with ). I am also unsure whether there was a co-signer on these loans, and my father, who might have been the co-signer, passed away four years ago. 

Given these circumstances, I believe these loans may have been issued under predatory lending practices, targeting me as a minor without providing adequate information or support. I have requested this information from Navient but have not received a response that resolves these concerns. 

Dates : Loans were disbursed on XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. 
I requested information and documentation from Navient on XX/XX/XXXX. 
My father passed away four years ago - XX/XX/XXXX.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year> I received notice from XXXX that my data had been taken by a unauthorized 3rd party. This letter is dated XX/XX/year>. They informed me that " some of your personal information may have been " effected '' by the incident. 
On Saturday XX/XX/year> at bout XXXX I received a phone call on my home phone that I did not answer. The caller ID noted Citi. Shortly after one of my cell phones received a call that I answered. The caller started by clearly asking me if I was ; and he had my full name ( first, middle initial, last name ). After I said yes he asked me was my last four numbers on my Social Security number, AND HE WAS RIGHT. He asked me did I still live in CA and in the correct city. This guy had me. He claimed he worked for Citi Bank and that someone was attempting to open an account in my name with my social security number. Note, the phone ID did indicate Citi Bank. BUT, it also notes it was a cell phone. I have the number for any follow up investigation you are going to do ( likely a burner but it is a start ). This becomes slick. The caller claims he will block the attempted effort to open the credit card account and that he will transfer me to the credit protection unit after he gives me a case number ( The number he gave me was Case ID # XXXX ). He puts me on hold for about 29 seconds ( there was background music ) and then a new guy comes on and confirms everything the first guy did ( included my last four SS numbers ). I could tell he was getting ready to ask me more personal information ( like my whole SS number ). Both of these callers were men with heavy XXXX accents. The first guy stated that the credit application was in XXXX XXXX Nevada. The second guy would state it was XXXX XXXX NEW YORK. That was when I knew they had a pretty good operation going. I terminated the call and called Citi Bank help number and reported the about. I was told they would never ask me the social security number but the last four numbers on my card. The real Citi Card employee noted that this was one of the best attempts to get my personal data she had heard. HEADS UXXXX. I then tried to report this ( and make a complaint ) to XXXX. What a joke. The number and email address they give in the XX/XX/year> letter doesn't work! You have to log into a 3rd party vendor ( XXXX ) to make a report and After attempting to log I got kicked out and told to call a number on MONDAY. I get a feeling this is a scam too. I will follow up on Monday and I really wany cfpb to follow up on this and I want everybody to be aware of this scam. If it was not for the XXXX XXXX New York and the heavy accents I would have stayed on the phone longer and maybe have given them more than they ALREADY KNEW.

Product: Mortgage
Sub-issue: Delays with the closing process
Consumer complaint narrative:
I called Veterans United in XX/XX/year> to discuss prequalification and the necessary steps to pursue buying a home. I discussed my case with a loan officer who determined that I initially qualified for a VA loan lower than I wanted for a home and discussed how to increase what I am eligible for. In XX/XX/year>, I contacted them again and with my partner 's income included received preapproval for a VA loan up to $ XXXX. I understand that my partner is a travel nurse and has a very complex case for loan inclusion. I proactively reached out and clarified exactly what was needed from us and Veterans United prior to us looking for homes. 

We found a house and our offer was accepted on XX/XX/XXXX with a closing date set for XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX weeks out. We notified Veterans United who began their process for loan approval. We were very responsive and provided all requested information same or next day throughout the approval process. They conducted an incredibly and frustratingly thorough approval process where we provided XXXX line items and XXXX different documents worth of information, most of which triggered further questions that required further revision and additional documents. While I understand the need for additional information and thoroughness to submit for a VA loan with a non-veteran additional person on the loan, they did not request the needed information in a timely manner and instead nearly every other night they would request XXXX to XXXX additional items of clarification that would then trigger them to request more in the next few days. 
They were so focused on completing the VA loan correctly that they did not concern themselves with the timeline or submit it for VA approval by XX/XX/XXXX, and did not notify me of the delay. They fixated on the loan details, dragged out the process, and ignored what effects this would have on me as a buyer. In essence, they were unable to do their job as a lender who had issued preapproval for a loan. 

I contacted Veterans United on XX/XX/XXXX to verify that we were approved for the loan and clear to close on the scheduled closing date of XX/XX/XXXX, and was told that despite us providing all of this information and doing it so responsively, they still needed more information before they could submit to the VA for approval which would take up to XXXX additional days. I had to reach out to them to find out that they needed at least until the end of the month to finish loan approval, and could not give me a specific date to change closing to. The job of a lender is to work with the buyer to achieve loan approval within the agreed timeframe, and to notify all parties to any changes or delays. They not only extended out their data gathering for over XXXX weeks, they did not inform me that they were not going to meet closing until I contacted them. I now have to pay to extend my current lease, provide additional funds requested by the sellers due to delay of closing, risk losing the home and earnest money that I paid, and go through the emotional and personal hardship that this has caused. They never got to the point where they submitted the file for VA approval. 

I'm a reasonable person and truly was diligent about providing all information needed when needed and followed up with them to ensure everything was set for the closing date. I even called and asked XXXX weeks prior to closing if we could bypass some requirements by decreasing my XXXX or other ideas to make the process more hassle free. I was told that the VA loan was the best way to go, no changes were needed by us, and we were nearly done with the process. I was misled, and after paying them to do the appraisal for the home, inspections and additions they said were required by the VA, and now additional costs of delay, I feel like I was paying money into a process that had no intention of getting me a loan. I called their escalation team and explained the situation. I was told that I was far enough along that the only thing they could do was to talk to my loan coordinator and officer about the lack of communication that caused the unexpected shock of not meeting the closing day. I had already discussed this with them and with no other recourse available to address these concerns, am now entering this complaint. 

I went with Veterans United instead of other lenders because of what I thought was their understanding of the VA loan. They do not understand how to coordinate VA loan requirements, by exceeding the closing date and not notifying myself or realtor risked both my earnest money amount and me losing the home, and with an extension now accrued extra costs to me. I truly hope that no other veteran ever has to go through this painful process with them.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative: Notice to agent is notice to principal notice to principal is notice to agent You [ XXXX, XXXX, XXXX replied that the alleged transaction you furnished as late was { accurate/ verified } but my previous dispute did not ask you for accuracy or validation. You { XXXX, XXXX, XXXX } reported an alleged transaction as Late. 15 U.S. Code 1666b - Timing of payments ( a ) TIME TO MAKE PAYMENTS A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. 15 USC 1681e ( b ) ( b ) ACCURACY OF REPORT Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates. I requested the information that you must have or possess by law in order for you to report a payment as late. This is being request pursuant rule 1002. In other words, to properly report information as verified, the furnisher must have sufficient evidence to support the conclusion that the information was true, and in doing this the conditions required by 15 USC 1666b must be met. You failed to provide the required requested information, you failed to proceed in accordance with the requires for a creditor to treat a payment as late and the evidence that must be sent to you to prove that this transaction was late. It has been over 30 days and you have not properly verify the information. Id. at 1303 ; see also Blacks Law Dictionary ( 11th ed. 2019 ) ( defining verify as [ t ] o prove to be true ; to confirm or establish the truth or truthfulness of ; to authenticate ). 15 U.S. Code 1681i - Procedure in case of disputed accuracy ( a ) REINVESTIGATIONS OF DISPUTED INFORMATION ( 1 ) REINVESTIGATION REQUIRED ( A ) In general Subject to subsection ( f ) and except as provided in subsection ( g ), if the completeness or accuracy of any item of information contained in a consumers file at a consumer reporting agency is disputed by the consumer and the consumer notifies the agency directly, or indirectly through a reseller, of such dispute, the agency shall, free of charge, conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to determine whether the disputed information is inaccurate and record the current status of the disputed information, or delete the item from the file in accordance with paragraph ( 5 ), before the end of the 30-day period beginning on the date on which the agency receives the notice of the dispute from the consumer or reseller. Importantly, a furnishers inability to conclusively determine that the disputed information is inaccurate does not mean that the furnisher is permitted to report back to the consumer reporting agency that its investigation verified the accuracy of that information. Instead, if the evidence available to the furnisher is insufficient to establish the truth or falsity of the disputed information, then, under the statutory framework, the furnisher must report that its investigation concluded that the disputed information can not be verified. Hinkle, 827 F.3d at 1304. So, for example, if a furnisher is unable to verify that a consumer missed a payment, then it may be appropriate for the furnisher to delete any mentions of the missed payment while continuing to report other information about the account. I am requesting pursuant 15 USC 1681i ( 6 ) NOTICE OF RESULTS OF REINVESTIGATION ( B ) Contents ( iii ) a notice that, if requested by the consumer, a description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information shall be provided to the consumer by the agency, including the business name and address of any furnisher of information contacted in connection with such information and the telephone number of such furnisher. when disputed information can not be verified is to delete that information. In particular, Section 1681i outlines consumer reporting agencies responsibilities in responding to consumers disputes and, like Section 1681s-2 ( b ), provides that when a disputed item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency must delete or modify it as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation. 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ). Section 1681i goes on to provide that, [ f ] ollowing any deletion of information which is found to be inaccurate or whose accuracy can no longer be verified, the consumer reporting agency must in some circumstances notify certain people who previously received a report with the now-deleted information. That provision thus contemplates that when information can no longer be verified, the proper response is to delet [ e ] it. See Hinkle, 827 F.3d at 1304 Delete the information you are Reporting as Late from account. XXXX XXXX _________________________________ Without Recourse UCC 1-308

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive notice of right to dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
As of today XX/XX/year>. I herby declare i am unaware of this debt. 



According to 15 U.S. Code 1692g - Validation of debts ( a ) Notice of debt ; contents Within five days after the initial communication with a consumer in connection with the collection of any debt, a debt collector shall, unless the following information is contained in the initial communication or the consumer has paid the debt, send the consumer a written notice containing ( XXXX ) the amount of the debt ; ( XXXX ) the name of the creditor to whom the debt is owed ; ( XXXX ) a statement that unless the consumer, within thirty days after receipt of the notice, disputes the validity of the debt, or any portion thereof, the debt will be assumed to be valid by the debt collector ; ( XXXX ) a statement that if the consumer notifies the debt collector in writing within the thirty-day period that the debt, or any portion thereof, is disputed, the debt collector will obtain verification of the debt or a copy of a judgment against the consumer and a copy of such verification or judgment will be mailed to the consumer by the debt collector ; and ( XXXX ) a statement that, upon the consumers written request within the thirty-day period, the debt collector will provide the consumer with the name and address of the original creditor, if different from the current creditor. I did not have an opportunity. 



I did not recieve any letter or notification from this company within the 5 days of this account being opened. I did not have an opportunity to address the alleged debt prior to this company billing me for it and placing the account along with its experiences on my credit report. If in fact you believe you gave me proper notification, which would give you legal right to assume the debt belongs to me due to unresponsiveness, please send me the ORIGINAL DOCUMENT containing the CERTIFIED RECIPT WITH THE DATE, MY NAME AND SIGNATURE PROVING I RECIEVED IT AND WAS MADE AWARE WITHIN THE PROPER TIME FRAME. 



ALSO, according to 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( a ) ( 2 ) for Permissible purposes of consumer reports A consumer reporting agency may only furnish my information to a third party or affiliate company unless it is for a court case or In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. Please also furnish the ORIGINAL DOCUMENT OF WRITTEN INSTRUCTIONS THAT I GAVE YOUR COMPANY PERMISSION to report this ALLEGED DEBT to a third party without my consent and other affiliates with whom i have no business. THIS LETTER SHOULD ALSO HAVE MY SIGNATURE PROVING IT WAS ME AND I GAVE WRITTEN INSTRUCTION AND AUTHORIZATION TO DO SO. 



You have 30 days from the date of this notice and complaint through the CFPB to furnish the document of me giving your company written consent/instructions to furnish my information to others without my consent and to provide proof via green certified mail receipt, containing my signature, proving that i was made aware of this alleged debt within the 5 days of its inception. 

Also please provide the Original Promissory note proving i owe this alleged debt and provide the original instrument of indebtness.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
DEPT OF EDUCATION/NELNET XXXX XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX are in violation of The Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act of 1974. FERPA, also known as the Buckley Amendment, is a federal law that protects the privacy of student education records. Key points of the law include : Ownership of Records : Students own their education records and have the right to inspect and review them. 
Consent for Disclosure : Schools generally can not disclose personally identifiable information ( PII ) from student records without written consent. it prohibits educational institutions from disclosing personally identifiable information in education records without the written consent of the student, or, if the student is a minor, the student 's parents. ( 20 U.S.C.S. 1232g ( b ) ) .Schools may disclose, without consent, " directory '' information such as a student 's name, address, telephone number, date and place of birth, honors and awards, and dates of attendance. Transaction history is prohibited under this law, which covers the amount of the educational loan and payment methods or deferment. Their actions constitute unauthorized and illegal reporting of my educational records, specifically the transaction history, to consumer reporting agencies. This action by DEPT OF EDUCATION/NELNET is a clear violation of the Family Education Rights and Privacy Act ( FERPA ) of 1974. The Family Education Rights and Privacy Act ( FERPA ) safeguards educational records, encompassing a wide array of information, including but not limited to grades, transcripts, disciplinary records, and personally identifiable information ( PII ) directly linked to a student. Transaction history pertinent to educational loans or financial matters, although not explicitly outlined in FERPA, falls squarely within the realm of protected information due to its direct association with the educational journey and financial status of the student. As custodians of these records, DEPT OF EDUCATION/NELNET is bound by FERPA regulations. However, they have egregiously disregarded these regulations by reporting transaction histories to consumer reporting agencies without obtaining my explicit consent, thereby breaching the privacy rights guaranteed under FERPA. Moreover, the Privacy Act of 1974 supplements FERPA by regulating the collection, use, and dissemination of personal information by federal agencies. This act establishes stringent measures to ensure confidentiality, accuracy, relevance, and proper use of personal information. DEPT OF EDUCATION/NELNET disclosure of my transaction history to consumer reporting agencies without my explicit consent constitutes a blatant violation not only of FERPA but also of the broader principles established under the Privacy Act of 1974. These actions compromise the confidentiality and privacy protections afforded to my educational records and personal information, resulting in tangible financial damages and emotional distress. Despite my attempts to rectify this matter directly with DEPT OF EDUCATION/NELNET , their failure to acknowledge or resolve the issue necessitates the intervention of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau .

DEPT OF EDUCATION/NELNET actions also violate the Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ) - 12 CFR 31.3 and the CFPA 's prohibition against unfair, deceptive, or abusive acts or practices. By continuing to report the transaction history of my educational affairs, DEPT OF EDUCATION/NELNET is engaging in deceptive conduct that harms consumers ( Me ).

Furthermore DEPT OF EDUCATION/NELNET has violated my rights under the Privacy Act of 1974. The Privacy Act of 1974, as amended, 5 U.S.C. 552a, establishes a code of fair information practices that governs the collection, maintenance, use, and dissemination of information about individuals that is maintained in systems of records by federal agencies. A system of records is a group of records under the control of an agency from which information is retrieved by the name of the individual or by some identifier assigned to the individual. The Privacy Act prohibits the disclosure of a record about an individual from a system of records absent the written consent of the individual, unless the disclosure is pursuant to one of twelve statutory exceptions. DEPT OF EDUCATION/NELNET improperly disclosed my personal information to credit reporting agencies, specifically XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX without my permission.

Additionally, DEPT OF EDUCATION/NELNET has violated the GLBA ( 15 U.S.C. 6802, also known as section 502 ( b ) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ) by failing to provide me with a clear and conspicuous notice of their intent to share my nonpublic personal information with nonaffiliated third parties, such as XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX. This coincides with 16 CFR 313.7 ( Form of opt out notice to consumers ; opt out methods ) 16 CFR 313.10 ( Limits on disclosure of non-public personal information to nonaffiliated third parties ) and 248.124 ( Reasonable opportunity to opt out ). 

Supporting Documentation : Credit Reports to Show Lack of Unison and Accurate Reporting Opt Out Letter to DEPT OF EDUCATION/NELNET that was ignored I request that the CFPB investigate this matter and take appropriate action against DEPT OF EDUCATION/NELNET XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, and XXXX. I seek the removal of the inaccurate information from my credit report, as well as compensation deemed appropriate and upholding the law per violation committed.

Consumer complaint narrative:
NOTICE OF DISPUTE XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XX/XX/XXXX ALLIANT CREDIT UNION XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX Re : Dispute of Alleged Late Payment Request for Verification DISCLAIMER : It is important to clarify that simply providing a record of when the payment was posted by your department does not suffice as proof that the payment was actually late. Such records only illustrate when your department processed the payment. 

To Whom It May Concern, This letter serves as a formal notice of dispute concerning the reported late payments associated with my account XXXX with ALLIANT CREDIT UNION. This dispute is brought according to my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq. ), specifically under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ), which requires the prompt investigation and correction of disputed information. 

My dispute is further supported by the legal precedent established in XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ), which emphasizes the necessity for creditors to maintain accurate, substantiated, and verifiable records when reporting to consumer reporting agencies. 

Accordingly, I hereby request that you provide the following specific documentation to substantiate your claim that the payment in question was late : Internal Records, Logs, or Notes and Interactions : Pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681m ( a ), please provide all internal records, logs, or notes and interactions that indicate the exact date and time the payment was received by your institution. 

Supporting Communication or Documentation : In accordance with 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), which mandates the accurate reporting of information, I request any communication or documentation that supports the assertion that the payment was received after the established due date. 

Relevant Policies or Procedures : As provided by 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 2 ), which requires furnishers of information to notify consumer reporting agencies of corrections to information that is found to be inaccurate, please supply any policies or procedures that were in place at the time, governing the handling of payments and the reporting of late payments. 

Please provide the requested documentation by XX/XX/XXXX, which falls within the legally required XXXXay period as stipulated under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). Failure to provide the necessary documentation may compel me to pursue further action, including filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and seeking legal remedies to ensure the accuracy of my credit report. 

Your prompt attention to this matter is not only expected but legally required under the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act. I look forward to your swift and thorough response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Company closed your account
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am unable to access the funds in my checking account. I first became aware of the problem on Monday XX/XX/XXXX when I was unable to login to my account online. I subsequently attempted to use my citicard at a Citibank atm to see my balances and got a screen advising me to call the bank. I called and was told my account had been " referred for closure ''. They were unable to give me any information about why. I was told they would send me a letter explaining their decision and I would receive a check in the mail for any money remaining in the account. I asked to speak to a manager and was told there is no one I could speak with who could tell me anything more - I would have to wait for the letter. It is now XX/XX/XXXX and I have NOT received any letter from Citibank. 
On XX/XX/XXXX I received a phone call from XXXX XXXX of Citibank who left a voicemail, saying he is my personal banker and asking me to call or stop by the XXXX XXXX XXXX. The following day, XX/XX/XXXX, I visited the XXXX XXXX branch. I asked for XXXX- he came and said hello and then passed me to XXXX XXXX. XXXX was unable to see any information about my accounts in the bank 's system. He called, after confirming my identity with my license and security questions, and spoke with the fraud division who told him nothing except that a letter had been sent to me explaining the situation. He informed them I had not received the letter. At my request, he asked if the letter could be emailed or faxed to me and was told no. He confirmed the address the letter was mailed to and asked them to resend it. 

I waited another week - still no letter. Still no explanation from Citibank about why this was happening. Still unable to access my account, unable to know if bill payments that I had setup online had been paid, wondering if my money was still in my account or if it had been stolen, or if had been a victim of identity theft. After bit of research on line, I filed a complaint with the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency. 

On XXXX, I went to my home branch, XXXX XXXX ( # XXXX ) at XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. I was first assisted by teller XXXX XXXX and then by Branch Manager, XXXX XXXX. Unlike the staff at the XXXX XXXX branch, they were able to see the activity on the accounts and the current balances so they were able to reassure me that the money was still in my account. I asked to close both my checking and savings accounts. They said the checking account was locked and could not be closed. However, there was no hold on the savings account. I closed the savings account and was given a bank check. The branch manager encouraged me to call again to see if they would explain the hold on my checking account. ( Note : unlike all of my other encounters with Citibank personnel, the branch staff delivered excellent customer service ; they were helpful and professional, expressing their regrets for the situation I found myself in and trying to reassure me that Citibank was probably acting to protect me. At the Branch Manager 's suggestion, I again called the Citibank Customer Service number while still at the branch. I spoke with XXXX, who told me there was a hold on the account but he could not see why. He gave me the number for the security division : XXXX ext XXXX. I called that number and was connected to XXXX, who told me that a decision had been made to close my account and end XXXX relationship with me. She could not tell me why but said I would receive a letter explaining the situation. I told her of the previous conversations with Citibank promising a letter but no letter had arrived. She said it could take from XXXX days. I pointed out that it had been more than 10 days since XX/XX/XXXX when the first letter had supposedly been sent. She informed me that since there was a note in the file from XX/XX/XXXX to resend the letter to the verified address '' and it had not yet been 10 days, she would not put in another request to resend the letter. I asked if the letter could be emailed or faxed to the branch and she said no. I asked her what she thought I should do if I dont receive the letter once it had been more than 10 days from XX/XX/XXXX. She said I could then call back and request that they again resend the letter. ( She did not seem to appreciate how absurd this was from my point of view. ) I asked her when I would receive the money that was in my checking account. She explained that Citibank had the right to terminate their relationship with me and they had up to 60 days to release the funds. She said I would be mailed a check for any funds remaining in my account at that time. I pointed out that it was hard for me to believe that I would be mailed a check since I had not yet received either letter that they said they had sent. She somewhat officiously repeated her script Citibank was within its rights to close my account and had XXXX days to return the funds to me and this was all in accordance with XXXX policy. 

I have had a checking account withe Citibank for more than XXXX  years. I remain unable to access the more than {$10000.00} in my account. Citibank 's only response has been to tell me to wait for a letter that has not yet come and then wait several more weeks to receive a check for the money that is in my account. I have little faith that Citibank will ever explain what they did or return my money to me. After a bit more research online, I decided to also file a complaint with CFPB to enlist your assistance in getting my funds released.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year> I received a number of flight confirmation emails from JetBlue about flights originating in XXXX XXXX to various places on the east coast. The flights were in my name, confirmations sent to my email address, using the information I had saved on JetBlues website. I did not book these flights. 
I IMMEDIATELY canceled all of the flights and changed my JetBlue password. I also placed a credit freeze on XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX. 
I found that the flights werent even booked on my credit card and after some digging saw that it was a Barclays Bank Delaware card that was opened in my name. ( I received an email that I had opened an account with them XXXX hours after I had already reported it to them and closed the account. ) I immediately called Barclays, relayed that it was fraud and they closed the account and opened an investigation. At that time they had told me there were no charges yet on the card. 
I reported the identity theft with the Federal Trade Commission. 
This credit card is not even listed on any of my credit reports. All three reporting agencies believe this is because of the speed with which I caught the fraud and canceled the account. The only mention of it is a regular inquiry through XXXX from Barclays on XX/XX/XXXX, when the fraudulent account was opened. 
Barclays Bank Delaware has denied that it is fraud on the basis of the flights being booked in my name. I appealed with a letter and a copy of my FTC report. 
To be clear, there is no phone number nor email to speak with anyone in the fraud investigations at Barclays. There is only a fax number and po box . 
I now have to pay the card balance totaling {$2000.00}, which I did not spend or my XXXXredit score will fall. 
This was fraud and identity theft. My California DMV account was also hacked. 
I am reporting Barclays Bank Delaware for XXXX ) terrible consumer services, XXXX ) allowing someone else to open a credit card in my name, XXXX ) not notifying me of the opening of the credit card for many hours, XXXX ) ignoring the fact that I took every correct action immediately and are still requiring me to pay them, and XXXX ) not making any conversation over the phone or email available. This all should be illegal of Barclays Bank Delaware.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, windows costing {$30000.00} ( including tax ) were purchased from the Home Depot located in XXXX, CA. I signed up for a 24-month, 0 % interest Home Depot consumer credit card through Citi Bank in purchasing these windows, putting {$20000.00} on the credit card. Due to high window costs, I was able to meet the promotion of 24-month, 0 % interest financing as advertised by Home Depot and qualified for the {$20000.00} balance charge on my credit card. Since the purchase, an automatic payment of {$1000.00} was set up each month to ensure the balance of {$20000.00} will be paid within less than 24 months. For the first month, {$200.00} additional payment was made as the automatic payment had not taken place right away. 

On XXXX XXXX, we noticed that there was a higher balance remaining than we anticipated, considering {$1000.00} payment had taken place each month. It turns out Citi Bank never honored this and defaulted the terms at 6 months, 0 % interest. We never agreed to 6 months, 0 % interest financing. They pulled a BAIT AND SWITCH. We called Home Depot after Citi Bank said there is nothing they can do, and the Home Depot manager did confirm the promotion and for the purchase period. The Home Depot manager tried calling Citi Bank but they told him they couldnt help because 60 days had passed. Keep in mind we originally agreed to 24 months, 0 % interest since day one and since day one, the payments have been on automatic withdraw. Home Depot manager stated he would even agree to be in a three-way call to confirm.

However, Citi Bank will NOT take any responsibility and play oh, you did not read the fine prints. We never agreed to those fine prints, we agreed to 24 months with 0 % interest and out of nowhere Citi Bank or Home Depot did a bait and switch. Problem is that Citi Bank and Home Depot will do anything to sell their business but change the contract without your consent or your knowledge. This is not only deceiving but this is fraud! If we knew the terms were 0 % interest at 6 months, we would have found other ways to purchase the windows but never apply for the Home Depot Citi credit card.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I opened an account with Bank of America XXXX  XXXX XXXX card on XX/XX/XXXX and received a card in the mail within a few weeks. I activated it and used it to charge {$3000.00} to cover the reward amount necessary to spend in first 90 days, by calling my timeshare company and paid my annual Maintenance Fees with the card. 

Within a few more weeks, I received a text notification that questioning whether I tried to use the card at XXXX XXXX. I explained I had not used it again since that XXXX charge not at XXXX XXXX nor anywhere else, and the card had never left my house, being safely store in a safe, only to be used on trips. 

They canceled the card immediately ( I cut it up and tossed the scraps away ) and they had a new card sent out and transferred everything about my account ( reward points, balance, history ) to the new card. I received a new card several weeks later and activated from my home phone. I then placed that card in the safe. 

Without it ever coming out of the safe, never being used anywhere- not online nor in person, not using the number or swiping the card, the same thing happened again with XXXX XXXX XXXX and I received a text asking me if the charges were mine. I spoke to BoA who said the best thing would be to speak with XXXX Fraud and they transferred me. The rep at XXXX said they have absolutely nothing to do with consumers and fraud and cant help me and that it has to be taken care with Bank of America and transferred me back. When the rep answered I asked to speak to a fraud Supervisor. He said the way they can stop it since it is only happening with XXXX XXXX is to put a stop on it Ito prevent any XXXX charges on the card since it was only happening with XXXX.. He also said that by creating a paper trail of fraud detection, it will be investigated by a higher level. THe assured me it would not happen again.I received yet another new card and activated it from my cell phone, and then put it away in the safe. You know by now I did not use it ever- not online, in person, nor over the phone! And yet, tonight I received yet another text informing me of XXXX declined charges at XXXX XXXX and XXXX at XXXX XXXX. At the post I am beyond frustrated as the Floor Supervisor I spoke to said there is nothing that they can do other that starting a fraud claim to refund the payment and that the card had already been cancelled and a new card will arrive soon. I pressed her to record in my account that she was saying she was the highest level this can go. That there is nothing else BofA can do. That she would expect it not to happen again, and if it does I should feel satisfied to know I wont be liable for fraudulent charges.I believe there could be an internal fraud happening at BofA, and that maybe there are lots of other s in a similar situation all being told not to worry. Meanwhile, who knows the information they might be accessing? Please help stop this nonsense so I can stop wasting my time and energy on this, and that I might actually be able to use the card and rewards if I ever have a card long enough for it to be useful.

Consumer complaint narrative: I have had an issue with XXXX about my background check since XXXX of XXXX. In XXXX of XXXX, I was charged with a crime against my abuser and an a XXXX  of XXXX  XXXX. The case was pending for XXXX Mos, during this time I lost XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. In XXXX finally, was dismissed. This had happened once previously, same charge yet I lost no access though did have a background report re run and submitted to each company during the pending status. Once my case was dismissed, I filed disputes with checkr for XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I obviously needed to dispute with XXXX eats as well but XXXX XXXX web site has no option to do so like it did the others. I reached out to them regarding this and notified them of changes in my report and I would need it re run and sent to XXXX eats. I noticed previously on their canidate portal that I also had an XXXX account but thought nothing of it and assumed it was related to my XXXX XXXX account. When reaching out via chat, as it is frustratingly their only communication option, I was alerted to identify theft by being asked if I was referring to my delivery or driver account. I said I do not have a driver account only delivery. They said I had a driver account which was associated with a location and an email and a phone number I did not recognize. They did not remove any of it though over the past few months I have requested many times. They don't seem concerned at all that they are incorrectly reporting or allowing identity theft. They have said they find it to be correct via email. Though, I don't even know what they are referring to when they say that and I do not think they do either. From XXXX to XXXX went by different last name and that is also the name the thief is using. Which caused XXXX to deactivate due to multiple accounts which is a violation of their terms and conditions. Even though I had reported the identity theft to them days prior. XXXX has also failed to assist in this matter and will not inform me the status of anything and continues to refer me to companies of which I have no relationship as they were created by the thief. They continue to send an automated response to contact other company. This had been incredibly frustrating as I continue to, via chat, explain myself to XXXX XXXX  and XXXX and am given the same automated responses. My income has been affected. I am being evicted and do not have anyone so I am terrified because I have kids. Both companies do not tell me of their response to identity theft or even acknowledge it has happened. I believe both companies keep no notes of correspondence. I figured fine, it is obviously computers doing all the approving. So I began requesting Checkr just re run my report and send it to XXXX eats but only XXXX eats and not XXXX as XXXX has tighter requirements and I would not be approved for an XXXX XXXX account. Also, reminding them that the XXXX rideshare account is identity theft and fraudulent and therefore not a request I even authorized. One of the many facts that are just completely jamming up their system and making my account look like total chaos and another total violation of the fcra on their part. They tell me, over many months, they will not send a report to XXXX eats because XXXX eats had not requested it and I should contact them. Contacting XXXX eats is equally as frustrating and they say to contact XXXX. I have in XXXX occasions been told by XXXX eats that there is a technical issue stopping it and it happens some times and that they are escalating to another department to have my report manually entered. Though, when I follow up about this it is as if they have no idea what I'm talking about but they do not attempt to understand. They do not aknowledge at all and tell me my deactivation sticks and to contact company that I have no relationship with regarding the fraudulent account. I of course can not a they are online only and I have no idea the numbers or emails or passwords or even city. It is interesting companies that exist to know who a person is is not able to deal with this or even understand that is an issue. The XXXX account background check obviously would be denied due to other charges I had from XXXX ish not just the recent pending charges that are now dismissed. However, applying to XXXX eats orginally in XXXX and being approved and delivering for them for 2 years, during which time many background reports were re run and sent to them without issue. Obviously, charges from XXXX where on my report at this time. It was never an issue. When the pending charges de activated all my accounts recently, though it has not previously, different county perhaps? Not sure because it was same charge only different county don't know why this time. In any event all others immediately re activated my account expect for XXXX eats. Contacting XXXX eats and them telling me to contact the companies of which I can not because it isn't mine and that account being opened during my deactivation leads me to believe it is the fraudulent account for XXXX rideshare that is messing me up. It even shows in the app that I am ready to go for XXXX eats. XXXX eats refuses to aknowledge the company they refer to had never sent me an email and that my rideshare account should be deleted completely and any background check related to it should be retracted on their end and deleted on checkrs  and other third parties end. XXXX eats has told me they submitted the request again to XXXX but that has proven to be false. Checkr continues to say they can't re run and send to XXXX eats and omit the fraudulent account. They also will not manually dispute XXXX eats, which I believe would solve this problem. XXXX, for all my gigs will not delete my statement that added to the dispute while my charge was pending. Which, for door dash and XXXX XXXX now that the charge is gone just hangs out on my report associated with and referring to absolutely nothing. Those reports are totally clear aside from my statement which now just makes me look crazy. I am beyond frustrated and suffering due to this. No one will listen or address these very serious matters. I believe it is mostly checkrs fault but XXXX has been unable to even acknowledge as well.

In XX/XX/XXXX, I disputed XXXX accounts with XXXX as they were never supposed to be sent to collections in the first place. I also never received a bill or notification by either XXXX XXXX or Wakefield and Associates, the last debt collector I am having issues with still.

I have no sure way of contacting XXXX and so far Wakefield and Associates have not provided proof that this is my debt or provided me current information to contact this creditor. I emailed them asking them to validate the debt and all contact information related to the original creditor. 

In XX/XX/XXXX, a XXXX XXXX  billing associate sent the insurance information I provided a second time to the XXXX  to Wakefield and Associates without my knowledge, I'm concerned that this could trash my credit for years, even though it was a medical billing error only. 

As a result of this adverse action taken on my credit report by Wakefield and Associates I've been denied a student loan. Even if it gets resolved, I will most likely have to find an alternate means to get a student loan. The worst case scenario is I won't be able to attend university this semester because of a medical billing error I did not make.

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Problem during payment process
Consumer complaint narrative:
It feels like a massive waste of time to have to write this complaint, but without doing so, nothing will get resolved. I opened this credit card, the card was never shipped to me. I had waited for several weeks and had to call in. From the start they were going to tell me it would take another week or two to receive it. I stated very clearly that it was already their fault I did not have it, I wanted to make a large purchase with said card. I had to speak to a supervisor to get a next day card. 

Fast forward to my first statement balance. The website would not allow me to add any payment information, I tried several times. I eventually had to call the customer support line and provide this information over the phone which I was not happy about. They paid my bill over the phone and i was under the impression they signed me up for auto bill pay. I have very strong credit, I enroll in auto pay for all my credit cards, mortgage, etc. 

Fast forward to last week while I was on vacation, I saw I was past due on a payment, no email was sent to me.. I went into the payments section to explore why a payment was not sent.. all my checking account information was gone from the website. I did not modify this on my own. It was just gone.

So not only did I not receive an email reminder ( paperless billing ), but my payment information was gone so I was unable to easily make a payment from my phone. I had to find a laptop, while on vacation, just to gather all the necessary information to post a payment of the full account balance.

Fast forward to today, I had to speak to an IVR and give 5 -6 voice prompts just to speak to someone. They gave me the general statement about a 1 time XXXX $ credit for late fee, assuming I pay my next balance in full, etc. I said I want the full XXXX credited because this is bank is a comedy of errors. 

Why does paperless billing not send me an email to alert about upcoming payment? 

Why is my payment information suddenly gone? 

Why doesn't the bank look into my support interaction to see the initial trouble I had with this bank and have empathy for a customer? 

This all feels like they are setting up customers to fail and have to suffer late fees. XXXX  XXXX XXXX, XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  are EXTREMELY easy to work with. Comenity has a frustrating user experience. 

I regret I have to write a review over XXXX $ but this is what it has come to.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account information incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative: We were approved for a " forbearance on a current account '' while we try to sell this home. We received a notification from all 3 credit bureaus that our Loan Depot balance increased from {$470000.00} to over {$470000.00}. I was extremely confused as there's no reason for our balance to increase while payments are paused. When I called the executive team at Loan Depot they confirmed that our balance has not increased, and our payments have simply been paused. They also confirmed that paused payments do not get added to the existing balance of the loan, they just get added to the life of the loan. She said she would inquire about how they reported it, but she said she only shows that it was reported as a forbearance, nothing more. I explained to her that all 3 credit bureaus are showing an " increased balance '' so it is more than likely not something that the credit agencies are doing and I asked if she could check into this again because something either isnt getting reported correctly, or is being left out. Our balance is the exact same as of today ( XX/XX/XXXX ). It hasn't changed or increased at all. Someone is reporting it to the credit agencies incorrectly and they are adding our paused payments as additional payments and causing a notification of an " increased balance '' instead of reporting them as paused payments. My husband and I both took a 60+ point hit on our credit scores because of this, resulting in damaged credit. We also confirmed with Loan Depot that there is no negative reporting to our credit as it is a forbearance on a current account, and we are also under a VA moratorium until XX/XX/XXXX regardless. So, the decrease in our scores was simply because of an increased balance, which makes zero sense. This needs to be fixed.

Product: Mortgage
Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue related to modification, forbearance, short sale, deed-in-lieu, bankruptcy, or foreclosure
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX & XXXX of 2023 we reached out to Flagstar as we were beginning to have financial hardships due to my Wife losing her job and my loss of hours due to a XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX and doctors appointments. We tried to get general information from them about our options and they would not provide any options or information unless we applied for Loss Mitigation, even though we were still current on our mortgage at the time. We explained that we were trying to be proactive, as to not have any late payments reported, but the representative said they can only assess options for us once we apply for the loss mitigation and that an application would only be considered IF we were delinquent. 
We applied in XXXX of 2023 when we didnt make our payment on the XXXX, and after about a month of back and forth with the company asking for additional documents, our application was officially complete on XX/XX/scrub> 2023. 
During this application period, we talked with a representative named XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX expressing our concerns about the late payments and we were assured that we would not be foreclosed on and that nothing had been reported to the credit bureaus about the late payment because we had applied for loss mitigation. 
On XX/XX/scrub> 2023, we called Flagstar because we still had not heard from them about our application. The representative XXXX let me know that they marked our application as complete and that it was in underwriting on XX/XX/scrub> 2023. We were assured once more that we were not in any threat of foreclosure but that we were reported to the credit bureaus as a 30 day late on XX/XX/scrub> 2023. 
We then received a letter from XXXX XXXX XXXX notifying us of pre-foreclosure. 
On XX/XX/year>2023 we called Flagstar about this notice and we spoke with representative XXXX and she assured us not to worry about it and disregard it because we were covered under the Loss Mitigation application. 
On XX/XX/scrub>, 2023, we called to get current on the mortgage payments, as we still did not have a resolution/recommendation from our Loss Mitigation application. We made the payment of {$5100.00} and were told that we were current. We then let the representative know that we did not need to proceed with the Loss Mitigation, as we decided we were going to list the home for sale and scale down with the changes in our income. 
On XX/XX/XXXX, Flagstar mailed the approval for FLEX MODIFICATION PLAN and we received the letter at the end of XX/XX/scrub> 2023.

We made one last mortgage payment on XX/XX/scrub>, 2023 and sold the home on XX/XX/year>. 
We moved out of state and my credit was hit with two 30 day lates AFTER we closed through escrow.

We are now trying to purchase our next home and can not because there are two 30 day lates and a 60 day late that is showing on our credit report.

In addition, I was the only person on this home loan with Flagstar, but they ran a hard credit inquiry on my wife ( without our knowledge ) during the loss mitigation review, significantly negatively affecting her credit.

Because of the loss mitigation representatives failure to provide accurate information to us regarding credit reporting, we are now without a home and potentially having to wait 24 full months before we can be considered for a home loan again. We both have credit scores in the mid-high XXXX even with these lates reporting.

We have applied for an internal review of the credit reporting and after their review, they denied us the deletion we requested.

We finally reached a supervisor with Flagstars credit reporting department after many lunch break phone calls and being placed on hold for 45 minutes to an hour, and he said theres nothing they can do about it, but we were welcome to submit a letter noting the dates of these conversations so they could review the calls and to also submit the letter directly to the credit bureaus.

Our late payments werent reported until a month after we sold the home, and 3 months after we got current on the mortgage. It feels like we were told very wrong information by multiple Flagstar loss mitigation representatives and are now paying the price. If they had been clear to us that they would be reporting late payments even during the loss mitigation, we would have borrowed money from family until the home sold to avoid taking hits on our credit.

Sub-issue: Application denied
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to file a complaint regarding a credit card application denial by American Express that I believe may involve discriminatory practices and a lack of equal consideration. 

On XX/XX/year>, I applied for the Blue Cash Everyday card from American Express. My application was denied, and I received an adverse action letter citing my XXXX score ( XXXX ) as the primary reason for the denial. 

I believe this denial may be discriminatory for the following reasons : 1. Religious Discrimination : As a XXXX, I operate with the belief of conducting business honorably and in good faith. I believe this religious principle may have been used against me in the credit decision process.

2. Lack of Equal Consideration : The adverse action letter does not provide sufficient information about how my application was evaluated beyond the XXXX score. I believe my entire financial profile and my commitment to honorable dealings were not given proper consideration. 

3. Potential Violation of the Equal Credit Opportunity Act ( ECOA ) : The ECOA prohibits discrimination in credit transactions based on religion, among other factors. I believe my application may not have been evaluated fairly and in compliance with this act.

4. Misleading Advertising : The credit card was advertised with certain terms, but the denial seems to contradict the implied accessibility of the product based on those advertised terms.

5. Lack of Transparency : The adverse action letter does not provide a clear explanation of how my religious beliefs and principles of honorable dealings were factored into the decision-making process. 

I request a thorough investigation into American Express 's credit application evaluation process to ensure compliance with anti-discrimination laws, particularly regarding religious beliefs and practices. 

Additionally, I ask for a review of American Express 's advertising practices to ensure they are not misleading consumers about the accessibility of their credit products. 

I appreciate your attention to this matter and look forward to your response.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
West Texas Central Collect ; As I have not heard back from you in over 60 days regarding my notice of dispute dated XX/XX/year>, and you have not supplied the demanded proof of the alleged debt, under the doctrine of estoppel by silence, I may presume that no proof of the alleged debt, nor therefore any such debt, in fact exists. 

In a good faith effort to resolve this matter amicably, I restate my demand for proof of the debt, specifically the alleged contract or other instrument bearing my signature, as well as proof of your authority in this matter. Absent such proof, you must terminate this collection action and correct any erroneous reports of this debt as mine. 

For the record, I state again that as I have no account with you, nor am I your customer, nor have I entered into a contract with you, I must ask for the following information : Please evidence your authorization under 15 usc 1692 ( e ) and 15 usc 1692 ( f ) in this alleged matter. 

What is your authorization of law for your collection of information? 

What is your authorization of law for your collection of this alleged debt? Please evidence your authorization to do business or operate in the state of Texas. Please evidence proof of the alleged debt, including specifically the alleged contract or other instrument bearing my signature. 

You have fifteen ( 15 ) days from receipt of this notice to respond. Your failure to respond, on point, in writing, hand signed, and in a timely manner, will work as a waiver to any and all of your claims in this matter, and will entitle me to presume that you sent your letter ( s ) in error, and that this matter is permanently closed. 

Your continued silence is unacceptable. Either provide the proof or correct the record to remove the invalid debt from my credit files with the three primary credit-reporting agencies. You are Failure to respond within 15 days of receipt of this registered letter will result in a small claims action against your company. I will be seeking {$5000.00} in damages for the following : Defamation, Negligent Enablement of Identity Fraud, and Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act. 

After obtaining the judgment against your company, I will obtain a Writ of Execution from the Sheriff 's office in your county and I will begin the process of attaching property or funds to satisfy the judgment. 

This Notice has the same effect as a dispute to the validity of the alleged debt and a dispute to the validity of your claims. This Notice is an attempt to correct your records, and any information received from you will be collected as evidence should any further action be necessary. This is a request for information only, and is not a statement, election, or waiver of status. 

Signature, XXXX XXXX
