Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Problem using a debit or ATM card
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX The basis of my complaint is that my Wells Fargo Bill Pay account was hacked when a Bill Pay category ( XXXX XXXX credit card ) was added to my Bill Pay account and {$1900.00} was taken from my account without my knowledge, consent, permission or authorization. Wells Fargo is denying my claim, does not believe my account was hacked and have concluded that after their research, theyve found that " the transaction was made through a secure online banking session by you ( me ) or someone who had your ( my ) authority and that no other processing errors occurred ''. This is not true. I do not, nor never had a XXXX XXXX credit card. 
It is my belief that Wells Fargo has conducted an incomplete investigation with a faulty conclusion. I further assert that Wells Fargo is not considering my signed affidavit stating that the transaction did occur without my knowledge or consent and that other circumstances surrounding this incident are not being considered. The events and other circumstances will be detailed below as succinctly as I can demonstrate. In fact, in talking with several Wells Fargo representatives about their research, no one was able to tell me what device they determined had been used, what time of day the transaction occurred, whos IP address was recorded and whether in their research anyone reached out to XXXX XXXX. 
On XX/XX/XXXX, a woman by the name of XXXX who identified herself as a Case Specialist with the Executive Office Complaint Department with Wells Fargo reached out to me, where previously no one had. At this time, I provided her all the details I could about the hack, and she said there would be further consideration, and shed get back to me within 10 business days or less. XXXX reached me on the morning of XX/XX/XXXX and informed me that they would still deny my claim. I was very angry and frustrated, and she continued to assert that in their research it was still determined that the transaction was made with my consent. Of note is that this woman was completely and utterly devoid of any empathy or concern, in itself disturbing. She offered little to no assistance. 
I asked her if they had contacted XXXX XXXX during their research and her response was essentially avoidant and she directed me to either contact XXXX XXXX myself or to call the Wells Fargo Claims department myself. I also asked what my next step was in my complaint, and she was not able to help me. When I called the claims department, the recording said I had an up to thirty-minute wait, so I hung up. 
I have now contacted XXXX XXXX and with the assistance of XXXX XXXX who faxed the requested information, they are conducting some research into this incident. This Im sure will still take several weeks. 
Finally, what I believe that Wells Fargo is not taking into account is the following : That on XX/XX/XXXX and on or about XX/XX/XXXX, my XXXX  credit card was hacked and my points stolen and then on XX/XX/XXXX, my XXXX  XXXX XXXX account was also hacked. I informed XXXX of all of these events. 
Ive never, to my knowledge possessed any kind of account with XXXX XXXX It seems that Wells Fargo has failed to recognize that it is possible for a hacker to make it appear that a transaction came through my device I live alone and have no children or ex-wives who might have access to my account information I have not given anyone any of my banking information Why would I have called Wells Fargo as soon as I saw on my Bill Pay account the first time the XXXX XXXX account was added? 
Why would I have called Wells Fargo the 2nd time I saw the XXXX XXXX card added the second time to stop the payment? 
Why did I receive a notification that a payee was added to my Bill Pay account the second time the XXXX XXXX account was added ( XX/XX/XXXX ) and not the first time ( XX/XX/XXXX )? I may have been able to prevent the debit from going through had I been notified. 
Why would I have gone through the trouble of changing the email accounts attached to my Wells Fargo account and my other financial accounts. 
Finally, why would I have gone through the trouble of changing my username and passwords on all of my financial accounts multiple times and the username and password for my email and Ive now signed up for a more secure email account and linked my accounts to this? 
There is more but Im afraid Ive already written too much. 
Respectfully, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Failure of consideration is a concept which relates to the law of contracts. In contract law, a party trades something of value ( My application ) in exchange for consideration ( My truck ). The term failure of consideration implies that the consideration, which was sufficient at the time of bargaining, has ceased to be sufficient. This could happen if the consideration offered becomes worthless or miniscule compared to the value of the contract, or if the party promising to furnish the consideration fails to do so. Furthermore, the definition Congress gave adverse action in 15 USC 1681a ( k ) never mentions a denial of credit, only for insurance or employment, neither of which I applied. The Federal Reserve Act is clear. Federal Reserve Act-Any Federal Reserve bank may make application to the local Federal Reserve agent for such amount of the Federal Reserve notes hereinbefore provided for as it may require. Such application shall be accompanied with a tender to the local Federal Reserve agent of collateral in amount equal to the sum of the Federal Reserve notes thus applied for and issued pursuant to such application. The collateral security thus offered shall be notes, drafts, bills of exchange, or acceptances acquired under section 10A, 10B, 13, or 13A of this Act, or bills of exchange endorsed by a member bank of any Federal Reserve district and purchased under the provisions of section 14 of this Act, or bankers ' acceptances purchased under the provisions of said section 14, or gold certificates, or Special Drawing Right certificates, or any obligations which are direct obligations of, or are fully guaranteed as to principal and interest by, the United States or any agency thereof, or assets that Federal Reserve banks may purchase or hold under section 14 of this Act or any other asset of a Federal reserve bank. In no event shall such collateral security be less than the amount of Federal Reserve notes applied for. The Federal Reserve agent shall each day notify the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System of all issues and withdrawals of Federal Reserve notes to and by the Federal Reserve bank to which he is accredited. The said Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System may at any time call upon a Federal Reserve bank for additional security to protect the Federal Reserve notes issued to it. Collateral shall not be required for Federal Reserve notes which are held in the vaults of, or are otherwise held by or on behalf of, Federal Reserve banks. Legal tender- Legal Tender also includes Federal Reserve notes as well as notes from Federal Reserve Banks and national banking associations for purposes of settling public and private debts, duties, dues, and taxes. Legal tender generally does not include personal checks, credit cards, or other general forms of noncash payments., the specific act of tendering the payment absolves the debt. Consumer complaint narrative:
I am a XXXX XXXX  employee. On XX/XX/XXXX, I enrolled in XXXX 's XXXX program through XXXX, the fXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX program. As part of XXXX XXXX 's program I can invest in an XXXX. The only option permitted by XXXX XXXX to manage and run the XXXX account is XXXX Bank, a division of Webster Bank XXXX. 

Up until this point, XXXX Bank has collected the money that I set aside for my XXXX savings, then allowed me to transfer the funds to either XXXX or XXXX  for my own management of the XXXX funds. XXXX offers no fees on management of an XXXX account, and users must only pay the fee of whatever wide variety of options of mutual funds or stocks they choose to invest in, and there are thousands of choices available for customers ( in most cases, very low fees close to 0.02 % for a mutual fund that tracks the XXXX & XXXX XXXX. ) However, on XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX 2024, I received an email from XXXX  Bank that stated that all customers must, starting from XX/XX/XXXX, invest their funds through an investment platform called " XXXX XXXX '' which charges a flat management fee between 0.1 % - 0.35 %, between 5x and 17x as much as the current management fees. Thus far, XXXX  Bank has not provided consumers with any information about what investment options will be available to them. Therefore, we are being forced to pay higher fees for completely unknown investment options. 

In addition, XXXX  Bank will no longer allow us to make changes within our XXXX accounts. I am only permitted to sell my holdings in XXXX and transfer the money back to XXXX  Bank if I want the money to remain invested. 

These changes are blatant profit-grab from XXXX  Bank that reduces consumer choice and control, and increases junk fees for what thus far appears to be worse options. This is blatantly anti-consumer behavior. As a XXXX  employee, I have no other choices for management of my XXXX.

Consumer complaint narrative: Discover Card closed case number XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, I immediately started getting BOMBARDED with very bizarre, very invasive and scary e-mails from a supposed loan company calling themselves XXXX XXXX XXXX. Their e-mails make a very deliberate effort to look like someone with my personal information is applying for a large loan, when Ive never even heard of this company. Their e-mails show the last four digits of my SSN, my birthday ( off by exactly one month ), and my mobile phone number. Every previous CFPB case Ive filed where Im just trying to understand where this company came from has ended up in an unresolved black hole. They have a website, but its just filled with placeholder information and a Staff page comprised of reused photos of people from other companies. Their e-mails come from multiple bank domains. CFPB kept forwarding my reports to the FTC, because apparently no one can verify what this XXXX XXXX company actually is. This is very, very exhausting and confusing. And for the past four months, while this XXXX mystery kept attacking me, Ive been going through another horrific experience with another creditor : XXXX XXXX and their crummy unethical legal representatives, XXXX XXXX XXXX. They casually violate consumer disclosure laws by refusing to answer my serious concerns about my XXXX account. They lied and said I stopped making payments to justify a brute-forced lawsuit against me last year. They MIGHT be related to some new identity theft problems Im having, but I'm not sure. They hired a dodgy local attorney named XXXX XXXX, who used some fake-friendship routine at the last minute to make sure I didnt even have a trial about any of this. And every now and then, XXXX XXXX  XXXX takes potshots at my stressful mental state to further treat me like garbage. I could sit here writing essays about how my accumulated family problems lead to my money problems. But let me try to put this into the most straightforward perspective : Ive already been legally toyed around with by backstabbing, childish family members RIGHT after my father died from XXXX in XXXX, and in every year since then. Ive already been legally and financially violated. Ive had every basic human right and every estate survivor right ripped away from me by demented family trolls playing Hide and Seek games in e-mails and social media. The primary reason I cant promptly pay off my debt right now is due to half-a-dozen unresolved legal arguments constantly being hidden in the dark. AND THEN lawyers like those from XXXX XXXX pop out in their clown car and start doing their horrendous consumer-rights-violating comedy routine. So, Im a little on-edge over the whole debt / creditor situation right now, to say the very least. BUT thats an entirely different case, with an entirely different creditor, and I HOPE I never wind up in a similar malicious relationship with Discover Card. Heres what I need to know from Discover Cards representatives : What the heck is XXXX XXXX XXXX? Why did they start their games on the same day you were writing your response CFPB case XXXX? Do you have ANYTHING you can tell me that can help me understand this?

I am filing this complaint to inform you that FMA Alliance has unlawfully reported an unauthorized inquiry on my XXXX consumer report. I have not given permission for FMA Alliance to access my consumer report, and there is no permissible purpose by law for this inquiry. I am a victim of identity theft. I have filed an identity theft report with my local police department and the FTC. ( see Evidence ) I have not initiated any transaction with FMA Alliance. Furthermore, I do not have an account as defined under 15 U.S.C. 1693a ( 2 ) with FMA Alliance for review or collection. I wrote to FMA Alliance on XX/XX/XXXX [ certified mail # XXXX ] and again on XX/XX/XXXX [ certified mail # XXXX ] to resolve this issue to no avail ( See Evidence ). I have requested the general or specific certifications pursuant to Rule 1002 required by 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( f ) ( 2 ) to establish permissible purpose and they have provided no such documentation.

Details of Violation : Date of Unauthorized Inquiry : XX/XX/XXXX Consumer Reporting Agency : XXXX ( 1 violation ) By obtaining my consumer report on the aforementioned date without any permissible purpose, FMA Alliance is in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), codified at 15 U.S.C 1681b ( a ) 3 ( f ) ( i ), 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( f ) ( 2 ), and15 U.S.C. 1681e ( a ). Therefore, FMA Alliance has committed 15 U.S.C. 1681q, which is tantamount to 18 U.S.C. 1028A. This statute invokes 15 U.S.C. 1681n ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ), and I am owed remedy per violation.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, I was shown an advertisement for the Citi / AAdvantage Platinum Select Card while booking a flight, implying that I could use the promotion for that same flight. I applied for and was approved for a Citi / AAdvantage Platinum Select Card with a credit limit of {$14000.00}. At the end of the application process, there was an option to get a temporary card number. I planned to use this credit card to purchase my XXXX XXXX flight. The promotion offered up to a {$250.00} statement credit on eligible XXXX XXXX purchases in the first 6 months of account opening, plus XXXX bonus miles after {$2000.00} in purchases within the first 3 months of account opening. 

The XXXX XXXX website timed out or I might have close out of the tab, so I had to re-enter all of my information. By the time I was ready to input the credit card information, I couldn't find the tab with the temporary credit card number. I attempted to log into my new Citi account, but it said I needed the CSV on the back of my credit card. Since I was approved the same day, I won't receive my physical credit card for 7-10 business days.

I called Citi and spoke to 5-6 different agents. I was ultimately told that there was nothing they could do to trigger the temporary credit card number again and that I would need to wait until my physical card arrived. 

I believe I was deceived because the advertisement suggested I could use the credit card for the specific flight at a certain price. Now, I'll need to wait 7-10 business days to book the flight, and the specific flight will very likely be at a different price.
